{"explanation": "Carbon is a chemical element with symbol C and atomic number 6, forming the basis of all known life and a vast number of compounds.", "urdu_meaning": "کاربن - ایک کیمیائی عنصر جو زندگی کی بنیاد ہے", "term_type": "element", "example_sentence": "Organic chemistry is the study of carbon-containing compounds.", "properties": {"symbol": "C", "atomic_number": 6, "category": "nonmetal", "state_room_temp": "solid", "common_uses": ["Basis of organic life", "Fuels (coal, oil, natural gas)", "Graphite (pencils, lubricants)", "Diamonds", "Nanomaterials (graphene, nanotubes)"]}}

{"explanation": "A carbon atom is an atom of the element carbon, typically having 6 protons, 6 neutrons, and 6 electrons, with 4 valence electrons allowing diverse bonding.", "urdu_meaning": "کاربن ایٹم - کاربن عنصر کا ایک ایٹم", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "A single carbon atom can form up to four covalent bonds with other atoms.", "properties": {"key_principle": "An atom of element carbon, fundamental to organic chemistry due to its bonding versatility.", "related_concepts": ["carbon (element)", "organic chemistry", "covalent bonding", "valence electrons", "isotopes (e.g., ¹²C, ¹⁴C)", "allotropes (diamond, graphite)"], "real_world_example": "The backbone of a glucose molecule (C₆H₁₂O₆) is made of six carbon atoms linked together."}}

{"explanation": "Carbon dioxide (CO₂) is a colorless gas composed of one carbon atom covalently bonded to two oxygen atoms, vital for photosynthesis and a key greenhouse gas.", "urdu_meaning": "کاربن ڈائی آکسائیڈ - ایک کاربن اور دو آکسیجن ایٹموں پر مشتمل گیس", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Plants absorb carbon dioxide from the atmosphere during photosynthesis.", "properties": {"formula": "CO₂", "molar_mass": "44.01 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "gas", "hazards": ["Asphyxiant in high concentrations", "Greenhouse gas", "Can form carbonic acid in water"]}}

{"explanation": "Cations are ions that have lost one or more electrons, resulting in a net positive charge.", "urdu_meaning": "کیٹائنز - مثبت چارج والے آئن", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Sodium (Na⁺) and calcium (Ca²⁺) ions are examples of cations.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Positively charged ions formed by losing electrons, typically from metal atoms.", "related_concepts": ["ions", "anions", "ionic bonding", "ionization energy", "metals", "electrolysis"], "real_world_example": "Sodium ions (Na⁺) are essential cations for nerve impulse transmission in animals."}}

{"explanation": "Chemical behavior describes how a substance interacts with other substances or responds to changes in energy or environment, determined by its atomic/molecular structure.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی طرز عمل - کسی مادے کا دیگر مادوں یا ماحول سے تعامل", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The chemical behavior of alkali metals includes vigorous reaction with water.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The characteristic ways a substance undergoes chemical changes or reactions.", "related_concepts": ["chemical properties", "reactivity", "chemical reactions", "electron configuration", "bonding", "periodicity"], "real_world_example": "Iron's chemical behavior includes rusting (oxidation) in the presence of moist air."}}

{"explanation": "Chemical bonding is the process or result of attractive forces holding atoms or ions together to form molecules, crystals, and other stable structures.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی بندھن - ایٹموں یا آئنوں کو جوڑنے والی قوتیں", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Covalent chemical bonding involves the sharing of electrons between atoms.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The interaction between atoms leading to the formation of stable chemical compounds.", "related_concepts": ["ionic bonds", "covalent bonds", "metallic bonds", "valence electrons", "electronegativity", "Lewis structures", "molecular geometry"], "real_world_example": "The strong chemical bonding in diamond contributes to its hardness."}}

{"explanation": "A chemical element is a pure substance consisting only of atoms that all have the same number of protons in their atomic nuclei.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی عنصر - ایک ہی قسم کے ایٹموں پر مشتمل خالص مادہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Oxygen is a chemical element essential for respiration.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A species of atom having the same number of protons in its atomic nuclei.", "related_concepts": ["atoms", "periodic table", "atomic number", "isotopes", "compounds", "pure substance"], "real_world_example": "Gold (Au) is a chemical element prized for its inertness and appearance."}}

{"explanation": "Chemical equations are symbolic representations of chemical reactions, showing reactants, products, and their stoichiometric relationships using chemical formulas.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی مساواتیں - کیمیائی تعاملات کا علامتی اظہار", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "A balanced chemical equation conserves mass and charge.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A shorthand that describes the changes occurring during a chemical reaction.", "related_concepts": ["chemical reactions", "reactants", "products", "stoichiometry", "balancing equations", "chemical formulas", "conservation of mass"], "real_world_example": "2H₂(g) + O₂(g) → 2H₂O(l) is the chemical equation for the formation of water."}}

{"explanation": "A chemical formula is a way of presenting information about the chemical proportions of atoms that constitute a particular chemical compound or molecule using chemical element symbols, numbers (subscripts), and other symbols.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی فارمولا - کسی مرکب میں ایٹموں کی نسبت کا علامتی اظہار", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The chemical formula for water is H₂O, indicating two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A concise notation representing the elemental composition of a substance.", "related_concepts": ["empirical formula", "molecular formula", "structural formula", "element symbols", "subscripts", "compounds", "molecules"], "real_world_example": "Glucose has a chemical formula of C₆H₁₂O₆."}}

{"explanation": "Chemical formulas are standardized notations using element symbols and subscripts to represent the composition of molecules and compounds.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی فارمولے - سالمات اور مرکبات کی ترکیب کا علامتی اظہار", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Chemists use various types of chemical formulas, such as empirical, molecular, and structural formulas, to describe substances.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Systematic representations of the elemental makeup of chemical substances.", "related_concepts": ["chemical formula (singular)", "empirical formula", "molecular formula", "structural formula", "compounds", "molecules", "stoichiometry"], "real_world_example": "Different chemical formulas like NaCl, H₂SO₄, and CH₄ represent salt, sulfuric acid, and methane respectively."}}

{"explanation": "Chemical reactions are processes that involve the rearrangement of atoms and molecules to form new substances with different properties.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی تعاملات - ایٹموں اور سالمات کی ترتیب نو سے نئے مادے بننے کا عمل", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Combustion is a type of chemical reaction that releases heat and light.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Transformation of one set of chemical substances (reactants) into another set (products).", "related_concepts": ["reactants", "products", "chemical equations", "stoichiometry", "activation energy", "reaction rate", "catalysis", "types of reactions (e.g., synthesis, decomposition)"], "real_world_example": "The rusting of iron is a slow chemical reaction between iron, oxygen, and water."}}

{"explanation": "Chloride ions (Cl⁻) are negatively charged ions formed when chlorine atoms gain an electron, commonly found in salts like sodium chloride.", "urdu_meaning": "کلورائیڈ آئنز - کلورین ایٹم سے بننے والے منفی آئن", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The presence of chloride ions is crucial for maintaining osmotic balance in bodily fluids.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A chlorine atom that has gained one electron, resulting in a -1 charge.", "related_concepts": ["anions", "ions", "halogens", "ionic compounds", "electrolytes", "sodium chloride"], "real_world_example": "Table salt (NaCl) dissolves in water to produce sodium ions (Na⁺) and chloride ions (Cl⁻)."}}

{"explanation": "A chemical compound is a substance formed from two or more different chemical elements that are chemically bonded together in a fixed ratio.", "urdu_meaning": "مرکب - دو یا زیادہ مختلف عناصر کے کیمیائی ملاپ سے بنا مادہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Water (H₂O) is a compound made of hydrogen and oxygen elements.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A substance with a constant composition formed by the chemical union of elements.", "related_concepts": ["elements", "molecules", "chemical bonds (ionic, covalent)", "chemical formula", "mixtures", "pure substance"], "real_world_example": "Sodium chloride (NaCl), or table salt, is an ionic compound."}}

{"explanation": "Compounds are chemical substances made up of atoms of two or more different elements chemically bonded together in fixed proportions.", "urdu_meaning": "مرکبات - مختلف عناصر کے ایٹموں کے کیمیائی طور پر جڑنے سے بننے والے مادے", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Organic compounds are primarily composed of carbon and hydrogen atoms.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Substances formed by the chemical combination of different elements, each with unique properties distinct from its constituent elements.", "related_concepts": ["compound (singular)", "elements", "chemical bonding", "chemical formulas", "molecules", "ionic compounds", "covalent compounds"], "real_world_example": "Water (H₂O), carbon dioxide (CO₂), and methane (CH₄) are all examples of common chemical compounds."}}

{"explanation": "Covalent compounds are chemical compounds formed by the sharing of electrons between atoms, resulting in covalent bonds, typically formed between nonmetal elements.", "urdu_meaning": "کوویلنٹ مرکبات - الیکٹرانوں کی شراکت سے بننے والے مرکبات", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Methane (CH₄) is a simple covalent compound where carbon shares electrons with four hydrogen atoms.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Compounds formed by covalent bonds, where atoms share electron pairs.", "related_concepts": ["covalent bonding", "molecules", "electronegativity", "polarity", "Lewis structures", "nonmetals", "molecular geometry"], "real_world_example": "Water (H₂O) is a polar covalent compound due to the unequal sharing of electrons between oxygen and hydrogen."}}

{"explanation": "CO₂ is the chemical formula for carbon dioxide, a gas composed of one carbon atom and two oxygen atoms.", "urdu_meaning": "سی او ٹو - کاربن ڈائی آکسائیڈ کا کیمیائی فارمولا", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "The concentration of CO₂ in the atmosphere is a major factor in climate change discussions.", "properties": {"formula": "CO₂", "molar_mass": "44.01 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "gas", "hazards": ["Asphyxiant in high concentrations", "Greenhouse gas", "Can form carbonic acid in water"]}}

{"explanation": "Crystals are solid materials in which atoms, molecules, or ions are arranged in a highly ordered, repeating pattern extending in all three spatial dimensions.", "urdu_meaning": "قلمیں / کرسٹلز - ٹھوس مادے جن میں ایٹم ایک منظم ترتیب میں ہوتے ہیں", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Salt and sugar commonly form crystals with distinct geometric shapes.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Solid matter with a periodic, ordered arrangement of constituent particles.", "related_concepts": ["crystal lattice", "unit cell", "amorphous solids", "crystallography", "ionic solids", "molecular solids", "metallic solids", "polymorphism"], "real_world_example": "Snowflakes are ice crystals, each with a unique hexagonal structure."}}

{"explanation": "C₆H₆ is the molecular formula for benzene, an aromatic hydrocarbon with a ring structure, widely used as an industrial solvent and precursor.", "urdu_meaning": "سی سکس ایچ سکس - بینزین کا سالمی فارمولا", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Benzene, C₆H₆, is known for its unique aromatic stability due to delocalized pi electrons.", "properties": {"formula": "C₆H₆", "molar_mass": "78.11 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "liquid", "hazards": ["Flammable", "Carcinogen", "Toxic", "Irritant"]}}

{"explanation": "Discrete molecules are individual, distinct units composed of two or more atoms held together by covalent bonds, existing as separate entities rather than part of a continuous lattice.", "urdu_meaning": "منفرد سالمات / علیحدہ مالیکیول - الگ الگ اکائیوں کے طور پر موجود سالمات", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Gases like oxygen (O₂) and carbon dioxide (CO₂) consist of discrete molecules.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Well-defined, separable units of covalently bonded atoms.", "related_concepts": ["molecules", "covalent compounds", "intermolecular forces", "gases", "liquids (some)", "molecular solids"], "real_world_example": "A sample of pure water is composed of many discrete H₂O molecules interacting through hydrogen bonds."}}

{"explanation": "Electrical neutrality is the state in which a substance or system has an equal number of positive and negative charges, resulting in no net electrical charge.", "urdu_meaning": "برقی تعدیل / برقی غیر جانبداری - مثبت اور منفی چارجز کی مساوی تعداد", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Atoms are electrically neutral because their protons and electrons balance each other's charges.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The condition of having a net electric charge of zero.", "related_concepts": ["charge conservation", "ions (cations, anions)", "atoms", "compounds (ionic and covalent)", "solutions", "plasma"], "real_world_example": "An ionic compound like NaCl is electrically neutral overall because the total charge of Na⁺ ions equals the total charge of Cl⁻ ions."}}

{"explanation": "Electronegativity is a measure of the tendency of an atom to attract a bonding pair of electrons towards itself when it forms a chemical bond.", "urdu_meaning": "برقی منفیت - کیمیائی بندھن میں الیکٹرانوں کو اپنی طرف کھینچنے کی صلاحیت", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "Fluorine has the highest electronegativity value, making it highly reactive in attracting electrons.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A chemical property describing an atom's ability to attract shared electrons in a covalent bond.", "related_concepts": ["chemical bonding", "polarity (polar covalent bonds)", "ionic bonds", "covalent bonds", "periodic trends", "dipole moment"], "real_world_example": "The difference in electronegativity between oxygen and hydrogen leads to the polarity of water molecules."}}

{"explanation": "Element formulas represent the form in which an element naturally exists or is commonly referred to, such as O₂ for oxygen or simply Fe for iron.", "urdu_meaning": "عنصری فارمولے - عناصر کی قدرتی یا عام حالت کی نمائندگی", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The element formula for diatomic gases like nitrogen is N₂, while for metals like copper it's Cu.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Notation showing the atomic composition of an element in its stable or common state.", "related_concepts": ["element symbols", "diatomic molecules", "allotropes", "chemical formulas", "monatomic elements"], "real_world_example": "Sulfur's element formula can be S₈, representing its stable crown-shaped molecular form."}}

{"explanation": "Element symbols are one- or two-letter abbreviations used in chemistry to represent chemical elements, typically derived from the element's name.", "urdu_meaning": "عنصری علامات - کیمیائی عناصر کی مختصر نمائندگی", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The element symbol 'H' stands for hydrogen, and 'He' stands for helium.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Standardized abbreviations for chemical elements used worldwide.", "related_concepts": ["periodic table", "chemical elements", "chemical formulas", "atomic number"], "real_world_example": "'Au' is the element symbol for gold, derived from its Latin name 'aurum'."}}

{"explanation": "Elements are pure chemical substances, each consisting of a single type of atom distinguished by its atomic number (the number of protons in its nucleus).", "urdu_meaning": "عناصر - ایک ہی قسم کے ایٹموں پر مشتمل خالص کیمیائی مادے", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The periodic table organizes all known chemical elements based on their properties.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Fundamental substances that cannot be broken down into simpler substances by ordinary chemical means.", "related_concepts": ["atoms", "periodic table", "atomic number", "compounds", "matter", "pure substances", "isotopes"], "real_world_example": "Hydrogen, carbon, oxygen, iron, and gold are all examples of elements."}}

{"explanation": "A formula unit is the simplest whole-number ratio of ions in an ionic compound, representing the smallest electrically neutral unit of that compound.", "urdu_meaning": "فارمولا اکائیاں - آئنی مرکب میں آئنوں کا سادہ ترین تناسب", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "For sodium chloride, the formula unit is NaCl, indicating one sodium ion for every chloride ion.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The empirical formula of an ionic compound; the smallest repeating unit in a crystal lattice of an ionic compound.", "related_concepts": ["ionic compounds", "empirical formula", "chemical formula", "crystal lattice", "ions (cations, anions)", "stoichiometry"], "real_world_example": "One formula unit of calcium fluoride is CaF₂, representing one Ca²⁺ ion and two F⁻ ions."}}

{"explanation": "In chemistry, formulas are concise symbolic representations of the composition of chemical substances, indicating the types and numbers of atoms present.", "urdu_meaning": "فارمولے - کیمیائی مادوں کی ترکیب کا علامتی اظہار", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Chemists rely on formulas like H₂O for water and C₆H₁₂O₆ for glucose to communicate molecular composition.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Symbolic expressions showing the constituent elements and their proportions in a substance.", "related_concepts": ["chemical formula", "empirical formula", "molecular formula", "structural formula", "element symbols", "subscripts"], "real_world_example": "The formulas for common acids include HCl (hydrochloric acid) and H₂SO₄ (sulfuric acid)."}}

{"explanation": "HCl is the chemical formula for hydrogen chloride, a colorless, corrosive gas that forms hydrochloric acid when dissolved in water.", "urdu_meaning": "ایچ سی ایل - ہائیڈروجن کلورائیڈ کا کیمیائی فارمولا", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Gaseous HCl is highly soluble in water, forming a strong acid.", "properties": {"formula": "HCl", "molar_mass": "36.46 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "gas", "hazards": ["Corrosive", "Toxic by inhalation", "Irritant", "Forms acidic solutions"]}}

{"explanation": "Helium (He) is a chemical element with atomic number 2, an inert noble gas that is the second lightest and second most abundant element in the observable universe.", "urdu_meaning": "ہیلیم - ایک کیمیائی عنصر، نجیب گیس", "term_type": "element", "example_sentence": "Helium is used to fill balloons and airships because it is lighter than air and non-flammable.", "properties": {"symbol": "He", "atomic_number": 2, "category": "nonmetal", "state_room_temp": "gas", "common_uses": ["Balloons and airships", "Cryogenics (coolant)", "Welding (shielding gas)", "Leak detection", "Breathing mixtures for deep-sea diving"]}}

{"explanation": "Hydrogen (H) is a chemical element with atomic number 1, the lightest and most abundant chemical substance in the universe, commonly existing as a diatomic gas (H₂).", "urdu_meaning": "ہائیڈروجن - ایک کیمیائی عنصر، کائنات میں سب سے ہلکا اور وافر", "term_type": "element", "example_sentence": "Hydrogen gas is highly flammable and is considered a clean fuel source as its combustion product is water.", "properties": {"symbol": "H", "atomic_number": 1, "category": "nonmetal", "state_room_temp": "gas", "common_uses": ["Production of ammonia", "Hydrogenation of fats and oils", "Rocket fuel", "Fuel cells", "Welding"]}}

{"explanation": "Hydrogen atoms are individual atoms of the element hydrogen, typically consisting of one proton and one electron (for the protium isotope).", "urdu_meaning": "ہائیڈروجن ایٹم - ہائیڈروجن عنصر کے انفرادی ایٹم", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "A molecule of water (H₂O) contains two hydrogen atoms covalently bonded to one oxygen atom.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The simplest type of atom, possessing one proton and usually one electron.", "related_concepts": ["hydrogen (element)", "isotopes (protium, deuterium, tritium)", "protons", "electrons", "covalent bonding", "acids"], "real_world_example": "The Sun's energy is produced by nuclear fusion of hydrogen atoms into helium."}}

{"explanation": "Hydrogen peroxide (H₂O₂) is a chemical compound of hydrogen and oxygen, known as a strong oxidizer and used as a disinfectant, bleach, and in rocket propulsion.", "urdu_meaning": "ہائیڈروجن پر آکسائیڈ - ہائیڈروجن اور آکسیجن کا ایک مرکب", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "A 3% solution of hydrogen peroxide is commonly used as a mild antiseptic.", "properties": {"formula": "H₂O₂", "molar_mass": "34.0147 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "liquid (often as aqueous solution)", "hazards": ["Strong oxidizer", "Corrosive (at high concentrations)", "Irritant", "Can decompose to form oxygen and water, potentially explosively"]}}

{"explanation": "H₂S is the chemical formula for hydrogen sulfide, a colorless, flammable, and highly toxic gas known for its characteristic rotten egg smell.", "urdu_meaning": "ایچ ٹو ایس - ہائیڈروجن سلفائیڈ کا کیمیائی فارمولا", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Hydrogen sulfide (H₂S) is naturally found in volcanic gases, natural gas, and some well waters.", "properties": {"formula": "H₂S", "molar_mass": "34.08 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "gas", "hazards": ["Highly toxic", "Flammable", "Irritant", "Corrosive to some metals"]}}

{"explanation": "Individual atoms are single, discrete units of a chemical element, as opposed to atoms bonded together in molecules or extended lattice structures.", "urdu_meaning": "انفرادی ایٹم - کیمیائی عنصر کی واحد، علیحدہ اکائیاں", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Scanning tunneling microscopy (STM) can be used to image and manipulate individual atoms on a surface.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The smallest particle of an element that retains the chemical identity of that element, considered separately.", "related_concepts": ["atoms", "molecules", "elements", "atomic theory", "quantum mechanics", "spectroscopy"], "real_world_example": "The study of reactions often considers the behavior of individual atoms colliding and interacting."}}

{"explanation": "Ionic compounds are chemical compounds composed of positively charged ions (cations) and negatively charged ions (anions) held together by electrostatic forces called ionic bonds.", "urdu_meaning": "آئنی مرکبات - مثبت اور منفی آئنوں کے درمیان برقی سکونی قوتوں سے بننے والے مرکبات", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Sodium chloride (NaCl), or table salt, is a common example of an ionic compound.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Compounds formed by the transfer of electrons between atoms, resulting in oppositely charged ions that attract each other.", "related_concepts": ["ionic bonding", "ions (cations, anions)", "formula units", "crystal lattice", "electrolytes", "metals", "nonmetals"], "real_world_example": "Many minerals, such as calcium carbonate (CaCO₃) in limestone, are ionic compounds."}}

{"explanation": "Ions are atoms or molecules that have gained or lost one or more electrons, resulting in a net positive or negative electrical charge.", "urdu_meaning": "آئنز - چارج شدہ ایٹم یا سالمات", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Electrolytes in sports drinks are essentially dissolved ions that help regulate bodily functions.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Charged species formed by the gain (anion) or loss (cation) of electrons.", "related_concepts": ["cations", "anions", "ionic bonding", "ionization", "electron transfer", "electrolytes", "plasma (state of matter)", "oxidation state"], "real_world_example": "When salt (NaCl) dissolves in water, it dissociates into Na⁺ and Cl⁻ ions."}}

{"explanation": "Isomers are molecules or polyatomic ions that have identical molecular formulas—that is, the same number of atoms of each element—but distinct arrangements of atoms in space.", "urdu_meaning": "آئسومرز / ہم ترکیب - ایک ہی سالمی فارمولا مگر مختلف ساختی ترتیب والے سالمات", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Butane and isobutane are isomers with the molecular formula C₄H₁₀ but different structural arrangements and properties.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Different compounds sharing the same molecular formula but having different structures and, therefore, different properties.", "related_concepts": ["molecular formula", "structural formula", "stereoisomers (e.g., enantiomers, diastereomers)", "constitutional (structural) isomers", "chirality", "organic chemistry"], "real_world_example": "Glucose and fructose are isomers (both C₆H₁₂O₆); glucose is an aldose sugar, while fructose is a ketose sugar, leading to different biochemical roles."}}

{"explanation": "Magnesium chloride (MgCl₂) is an ionic compound of magnesium and chlorine, used in medicine, as a de-icer, and as a source of magnesium.", "urdu_meaning": "میگنیشیم کلورائیڈ - میگنیشیم اور کلورین کا آئنی مرکب", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Magnesium chloride is often extracted from brine or seawater.", "properties": {"formula": "MgCl₂", "molar_mass": "95.211 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Irritant (especially to eyes and skin)", "Hygroscopic"]}}

{"explanation": "Methane (CH₄) is the simplest alkane, a hydrocarbon consisting of one carbon atom and four hydrogen atoms. It is a potent greenhouse gas and the main component of natural gas.", "urdu_meaning": "میتھین - ایک کاربن اور چار ہائیڈروجن ایٹموں پر مشتمل سادہ ترین الکین", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Methane is produced by anaerobic digestion by methanogenic bacteria.", "properties": {"formula": "CH₄", "molar_mass": "16.04 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "gas", "hazards": ["Highly flammable", "Asphyxiant in high concentrations", "Greenhouse gas"]}}

{"explanation": "The minimum ratio in chemistry usually refers to the empirical formula of a compound, which represents the simplest whole-number ratio of atoms of each element in the compound.", "urdu_meaning": "کم از کم تناسب - کسی مرکب میں عناصر کے ایٹموں کا سادہ ترین عددی تناسب (تجرباتی فارمولے میں)", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The minimum ratio of carbon to hydrogen in acetylene (C₂H₂) is 1:1, so its empirical formula is CH.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The simplest whole-number proportion of constituent elements in a chemical compound.", "related_concepts": ["empirical formula", "molecular formula", "stoichiometry", "percent composition", "law of definite proportions"], "real_world_example": "For glucose (C₆H₁₂O₆), the molecular formula shows a 6:12:6 ratio, but the minimum ratio (empirical formula) is CH₂O (1:2:1)."}}

{"explanation": "A molecular formula is a chemical formula that gives the actual number of atoms of each element present in one molecule of a specific compound.", "urdu_meaning": "سالمی فارمولا / مالیکیولر فارمولا - ایک سالمے میں ہر عنصر کے ایٹموں کی حقیقی تعداد", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The molecular formula for glucose is C₆H₁₂O₆, while its empirical formula is CH₂O.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Represents the exact number of atoms of each element in a single molecule.", "related_concepts": ["empirical formula", "chemical formula", "molecules", "covalent compounds", "stoichiometry", "molar mass"], "real_world_example": "Hydrogen peroxide has the molecular formula H₂O₂, indicating two hydrogen and two oxygen atoms per molecule."}}

{"explanation": "Molecules are electrically neutral groups of two or more atoms held together by chemical bonds (typically covalent bonds), acting as a single distinct unit.", "urdu_meaning": "سالمات / مالیکیول - کیمیائی بندھنوں سے جڑے دو یا زیادہ ایٹموں کے گروہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "A water molecule consists of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The smallest particle of a substance that retains the chemical and physical properties of that substance and is composed of two or more atoms.", "related_concepts": ["atoms", "covalent bonds", "compounds", "elements (e.g., O₂, N₂)", "discrete molecules", "intermolecular forces", "molecular geometry"], "real_world_example": "Oxygen gas in the air we breathe consists of O₂ molecules."}}

{"explanation": "Neon (Ne) is a chemical element with atomic number 10, an inert noble gas known for its use in bright reddish-orange advertising signs.", "urdu_meaning": "نیون - ایک کیمیائی عنصر، نجیب گیس", "term_type": "element", "example_sentence": "Neon gas emits a characteristic orange-red glow when an electric current is passed through it.", "properties": {"symbol": "Ne", "atomic_number": 10, "category": "nonmetal", "state_room_temp": "gas", "common_uses": ["Lighting (neon signs)", "Cryogenic refrigerant", "Lasers (He-Ne lasers)", "Television tubes", "High-voltage indicators"]}}

{"explanation": "Nitrogen (N) is a chemical element with atomic number 7, a nonmetal that constitutes about 78% of Earth's atmosphere as diatomic nitrogen gas (N₂).", "urdu_meaning": "نائٹروجن - ایک کیمیائی عنصر جو زمین کی فضا کا بڑا حصہ ہے", "term_type": "element", "example_sentence": "Nitrogen is essential for plant growth and is a key component of proteins and nucleic acids.", "properties": {"symbol": "N", "atomic_number": 7, "category": "nonmetal", "state_room_temp": "gas", "common_uses": ["Production of ammonia (for fertilizers)", "Inert atmosphere for chemical processes and food packaging", "Cryogenics (liquid nitrogen)", "Explosives", "Electronic components manufacturing"]}}

{"explanation": "Noble gases (Group 18 of the periodic table) are a group of chemical elements characterized by their very low chemical reactivity due to having a full valence electron shell.", "urdu_meaning": "نجیب گیسیں / نوبل گیسیں - بہت کم کیمیائی تعامل والی گیسوں کا گروہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Helium, neon, and argon are examples of noble gases used in lighting and welding.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Elements with complete valence electron shells, making them largely unreactive (inert).", "related_concepts": ["elements", "periodic table (Group 18)", "helium", "neon", "argon", "krypton", "xenon", "radon", "valence electrons", "octet rule", "inertness"], "real_world_example": "Argon, a noble gas, is used in incandescent light bulbs to prevent the filament from oxidizing."}}

{"explanation": "Numerical subscripts in chemical formulas are numbers written to the lower right of an element's symbol, indicating the number of atoms of that element in a molecule or formula unit.", "urdu_meaning": "عددی زیر نوشت / عددی سب اسکرپٹ - کیمیائی فارمولوں میں ایٹموں کی تعداد ظاہر کرنے والے اعداد", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "In the formula H₂O, the numerical subscript '2' indicates that there are two hydrogen atoms.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Notation conventions in chemical formulas to denote atom counts.", "related_concepts": ["chemical formula", "molecular formula", "empirical formula", "stoichiometry", "element symbols"], "real_world_example": "The numerical subscript '6' in C₆H₁₂O₆ (glucose) signifies six carbon atoms."}}

{"explanation": "Octane (C₈H₁₈) is an alkane hydrocarbon with eight carbon atoms, a major component of gasoline (petrol) known for its anti-knock properties.", "urdu_meaning": "آکٹین - آٹھ کاربن ایٹموں والا ہائیڈروکاربن، پیٹرول کا اہم جزو", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "The octane rating of gasoline indicates its resistance to premature ignition or knocking.", "properties": {"formula": "C₈H₁₈ (referring to isomers, n-octane being one)", "molar_mass": "114.23 g/mol (for n-octane)", "state_room_temp": "liquid", "hazards": ["Flammable", "Irritant", "Harmful if inhaled or swallowed", "Environmental pollutant"]}}

{"explanation": "Oxygen (O) is a chemical element with atomic number 8, a highly reactive nonmetal essential for respiration in most living organisms and for combustion.", "urdu_meaning": "آکسیجن - ایک کیمیائی عنصر جو سانس لینے اور جلنے کے لیے ضروری ہے", "term_type": "element", "example_sentence": "Plants release oxygen into the atmosphere as a byproduct of photosynthesis.", "properties": {"symbol": "O", "atomic_number": 8, "category": "nonmetal", "state_room_temp": "gas", "common_uses": ["Respiration (medical and life support)", "Combustion processes", "Steel production", "Water treatment", "Rocket propellant (oxidizer)"]}}

{"explanation": "An oxygen atom is an atom of the element oxygen, typically possessing 8 protons, 8 neutrons, and 8 electrons, with 6 valence electrons making it highly reactive.", "urdu_meaning": "آکسیجن ایٹم - آکسیجن عنصر کا ایک ایٹم", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "In a water molecule (H₂O), one oxygen atom is bonded to two hydrogen atoms.", "properties": {"key_principle": "An atom of element oxygen, characterized by its high electronegativity and ability to form strong bonds.", "related_concepts": ["oxygen (element)", "chemical bonding (covalent, ionic)", "oxidation", "oxides", "ozone (O₃)", "valence electrons"], "real_world_example": "The reactivity of an oxygen atom plays a crucial role in metabolic processes like cellular respiration."}}

{"explanation": "Oxygen gas (O₂) refers to the diatomic molecule of oxygen, which is the predominant form of elemental oxygen in Earth's atmosphere and is vital for aerobic respiration.", "urdu_meaning": "آکسیجن گیس - آکسیجن کی دو ایٹمی سالمی شکل (O₂)", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Humans and many other organisms require oxygen gas for breathing and energy production.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The stable diatomic form of elemental oxygen (O₂) under standard conditions.", "related_concepts": ["oxygen (element)", "diatomic molecules", "combustion", "respiration", "photosynthesis", "atmosphere"], "real_world_example": "Hospitals supply patients with oxygen gas for respiratory support."}}

{"explanation": "Ozone (O₃) is an allotrope of oxygen consisting of three oxygen atoms, known for forming the protective ozone layer in the stratosphere and as a pollutant at ground level.", "urdu_meaning": "اوزون - آکسیجن کی ایک شکل (O₃) جو تین آکسیجن ایٹموں پر مشتمل ہے", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "The ozone layer in the upper atmosphere absorbs most of the Sun's harmful ultraviolet radiation.", "properties": {"formula": "O₃", "molar_mass": "48.00 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "gas", "hazards": ["Toxic by inhalation", "Strong oxidizer", "Lung irritant (ground-level ozone)", "Unstable, decomposes to O₂"]}}

{"explanation": "The periodic table is a tabular arrangement of chemical elements, ordered by their atomic number, electron configurations, and recurring chemical properties, providing a framework to classify and understand elements.", "urdu_meaning": "دوری جدول / پیریوڈک ٹیبل - کیمیائی عناصر کی منظم ترتیب", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The periodic table allows chemists to predict the properties of elements and their compounds.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Systematic organization of elements showing periodic trends in their properties.", "related_concepts": ["elements", "atomic number", "electron configuration", "groups (columns)", "periods (rows)", "metals", "nonmetals", "metalloids", "periodic trends (e.g., electronegativity, ionization energy)"], "real_world_example": "Using the periodic table, one can infer that elements in Group 1 (alkali metals) are highly reactive."}}

{"explanation": "Potassium bromide (KBr) is an ionic salt composed of potassium ions and bromide ions, historically used as an anticonvulsant and sedative.", "urdu_meaning": "پوٹاشیم برومائیڈ - پوٹاشیم اور برومین کا آئنی نمک", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Potassium bromide is a white crystalline solid that is soluble in water.", "properties": {"formula": "KBr", "molar_mass": "119.002 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Irritant", "Can cause drowsiness in large doses (historically)"]}}

{"explanation": "A potassium ion (K⁺) is formed when a potassium atom loses one electron, resulting in a +1 charge; it is an essential electrolyte in living organisms.", "urdu_meaning": "پوٹاشیم آئن - پوٹاشیم ایٹم سے بننے والا مثبت آئن", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Potassium ions play a critical role in nerve function and maintaining fluid balance within cells.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A potassium atom that has lost its single valence electron, resulting in a +1 charge.", "related_concepts": ["cations", "ions", "alkali metals", "ionic compounds", "electrolytes", "nerve impulse", "membrane potential"], "real_world_example": "Bananas are a well-known dietary source of potassium ions."}}

{"explanation": "In chemistry, proportions refer to the quantitative relationship between the amounts of different substances in a mixture or elements in a compound, often governed by laws like the Law of Definite Proportions.", "urdu_meaning": "تناسبات - کسی مرکب یا آمیزے میں اجزاء کی مقداری نسبت", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The Law of Definite Proportions states that a chemical compound always contains its component elements in fixed proportions by mass.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The fixed or variable ratios by mass or moles of components in chemical systems.", "related_concepts": ["stoichiometry", "Law of Definite Proportions", "Law of Multiple Proportions", "chemical formula", "percent composition", "concentration", "ratios"], "real_world_example": "Water (H₂O) always consists of hydrogen and oxygen in a 2:1 atomic proportion and approximately an 11.19% to 88.81% mass proportion, respectively."}}

{"explanation": "Sodium chloride (NaCl), commonly known as table salt, is an ionic compound made of sodium ions and chloride ions, essential for life and widely used as a food seasoning and preservative.", "urdu_meaning": "سوڈیم کلورائیڈ (عام نمک) - سوڈیم اور کلورین کا آئنی مرکب", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Sodium chloride crystallizes in a cubic lattice structure.", "properties": {"formula": "NaCl", "molar_mass": "58.44 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Generally Recognized As Safe (GRAS) in food amounts", "Large doses can be harmful (e.g., hypertension)"]}}

{"explanation": "Sodium oxide (Na₂O) is an ionic compound formed from sodium and oxygen, a highly basic oxide that reacts vigorously with water to form sodium hydroxide.", "urdu_meaning": "سوڈیم آکسائیڈ - سوڈیم اور آکسیجن کا آئنی مرکب", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Sodium oxide is a key component in the manufacture of glass and ceramics.", "properties": {"formula": "Na₂O", "molar_mass": "61.9789 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Corrosive", "Reacts violently with water", "Irritant", "Basic (forms strong alkali)"]}}

{"explanation": "Stoichiometry is the branch of chemistry that deals with the quantitative relationships between reactants and products in chemical reactions, based on balanced chemical equations and the mole concept.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی مقدار شماری / سٹوکیومیٹری - کیمیائی تعاملات میں متعاملات اور حاصلات کے مقداری تعلقات کا مطالعہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Stoichiometry allows chemists to calculate the amount of product that can be formed from a given amount of reactant.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The calculation of quantities in chemical reactions using mole ratios from balanced equations.", "related_concepts": ["chemical equations", "mole concept", "molar mass", "limiting reactant", "excess reactant", "theoretical yield", "percent yield", "law of conservation of mass"], "real_world_example": "Using stoichiometry to determine the exact amount of oxygen needed for the complete combustion of 10 grams of methane."}}

{"explanation": "The 'structural story' of a molecule refers to how its specific three-dimensional arrangement of atoms and bonds (its structure) dictates its physical and chemical properties, behavior, and function.", "urdu_meaning": "ساختی وضاحت / ساخت اور خصوصیات کا تعلق - سالمے کی ساخت کا اس کی خصوصیات پر اثر", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The structural story of DNA, with its double helix, explains how it stores and transmits genetic information.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The direct relationship between a molecule's architecture (structure) and its observable characteristics and reactivity.", "related_concepts": ["structural formula", "isomers", "molecular geometry (VSEPR theory)", "chemical bonding", "conformation", "chirality", "structure-property relationships", "pharmacology (drug design)"], "real_world_example": "The bent structural story of a water molecule (H₂O) explains its polarity, high boiling point (due to hydrogen bonding), and solvent properties."}}

{"explanation": "Subscripts are characters (typically numbers or letters) set slightly below the normal line of type, commonly used in chemical formulas to indicate the number of atoms of an element in a molecule or formula unit.", "urdu_meaning": "زیر نوشت / سب اسکرپٹس - کیمیائی فارمولوں میں ایٹموں کی تعداد یا دیگر معلومات ظاہر کرنے والے نشانات", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "In the chemical formula C₆H₁₂O₆, the numbers 6, 12, and 6 are subscripts indicating the count of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen atoms respectively.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Notational convention in scientific and mathematical expressions placed below the baseline.", "related_concepts": ["chemical formula", "numerical subscripts", "element symbols", "molecular formula", "empirical formula", "mathematical notation"], "real_world_example": "The subscript '2' in O₂ denotes a molecule composed of two oxygen atoms."}}

{"explanation": "Valence electrons are the electrons located in the outermost electron shell of an atom, which are involved in forming chemical bonds with other atoms.", "urdu_meaning": "ویلنس الیکٹران / گرفتی الیکٹران - ایٹم کے بیرونی شیل میں موجود الیکٹران جو کیمیائی بندھن بناتے ہیں", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Carbon has four valence electrons, allowing it to form a wide variety of organic compounds.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Electrons in the highest occupied energy level of an atom, determining its chemical reactivity and bonding behavior.", "related_concepts": ["electron configuration", "chemical bonding (covalent, ionic)", "octet rule", "Lewis structures", "periodic table groups", "oxidation states", "reactivity"], "real_world_example": "Alkali metals (Group 1) have one valence electron, making them highly reactive and prone to losing that electron to form a +1 ion."}}

{"explanation": "Water (H₂O) is a chemical compound consisting of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom, essential for all known forms of life and existing as a liquid at room temperature.", "urdu_meaning": "پانی - دو ہائیڈروجن اور ایک آکسیجن ایٹموں پر مشتمل کیمیائی مرکب، زندگی کے لیے لازمی", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "The polarity of water molecules allows them to form hydrogen bonds, leading to many of its unique properties.", "properties": {"formula": "H₂O", "molar_mass": "18.01528 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "liquid", "hazards": ["Generally safe", "Risk of drowning", "Hyponatremia if consumed in extreme excess without electrolytes"]}}

{"explanation": "Aluminum oxide (Al₂O₃) is an inorganic ionic compound of aluminum and oxygen, known for its hardness and high melting point, commonly found as corundum or used in abrasives and ceramics.", "urdu_meaning": "ایلومینیم آکسائیڈ - ایلومینیم اور آکسیجن کا ایک غیر نامیاتی آئنی مرکب", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "The formula for aluminum oxide, derived from Al³⁺ and O²⁻ ions, is Al₂O₃.", "properties": {"formula": "Al₂O₃", "molar_mass": "101.96 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Irritant (dust)", "Abrasive"]}}

{"explanation": "An anion is an ion that has gained one or more electrons, resulting in a net negative electrical charge.", "urdu_meaning": "اینائن - منفی چارج والا آئن", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "When a chlorine atom gains an electron, it becomes a chloride anion (Cl⁻).", "properties": {"key_principle": "Negatively charged ion formed by the gain of electrons, typically by nonmetal atoms.", "related_concepts": ["ions", "cations", "ionic bonding", "electron affinity", "oxidation state", "polyatomic ions"], "real_world_example": "The oxide ion (O²⁻) is an anion commonly found in metal oxides."}}

{"explanation": "Anion charges represent the magnitude of the negative charge on an anion, indicating the number of electrons gained by the neutral atom or group.", "urdu_meaning": "اینائن چارجز - اینائن پر منفی چارج کی مقدار", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Common anion charges for nonmetals in groups 15, 16, and 17 are typically -3, -2, and -1, respectively.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The net negative charge on an ion resulting from an excess of electrons compared to protons.", "related_concepts": ["anion", "ions", "valence electrons", "electron gain", "periodic table trends", "oxidation state"], "real_world_example": "The sulfide ion (S²⁻) has an anion charge of 2- because a sulfur atom gains two electrons to achieve a stable electron configuration."}}

{"explanation": "A binary ionic compound is a chemical compound composed of exactly two different elements: a metal (forming a cation) and a nonmetal (forming an anion), held together by ionic bonds.", "urdu_meaning": "دو عنصری آئنی مرکب - دو مختلف عناصر (ایک دھات اور ایک غیر دھات) پر مشتمل آئنی مرکب", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Sodium chloride (NaCl) is a classic example of a binary ionic compound.", "properties": {"key_principle": "An ionic compound formed from one type of metallic cation and one type of nonmetallic anion.", "related_concepts": ["ionic compounds", "cations", "anions", "ionic bonding", "chemical formula", "naming ionic compounds"], "real_world_example": "Magnesium oxide (MgO) is a binary ionic compound formed from magnesium ions (Mg²⁺) and oxide ions (O²⁻)."}}

{"explanation": "Binary ionic compounds are chemical substances formed from the ionic bonding of cations from one metallic element and anions from one nonmetallic element.", "urdu_meaning": "دو عنصری آئنی مرکبات - ایک دھاتی عنصر کے کیٹائنز اور ایک غیر دھاتی عنصر کے اینائنز کے آئنی بندھن سے بننے والے کیمیائی مادے", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Many simple salts, like potassium bromide (KBr) and calcium sulfide (CaS), are binary ionic compounds.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Ionic compounds consisting of only two types of elements, one metal and one nonmetal.", "related_concepts": ["binary ionic compound (singular)", "ionic compounds", "cations", "anions", "chemical nomenclature", "formula writing"], "real_world_example": "Examples of binary ionic compounds include LiF (lithium fluoride) and AlN (aluminum nitride)."}}

{"explanation": "Calcium chloride (CaCl₂) is an ionic compound of calcium and chlorine, widely used as a desiccant and for de-icing roads.", "urdu_meaning": "کیلشیم کلورائیڈ - کیلشیم اور کلورین کا آئنی مرکب", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "The chemical formula for calcium chloride, CaCl₂, reflects the +2 charge of the calcium ion and the -1 charge of the chloride ion.", "properties": {"formula": "CaCl₂", "molar_mass": "110.98 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Irritant", "Hygroscopic", "Generates heat when dissolved in water"]}}

{"explanation": "Calcium phosphide (Ca₃P₂) is an ionic compound formed from calcium and phosphorus, which reacts with water to produce highly toxic phosphine gas.", "urdu_meaning": "کیلشیم فاسفائیڈ - کیلشیم اور فاسفورس کا آئنی مرکب", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "The formula for calcium phosphide is Ca₃P₂, derived from Ca²⁺ and P³⁻ ions.", "properties": {"formula": "Ca₃P₂", "molar_mass": "182.18 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid (often reddish-brown or grey)", "hazards": ["Reacts with water or acids to produce highly toxic and flammable phosphine gas (PH₃)", "Flammable solid"]}}

{"explanation": "A cation is an ion that has lost one or more electrons, resulting in a net positive electrical charge.", "urdu_meaning": "کیٹائن - مثبت چارج والا آئن", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "When a sodium atom loses an electron, it becomes a sodium cation (Na⁺).", "properties": {"key_principle": "Positively charged ion formed by the loss of electrons, typically by metal atoms.", "related_concepts": ["ions", "anions", "ionic bonding", "ionization energy", "oxidation state", "polyatomic ions"], "real_world_example": "The aluminum ion (Al³⁺) is a cation commonly found in minerals like bauxite."}}

{"explanation": "Cation charges represent the magnitude of the positive charge on a cation, indicating the number of electrons lost by the neutral atom or group.", "urdu_meaning": "کیٹائن چارجز - کیٹائن پر مثبت چارج کی مقدار", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Alkali metals typically form cations with a +1 charge, while alkaline earth metals form cations with a +2 charge.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The net positive charge on an ion resulting from a deficit of electrons compared to protons.", "related_concepts": ["cation", "ions", "valence electrons", "electron loss", "periodic table trends", "oxidation state", "transition metals (variable charges)"], "real_world_example": "The iron(III) ion (Fe³⁺) has a cation charge of 3+ because an iron atom has lost three electrons."}}

{"explanation": "Charges in chemistry refer to the electrical property of ions or subatomic particles, which can be positive (due to a deficiency of electrons relative to protons) or negative (due to an excess of electrons).", "urdu_meaning": "چارجز (برقی بار) - آئنوں یا ذیلی ایٹمی ذرات کی برقی خاصیت", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "Opposite charges attract each other, which is the basis of ionic bonding.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A fundamental property of matter that experiences a force when placed in an electromagnetic field; can be positive or negative.", "related_concepts": ["ions (cations, anions)", "protons", "electrons", "electrical neutrality", "electrostatic force", "oxidation state"], "real_world_example": "An electron carries a fundamental unit of negative charge (-1e), while a proton carries a positive charge (+1e)."}}

{"explanation": "Chemical bonding is the process or result of attractive forces holding atoms or ions together to form molecules, crystals, and other stable structures.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی بندھن - ایٹموں یا آئنوں کو جوڑنے والی قوتیں", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Ionic chemical bonding involves the electrostatic attraction between oppositely charged ions.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The interaction between atoms leading to the formation of stable chemical compounds.", "related_concepts": ["ionic bonds", "covalent bonds", "metallic bonds", "valence electrons", "electronegativity", "Lewis structures", "molecular geometry"], "real_world_example": "The strong chemical bonding in diamond contributes to its hardness."}}

{"explanation": "A chemical formula is a way of presenting information about the chemical proportions of atoms that constitute a particular chemical compound or molecule using chemical element symbols, numbers (subscripts), and other symbols.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی فارمولا - کسی مرکب میں ایٹموں کی نسبت کا علامتی اظہار", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The chemical formula for an ionic compound represents the simplest ratio of ions, known as a formula unit.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A concise notation representing the elemental composition of a substance.", "related_concepts": ["empirical formula", "molecular formula", "structural formula", "element symbols", "subscripts", "compounds", "molecules", "formula unit"], "real_world_example": "The chemical formula for magnesium chloride is MgCl₂."}}

{"explanation": "Chemical formulas are standardized notations using element symbols and subscripts to represent the composition of molecules and compounds, including the ratios of ions in ionic compounds.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی فارمولے - سالمات اور مرکبات کی ترکیب کا علامتی اظہار", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Understanding how to write chemical formulas for ionic compounds requires knowing the charges of the constituent ions.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Systematic representations of the elemental makeup of chemical substances.", "related_concepts": ["chemical formula (singular)", "empirical formula", "molecular formula", "structural formula", "compounds", "ions", "formula unit"], "real_world_example": "Various chemical formulas, such as Al₂O₃ for aluminum oxide and KBr for potassium bromide, represent ionic compounds."}}

{"explanation": "The crisscross method is a simple technique used to determine the chemical formula of an ionic compound by exchanging the numerical values of the ion charges to become the subscripts of the opposite ion.", "urdu_meaning": "کراس کراس طریقہ - آئنی مرکب کا فارمولا معلوم کرنے کا ایک سادہ طریقہ", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Using the crisscross method for Al³⁺ and O²⁻, the 3 from aluminum's charge becomes the subscript for oxygen, and the 2 from oxygen's charge becomes the subscript for aluminum, yielding Al₂O₃.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A shortcut to balance charges in an ionic compound formula by making the magnitude of one ion's charge the subscript of the other ion.", "related_concepts": ["ionic compounds", "chemical formula", "cation charges", "anion charges", "electrical neutrality", "formula unit"], "real_world_example": "Applying the crisscross method to Ca²⁺ and N³⁻ gives Ca₃N₂, the formula for calcium nitride."}}

{"explanation": "Electrical neutrality is the state in which a substance or system has an equal number of positive and negative charges, resulting in no net electrical charge; ionic compounds are electrically neutral overall.", "urdu_meaning": "برقی تعدیل / برقی غیر جانبداری - مثبت اور منفی چارجز کی مساوی تعداد", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Ionic compounds achieve electrical neutrality by combining cations and anions in ratios that balance the total positive and negative charges.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The condition of having a net electric charge of zero due to balanced positive and negative charges.", "related_concepts": ["charge conservation", "ions (cations, anions)", "atoms", "ionic compounds", "formula unit"], "real_world_example": "A formula unit of NaCl is electrically neutral because the +1 charge of the sodium ion is balanced by the -1 charge of the chloride ion."}}

{"explanation": "Electron configurations describe the arrangement of electrons in the different energy levels and sublevels within an atom or ion, which helps predict ion formation and charges.", "urdu_meaning": "الیکٹران ترتیب / الیکٹرانک کنفیگریشن - ایٹم یا آئن میں الیکٹرانوں کی ترتیب", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The electron configurations of metals often show them losing valence electrons to achieve a stable, noble gas configuration, thus forming cations.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The distribution of electrons of an atom or molecule (or other physical structure) in atomic or molecular orbitals.", "related_concepts": ["atoms", "ions", "orbitals (s, p, d, f)", "electron shells", "valence electrons", "periodic table", "octet rule", "noble gas configuration"], "real_world_example": "Sodium (1s²2s²2p⁶3s¹) readily loses its 3s¹ electron to form Na⁺ (1s²2s²2p⁶), which has the electron configuration of neon."}}

{"explanation": "An ion is an atom or molecule that has acquired a net electrical charge by gaining or losing one or more electrons.", "urdu_meaning": "آئن - چارج شدہ ایٹم یا سالمہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "When forming an ionic compound, a metal atom typically becomes a positive ion (cation), and a nonmetal atom becomes a negative ion (anion).", "properties": {"key_principle": "An electrically charged particle formed from an atom or molecule by the loss or gain of electrons.", "related_concepts": ["cation", "anion", "ionic bonding", "electron transfer", "electrolytes", "polyatomic ions", "oxidation state"], "real_world_example": "The fluoride ion (F⁻) is formed when a fluorine atom gains one electron."}}

{"explanation": "Ion charges are the net electrical charges on ions, determined by the number of protons and electrons; these charges are crucial for predicting the formulas of ionic compounds.", "urdu_meaning": "آئن چارجز - آئنوں پر موجود خالص برقی چارج", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The ion charges of monatomic ions can often be predicted from their position in the periodic table.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The positive or negative numerical value representing the net charge of an ion.", "related_concepts": ["ion", "cation", "anion", "oxidation state", "valence electrons", "periodic table trends", "polyatomic ions"], "real_world_example": "The magnesium ion has an ion charge of +2 (Mg²⁺), while the oxide ion has an ion charge of -2 (O²⁻)."}}

{"explanation": "Ionic bonding is a type of chemical bond formed through an electrostatic attraction between two oppositely charged ions (cations and anions), typically involving electron transfer from a metal to a nonmetal.", "urdu_meaning": "آئنی بندھن - مخالف چارج والے آئنوں کے درمیان برقی سکونی کشش", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Ionic bonding results in the formation of crystalline solids with high melting points, such as sodium chloride.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The complete transfer of valence electron(s) between atoms, leading to the formation of ions that are electrostatically attracted.", "related_concepts": ["chemical bonding", "ions", "cations", "anions", "electron transfer", "electrostatic force", "ionic compounds", "crystal lattice", "electronegativity difference"], "real_world_example": "The ionic bonding in potassium fluoride (KF) occurs due to the attraction between K⁺ and F⁻ ions."}}

{"explanation": "Ions are atoms or groups of atoms that have gained or lost electrons, thus acquiring a net positive (cation) or negative (anion) electrical charge, and are the fundamental units of ionic compounds.", "urdu_meaning": "آئنز - چارج شدہ ایٹم یا ایٹموں کے گروہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "In an ionic compound, the total positive charge from the cations must balance the total negative charge from the anions.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Charged species formed by the gain (anion) or loss (cation) of electrons from neutral atoms or molecules.", "related_concepts": ["cations", "anions", "ionic bonding", "ionization", "electron transfer", "electrolytes", "polyatomic ions", "oxidation state"], "real_world_example": "When table salt (NaCl) dissolves in water, it dissociates into sodium ions (Na⁺) and chloride ions (Cl⁻)."}}

{"explanation": "Lithium oxide (Li₂O) is an inorganic ionic compound formed between lithium and oxygen, used in ceramics and as a fluxing agent.", "urdu_meaning": "لیتھیم آکسائیڈ - لیتھیم اور آکسیجن کا آئنی مرکب", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "The chemical formula for lithium oxide is Li₂O because lithium forms Li⁺ ions and oxygen forms O²⁻ ions.", "properties": {"formula": "Li₂O", "molar_mass": "29.88 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Corrosive", "Reacts with water to form lithium hydroxide", "Irritant"]}}

{"explanation": "Magnesium nitride (Mg₃N₂) is an inorganic ionic compound composed of magnesium and nitrogen, which reacts with water to produce ammonia gas.", "urdu_meaning": "میگنیشیم نائٹرائیڈ - میگنیشیم اور نائٹروجن کا آئنی مرکب", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Magnesium nitride is formed when magnesium burns in air, reacting with both oxygen (to form MgO) and nitrogen.", "properties": {"formula": "Mg₃N₂", "molar_mass": "100.9494 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid (yellowish-green)", "hazards": ["Reacts with water or moisture to produce flammable ammonia gas", "Irritant"]}}

{"explanation": "The periodic table is a tabular arrangement of chemical elements, ordered by their atomic number, electron configurations, and recurring chemical properties, which is essential for predicting ion charges and types of bonding.", "urdu_meaning": "دوری جدول / پیریوڈک ٹیبل - کیمیائی عناصر کی منظم ترتیب", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The position of an element in the periodic table helps determine the charge it will likely form as an ion in an ionic compound.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Systematic organization of elements showing periodic trends in their properties, including ion formation.", "related_concepts": ["elements", "atomic number", "electron configuration", "groups (columns)", "periods (rows)", "metals", "nonmetals", "metalloids", "ion charges", "valence electrons"], "real_world_example": "Elements in Group 1 of the periodic table typically form +1 cations, while elements in Group 17 typically form -1 anions."}}

{"explanation": "Potassium bromide (KBr) is an ionic salt composed of potassium ions (K⁺) and bromide ions (Br⁻), often used in spectroscopy and historically as a sedative.", "urdu_meaning": "پوٹاشیم برومائیڈ - پوٹاشیم اور برومین کا آئنی نمک", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Potassium bromide is a typical binary ionic compound formed from an alkali metal and a halogen.", "properties": {"formula": "KBr", "molar_mass": "119.002 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Irritant", "Can cause drowsiness in large doses (historically)"]}}

{"explanation": "Sodium sulfide (Na₂S) is an inorganic ionic compound of sodium and sulfur, used in the pulp and paper industry, water treatment, and as a chemical intermediate.", "urdu_meaning": "سوڈیم سلفائیڈ - سوڈیم اور سلفر کا آئنی مرکب", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "The chemical formula Na₂S indicates that two sodium ions (Na⁺) are needed to balance the charge of one sulfide ion (S²⁻).", "properties": {"formula": "Na₂S", "molar_mass": "78.0452 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid (often yellow or brick red due to polysulfides)", "hazards": ["Corrosive", "Reacts with acids to produce highly toxic hydrogen sulfide (H₂S) gas", "Hygroscopic", "Irritant"]}}

{"explanation": "Solubility is the property of a solid, liquid, or gaseous chemical substance called solute to dissolve in a solid, liquid, or gaseous solvent to form a homogeneous solution. The solubility of ionic compounds in water varies greatly.", "urdu_meaning": "حل پذیری - کسی مادے کا دوسرے مادے میں حل ہونے کی صلاحیت", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "The solubility of many ionic compounds in water is high, but some, like silver chloride, are nearly insoluble.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The maximum concentration of a solute that can dissolve in a given amount of solvent at a specific temperature and pressure.", "related_concepts": ["solution", "solute", "solvent", "concentration", "saturated solution", "unsaturated solution", "supersaturated solution", "polarity", "'like dissolves like'", "solubility rules"], "real_world_example": "Sugar (sucrose) has a high solubility in water, allowing large amounts to dissolve and form sweet solutions."}}

{"explanation": "'Table 4.1' likely refers to a specific table within a chemistry textbook or reference material for Topic 4.3, probably listing common ions, their names, and their charges to aid in writing formulas for ionic compounds.", "urdu_meaning": "جدول 4.1 - ممکنہ طور پر آئنوں اور ان کے چارجز کی فہرست پر مشتمل جدول", "term_type": "other", "example_sentence": "Consult Table 4.1 in your textbook to find the charge of the phosphate ion when writing the formula for calcium phosphate.", "properties": {"content_description": "Typically lists common monatomic and polyatomic ions with their respective names and electrical charges.", "purpose": "Reference guide for determining ion charges and correctly writing chemical formulas for ionic compounds.", "common_elements_listed": ["Monatomic ions (e.g., Na⁺, Ca²⁺, Al³⁺, Cl⁻, O²⁻, N³⁻)", "Polyatomic ions (e.g., NH₄⁺, OH⁻, NO₃⁻, CO₃²⁻, SO₄²⁻, PO₄³⁻)"]}}

{"explanation": "Ascorbic acid, also known as Vitamin C, is an organic compound with the molecular formula C₆H₈O₆, essential for various metabolic processes in humans and many other animal species.", "urdu_meaning": "ایسکوربک ایسڈ (وٹامن سی) - ایک نامیاتی مرکب، وٹامن سی", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Elemental analysis of ascorbic acid reveals its empirical formula to be C₃H₄O₃.", "properties": {"formula": "C₆H₈O₆", "molar_mass": "176.12 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Generally non-toxic in dietary amounts", "High doses can cause gastrointestinal upset"]}}

{"explanation": "Atoms are the fundamental building blocks of matter, consisting of a nucleus (protons and neutrons) surrounded by electrons; their ratios in a compound determine its empirical and molecular formulas.", "urdu_meaning": "ایٹم (جوہر) - مادے کی بنیادی اکائی", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The molecular formula of a compound shows the exact number of atoms of each element in one molecule.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The basic unit of a chemical element, defining its properties.", "related_concepts": ["elements", "molecules", "ions", "subatomic particles (protons, neutrons, electrons)", "atomic theory", "isotopes", "empirical formula", "molecular formula"], "real_world_example": "A molecule of glucose (C₆H₁₂O₆) contains 6 carbon atoms, 12 hydrogen atoms, and 6 oxygen atoms."}}

{"explanation": "Benzene (C₆H₆) is a cyclic aromatic hydrocarbon. Its empirical formula is CH, while its molecular formula is C₆H₆.", "urdu_meaning": "بینزین - ایک چکری خوشبودار ہائیڈروکاربن", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Although the empirical formula of benzene is CH, its molar mass indicates a molecular formula of C₆H₆.", "properties": {"formula": "C₆H₆", "molar_mass": "78.11 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "liquid", "hazards": ["Flammable", "Carcinogen", "Toxic", "Irritant"]}}

{"explanation": "Biochemistry is the branch of science that explores the chemical processes within and related to living organisms, often involving complex biomolecules with specific empirical and molecular formulas.", "urdu_meaning": "حیاتیاتی کیمیا / بائیو کیمسٹری - جانداروں میں کیمیائی عوامل کا مطالعہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "In biochemistry, determining the molecular formula of a newly discovered enzyme is a critical step.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The study of the chemical basis of life, focusing on the structure, function, and interaction of biomolecules.", "related_concepts": ["biomolecules", "molecular biology", "enzymes", "metabolism", "DNA", "proteins", "carbohydrates", "lipids"], "real_world_example": "Understanding the Krebs cycle, a series of chemical reactions in cells, is a fundamental aspect of biochemistry."}}

{"explanation": "Biomolecules are molecules produced by living organisms, such as proteins, carbohydrates, lipids, and nucleic acids, whose composition can be described by empirical and molecular formulas.", "urdu_meaning": "حیاتیاتی سالمات / بائیو مالیکیولز - جانداروں کے ذریعے پیدا کردہ سالمات", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Glucose, a simple carbohydrate and a key biomolecule, has the molecular formula C₆H₁₂O₆.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Organic molecules that are essential components or products of living organisms.", "related_concepts": ["organic chemistry", "biochemistry", "proteins", "carbohydrates", "lipids", "nucleic acids (DNA, RNA)", "vitamins", "hormones"], "real_world_example": "Hemoglobin is a complex protein biomolecule responsible for oxygen transport in the blood."}}

{"explanation": "Caffeine is a naturally occurring stimulant compound whose molecular formula is C₈H₁₀N₄O₂, and its empirical formula can be determined from its percent composition.", "urdu_meaning": "کیفین - ایک قدرتی محرک مرکب", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "From the mass percent composition, the empirical formula of caffeine is C₄H₅N₂O, and its molecular formula is C₈H₁₀N₄O₂.", "properties": {"formula": "C₈H₁₀N₄O₂", "molar_mass": "194.19 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Stimulant", "Can cause restlessness and insomnia in high doses", "Mildly addictive"]}}

{"explanation": "Chemical analysis encompasses techniques used to identify and quantify the chemical composition of substances, often involving the determination of empirical and molecular formulas.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی تجزیہ - مادوں کی کیمیائی ترکیب کا تعین", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Chemical analysis, such as mass spectrometry, can provide data to determine the molecular formula of an unknown compound.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The identification, characterization, and quantification of chemical substances and their components.", "related_concepts": ["qualitative analysis", "quantitative analysis", "elemental analysis", "spectroscopy", "chromatography", "titration", "empirical formula", "molecular formula"], "real_world_example": "Forensic scientists use chemical analysis to identify substances found at a crime scene."}}

{"explanation": "Dimethyl ether is an organic compound with the molecular formula C₂H₆O, which is the same as ethanol, making them isomers. Its empirical formula is also C₂H₆O.", "urdu_meaning": "ڈائی میتھائل ایتھر - ایک نامیاتی مرکب", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Despite having the same molecular formula C₂H₆O, dimethyl ether and ethanol have different properties due to their different structural formulas.", "properties": {"formula": "CH₃OCH₃ (or C₂H₆O)", "molar_mass": "46.07 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "gas", "hazards": ["Extremely flammable", "Asphyxiant in high concentrations"]}}

{"explanation": "Elemental analysis is a process used to determine the mass percent composition of elements in a compound, which is the first step towards finding its empirical formula.", "urdu_meaning": "عنصری تجزیہ - کسی مرکب میں عناصر کی فیصدی ترکیب کا تعین", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Combustion analysis is a common method of elemental analysis for organic compounds to determine their empirical formula.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The determination of the types and relative amounts of elements present in a sample.", "related_concepts": ["empirical formula", "mass percent composition", "combustion analysis", "atomic spectroscopy", "quantitative analysis"], "real_world_example": "Elemental analysis of a newly synthesized pharmaceutical compound is crucial for confirming its identity and purity, from which its empirical formula can be derived."}}

{"explanation": "The empirical formula of a chemical compound is the simplest whole-number ratio of atoms of each element present in the compound.", "urdu_meaning": "تجرباتی فارمولا - کسی مرکب میں عناصر کے ایٹموں کا سادہ ترین عددی تناسب", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "If the molecular formula of glucose is C₆H₁₂O₆, its empirical formula is CH₂O.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Represents the simplest positive integer ratio of atoms of each element in a compound.", "related_concepts": ["molecular formula", "mass percent composition", "elemental analysis", "formula unit (for ionic compounds)", "stoichiometry"], "real_world_example": "The empirical formula for hydrogen peroxide (H₂O₂) is HO."}}

{"explanation": "The empirical formula mass is the sum of the atomic masses of all atoms represented in an empirical formula.", "urdu_meaning": "تجرباتی فارمولا کمیت - تجرباتی فارمولے میں تمام ایٹموں کی جوہری کمیتوں کا مجموعہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The empirical formula mass of CH₂O (empirical formula for glucose) is approximately 30.03 g/mol.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The molar mass corresponding to the empirical formula of a compound.", "related_concepts": ["empirical formula", "molar mass", "molecular formula", "atomic mass"], "real_world_example": "To find the molecular formula from the empirical formula, you divide the compound's molar mass by its empirical formula mass to find the whole-number multiplier."}}

{"explanation": "Ethanol is an alcohol with the molecular formula C₂H₆O (or C₂H₅OH), and its empirical formula is also C₂H₆O as the atom ratios cannot be simplified further.", "urdu_meaning": "ایتھنول - ایک الکحل، سالمی فارمولا C₂H₆O", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "The empirical formula of ethanol is C₂H₆O, which is identical to its molecular formula.", "properties": {"formula": "C₂H₅OH (or C₂H₆O)", "molar_mass": "46.07 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "liquid", "hazards": ["Flammable", "Irritant", "Intoxicant"]}}

{"explanation": "Glucose is a simple sugar with the molecular formula C₆H₁₂O₆. Its empirical formula, representing the simplest ratio of atoms, is CH₂O.", "urdu_meaning": "گلوکوز - ایک سادہ شکر، سالمی فارمولا C₆H₁₂O₆", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "From the percent composition, the empirical formula of glucose is found to be CH₂O, and its molecular formula is C₆H₁₂O₆.", "properties": {"formula": "C₆H₁₂O₆", "molar_mass": "180.16 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Generally non-toxic", "Hyperglycemia in excess for diabetics"]}}

{"explanation": "Hydrogen peroxide is a compound with the molecular formula H₂O₂. Its empirical formula, representing the simplest ratio, is HO.", "urdu_meaning": "ہائیڈروجن پر آکسائیڈ - ایک مرکب، سالمی فارمولا H₂O₂", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "The empirical formula of hydrogen peroxide is HO, while its molecular formula is H₂O₂.", "properties": {"formula": "H₂O₂", "molar_mass": "34.0147 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "liquid (often as aqueous solution)", "hazards": ["Strong oxidizer", "Corrosive (at high concentrations)", "Irritant", "Can decompose to form oxygen and water, potentially explosively"]}}

{"explanation": "Mass percent composition of a compound is the percentage by mass contributed by each element in the compound, which is used to determine the empirical formula.", "urdu_meaning": "کمیت فیصدی ترکیب - کسی مرکب میں ہر عنصر کا کمیتی فیصد", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The mass percent composition of carbon in CO₂ can be calculated from the molar masses of carbon and carbon dioxide.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The relative mass of each element in a compound expressed as a percentage of the total mass of the compound.", "related_concepts": ["empirical formula", "molecular formula", "stoichiometry", "elemental analysis", "molar mass"], "real_world_example": "Water (H₂O) has a mass percent composition of approximately 11.19% hydrogen and 88.81% oxygen."}}

{"explanation": "Mass spectrometry is an analytical technique that measures the mass-to-charge ratio of ions, which can be used to determine the molar mass of a compound and help elucidate its molecular formula.", "urdu_meaning": "کمیت طیف پیمائی / ماس سپیکٹرو میٹری - آئنوں کے کمیت اور چارج کے تناسب کی پیمائش کا طریقہ", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Mass spectrometry data provides the molar mass of a compound, which, along with the empirical formula, allows determination of the molecular formula.", "properties": {"key_principle": "An analytical method to identify the constituents of a sample by separating gaseous ions according to their mass-to-charge ratio.", "related_concepts": ["molar mass determination", "molecular formula", "isotopic abundance", "fragmentation patterns", "chemical analysis", "analytical chemistry"], "real_world_example": "Forensic scientists use mass spectrometry to identify unknown substances by precisely determining their molar mass."}}

{"explanation": "Molar mass is the mass of one mole of a substance (e.g., an element or compound), expressed in grams per mole (g/mol). It is numerically equal to the formula weight in atomic mass units and is crucial for converting between mass and moles, and for determining molecular formulas from empirical formulas.", "urdu_meaning": "مولر کمیت / مولی کمیت - ایک مول مادے کی کمیت", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "If the empirical formula mass is 30 g/mol and the molar mass of the compound is 180 g/mol, the molecular formula is six times the empirical formula.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The mass of Avogadro's number of particles (atoms, molecules, formula units) of a substance.", "unit": "g/mol", "related_concepts": ["mole", "Avogadro's number", "atomic mass", "molecular weight", "formula weight", "empirical formula", "molecular formula", "stoichiometry"], "real_world_example": "The molar mass of carbon dioxide (CO₂) is approximately 44.01 g/mol."}}

{"explanation": "The molecular formula of a chemical compound indicates the actual number of atoms of each element present in one molecule of the compound.", "urdu_meaning": "سالمی فارمولا / مالیکیولر فارمولا - ایک سالمے میں ہر عنصر کے ایٹموں کی حقیقی تعداد", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The molecular formula of glucose is C₆H₁₂O₆, which shows that each molecule contains 6 carbon, 12 hydrogen, and 6 oxygen atoms.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Represents the exact number and types of atoms in a single molecule of a covalent compound.", "related_concepts": ["empirical formula", "chemical formula", "molecules", "covalent compounds", "stoichiometry", "molar mass", "isomers"], "real_world_example": "While acetic acid and glucose have different molecular formulas (C₂H₄O₂ and C₆H₁₂O₆ respectively), they share the same empirical formula (CH₂O)."}}

{"explanation": "A molecule is an electrically neutral group of two or more atoms held together by chemical bonds; its composition is represented by a molecular formula.", "urdu_meaning": "سالمہ / مالیکیول - کیمیائی بندھنوں سے جڑے دو یا زیادہ ایٹموں کا گروہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Each molecule of water (H₂O) consists of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The smallest particle of a substance that retains the chemical and physical properties of that substance and is composed of two or more atoms linked by covalent bonds.", "related_concepts": ["atoms", "covalent bonds", "compounds", "elements (diatomic, e.g., O₂, N₂)", "molecular formula", "empirical formula", "intermolecular forces"], "real_world_example": "A methane molecule (CH₄) is formed by one carbon atom covalently bonded to four hydrogen atoms."}}
