{"explanation": "Ammonium salts are ionic compounds containing the ammonium cation (NH₄⁺), typically formed from the reaction of ammonia with an acid.", "urdu_meaning": "امونیم نمکیات - امونیم کیٹائن پر مشتمل آئنی مرکبات", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Ammonium nitrate (NH₄NO₃) is an ammonium salt widely used as a fertilizer.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Ionic compounds containing the NH₄⁺ cation.", "related_concepts": ["ammonia", "acids", "salts", "ions", "fertilizers"], "real_world_example": "Ammonium chloride (NH₄Cl) used in dry cell batteries and as a flux in soldering."}}

{"explanation": "Antacids are substances, typically basic compounds, used to neutralize excess stomach acid and relieve heartburn or indigestion.", "urdu_meaning": "اینٹاسڈ - معدے کی تیزابیت کم کرنے والی ادویات", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Magnesium hydroxide is a common ingredient in antacids that neutralizes hydrochloric acid in the stomach.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Basic compounds that neutralize stomach acidity.", "related_concepts": ["acids", "bases", "neutralization", "pH", "heartburn", "stomach acid"], "real_world_example": "Over-the-counter medications like Tums (calcium carbonate) or Milk of Magnesia (magnesium hydroxide)."}}

{"explanation": "Baking powder is a chemical leavening agent, a mixture of a carbonate or bicarbonate and a weak acid, used to make baked goods rise.", "urdu_meaning": "بیکنگ پاؤڈر - بیکنگ میں استعمال ہونے والا خمیرہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "When baking powder is moistened and heated, it releases carbon dioxide gas, causing the dough to expand.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Releases carbon dioxide gas upon reaction of its acidic and basic components when wet and/or heated.", "related_concepts": ["baking soda", "carbon dioxide", "acid-base reaction", "leavening agent"], "real_world_example": "Used in cakes, cookies, and muffins to make them light and fluffy."}}

{"explanation": "Baking soda, chemically known as sodium bicarbonate, is a white crystalline powder commonly used in baking as a leavening agent and as a household cleaner.", "urdu_meaning": "بیکنگ سوڈا - سوڈیم بائی کاربونیٹ", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Baking soda reacts with acidic ingredients in batter, like buttermilk, to produce carbon dioxide gas.", "properties": {"formula": "NaHCO₃", "molar_mass": "84.007 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Generally recognized as safe (GRAS)", "Mild irritant in large quantities"]}}

{"explanation": "Bases are chemical substances that accept protons or hydrogen ions and/or donate electrons, typically having a bitter taste and feeling slippery, and reacting with acids to form salts.", "urdu_meaning": "اساس - پروٹان قبول کرنے والے کیمیائی مادے", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Sodium hydroxide is a strong base used in many industrial processes, including soap manufacturing.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Proton (H⁺) acceptors or electron donors, with pH > 7 in aqueous solution.", "related_concepts": ["acids", "pH", "neutralization", "salts", "alkalis", "Arrhenius theory", "Bronsted-Lowry theory", "Lewis theory"], "real_world_example": "Ammonia is a common base used in cleaning products; antacids contain bases to neutralize stomach acid."}}

{"explanation": "Biochemistry is the branch of science that explores the chemical processes within and related to living organisms.", "urdu_meaning": "حیاتیاتی کیمیا - جانداروں میں کیمیائی عوامل کا علم", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The study of enzyme kinetics and metabolic pathways are key areas of biochemistry.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Application of chemical principles to understand biological systems at the molecular level.", "related_concepts": ["enzymes", "proteins", "DNA", "metabolism", "cellular respiration", "photosynthesis"], "real_world_example": "Developing new drugs by understanding the biochemistry of diseases."}}

{"explanation": "Buffer systems are solutions containing a weak acid and its conjugate base, or a weak base and its conjugate acid, that resist changes in pH upon addition of small amounts of acid or base.", "urdu_meaning": "بفر سسٹم - پی ایچ میں تبدیلی کے خلاف مزاحمت کرنے والے محلول", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The bicarbonate buffer system in human blood helps maintain a stable pH, crucial for physiological functions.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Resists pH change by neutralizing added H⁺ or OH⁻ ions through equilibrium shifts.", "related_concepts": ["pH", "acids", "bases", "equilibrium", "Le Chatelier's principle", "conjugate acid-base pair"], "real_world_example": "Blood pH regulation, calibration solutions for pH meters, maintaining pH in biological experiments."}}

{"explanation": "Ca(OH)₂, calcium hydroxide, also known as slaked lime, is an inorganic compound that is a colorless crystal or white powder produced when calcium oxide (lime or quicklime) is mixed, or slaked with water.", "urdu_meaning": "کیلشیم ہائیڈروآکسائیڈ - بجھا ہوا چونا", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Ca(OH)₂ is used in mortar, plaster, and to neutralize acidic soils.", "properties": {"formula": "Ca(OH)₂", "molar_mass": "74.093 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Skin irritant", "Eye damage risk"]}}

{"explanation": "Calcium carbonate is a chemical compound commonly found in rocks as the minerals calcite and aragonite, and is the main component of pearls and the shells of marine organisms, snails, and eggs.", "urdu_meaning": "کیلشیم کاربونیٹ - چونے کا پتھر", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Calcium carbonate is used as an antacid to relieve heartburn and indigestion by neutralizing stomach acid.", "properties": {"formula": "CaCO₃", "molar_mass": "100.086 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Generally non-toxic", "Can cause irritation if inhaled"]}}

{"explanation": "Calcium hydroxide, also known as slaked lime, is an inorganic compound used in food preparation, wastewater treatment, and as a pH modifier.", "urdu_meaning": "کیلشیم ہائیڈروآکسائیڈ - بجھا ہوا چونا", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "A suspension of calcium hydroxide in water, known as limewater, is used to detect carbon dioxide.", "properties": {"formula": "Ca(OH)₂", "molar_mass": "74.093 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Skin irritant", "Risk of serious eye damage"]}}

{"explanation": "Carbon dioxide is a colorless gas with a density about 60% higher than that of dry air, composed of one carbon atom covalently double bonded to two oxygen atoms.", "urdu_meaning": "کاربن ڈائی آکسائیڈ - ایک بے رنگ گیس", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Plants use carbon dioxide during photosynthesis to produce glucose and oxygen.", "properties": {"formula": "CO₂", "molar_mass": "44.01 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "gas", "hazards": ["Asphyxiant in high concentrations", "Greenhouse gas"]}}

{"explanation": "Carbon dioxide gas is the gaseous form of carbon dioxide, a vital component of Earth's atmosphere involved in the carbon cycle and climate regulation.", "urdu_meaning": "کاربن ڈائی آکسائیڈ گیس", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "The fizz in carbonated beverages is due to dissolved carbon dioxide gas under pressure.", "properties": {"formula": "CO₂", "molar_mass": "44.01 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "gas", "hazards": ["Asphyxiant at high concentrations", "Can displace oxygen"]}}

{"explanation": "Caustic drain cleaners are highly alkaline chemical products, often containing sodium hydroxide or potassium hydroxide, designed to dissolve grease, hair, and other organic blockages in pipes.", "urdu_meaning": "کاسٹک ڈرین کلینر - تیزابی نالی صاف کرنے والا", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Extreme caution should be used when handling caustic drain cleaner due to its corrosive nature.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Utilizes strong bases to hydrolyze and break down organic matter clogging drains.", "related_concepts": ["sodium hydroxide", "potassium hydroxide", "alkalis", "saponification", "corrosion"], "real_world_example": "Products like Drano or Liquid-Plumr containing lye."}}

{"explanation": "Ca₃(PO₄)₂, calcium phosphate, is a family of minerals containing calcium ions together with orthophosphate, metaphosphate, or pyrophosphate ions, and sometimes hydrogen or hydroxide ions.", "urdu_meaning": "کیلشیم فاسفیٹ", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Calcium phosphate, Ca₃(PO₄)₂, is the main inorganic constituent of bone and teeth.", "properties": {"formula": "Ca₃(PO₄)₂", "molar_mass": "310.18 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Generally non-toxic", "Can be an irritant if inhaled"]}}

{"explanation": "Cellular respiration is a set of metabolic reactions and processes that take place in the cells of organisms to convert biochemical energy from nutrients into adenosine triphosphate (ATP), and then release waste products.", "urdu_meaning": "خلیاتی تنفس - خلیوں میں توانائی پیدا کرنے کا عمل", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "During cellular respiration, glucose and oxygen are used to produce ATP, water, and carbon dioxide.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Oxidation of organic molecules (e.g., glucose) to produce ATP, the energy currency of the cell.", "related_concepts": ["glucose", "oxygen", "ATP", "mitochondria", "glycolysis", "Krebs cycle", "electron transport chain"], "real_world_example": "The process by which humans and animals get energy from food."}}

{"explanation": "Chemical drain cleaners are products designed to unclog drains, typically working through strong acidic or alkaline reactions to dissolve blockages like hair and grease.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی ڈرین کلینر - نالی صاف کرنے والے کیمیکل", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Chemical drain cleaners can be corrosive and should be handled with care, following safety instructions.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Utilize chemical reactions (acidic, alkaline, or oxidizing) to break down organic and inorganic materials causing clogs.", "related_concepts": ["acids", "bases", "oxidation", "corrosion", "safety precautions"], "real_world_example": "Alkaline cleaners containing NaOH, acidic cleaners containing H₂SO₄ (less common for household use)."}}

{"explanation": "Chemical properties describe a material's potential to undergo some chemical change or reaction by virtue of its composition, such as reactivity, flammability, and acidity.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی خصوصیات - مادے کی کیمیائی تبدیلی کی صلاحیت", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "The flammability of methane is one of its important chemical properties.", "properties": {"describes": "How a substance interacts with other substances or changes its chemical identity.", "related_concepts": ["physical properties", "chemical reaction", "reactivity", "flammability", "oxidation state", "pH"], "example_of_use": "Assessing the chemical properties of a new compound to determine its potential uses and hazards.", "measurement_type": "Observation of reactions, spectroscopic methods"}}

{"explanation": "A cleaning agent is a substance, usually a liquid, powder, spray, or granule, used to remove dirt, including dust, stains, bad smells, and clutter on surfaces.", "urdu_meaning": "صفائی کا ایجنٹ - گندگی صاف کرنے والا مادہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Soap is a common cleaning agent that works by emulsifying fats and oils.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Facilitates the removal of unwanted substances (dirt, stains, etc.) from surfaces through various chemical or physical mechanisms.", "related_concepts": ["surfactants", "solvents", "detergents", "disinfectants", "abrasives", "pH"], "real_world_example": "Soaps, detergents, bleach, ammonia solutions, vinegar."}}

{"explanation": "Cleaning products are substances formulated to help clean, disinfect, or maintain various surfaces and items, often containing a mix of chemicals like surfactants, solvents, and builders.", "urdu_meaning": "صفائی کی مصنوعات - صفائی کے لیے تیار کردہ اشیاء", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Many cleaning products contain active ingredients like bleach or ammonia, which require careful handling.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Formulations designed for specific cleaning tasks, utilizing chemical and physical actions.", "related_concepts": ["detergents", "solvents", "disinfectants", "surfactants", "pH", "safety"], "real_world_example": "Dish soap, laundry detergent, window cleaner, all-purpose cleaner."}}

{"explanation": "Concrete is a composite material composed of fine and coarse aggregate bonded together with a fluid cement (cement paste) that hardens (cures) over time.", "urdu_meaning": "کنکریٹ - سیمنٹ اور بجری کا مرکب", "term_type": "other", "example_sentence": "The hydration of cement in concrete is a complex chemical process that leads to its hardening and strength.", "properties": {"description": "A widely used construction material made from cement, water, and aggregates.", "contextual_relevance": "Involves chemical reactions (hydration of cement), and can be affected by acidic environments (e.g., acid rain)."}}

{"explanation": "Copper is a chemical element with symbol Cu and atomic number 29, a soft, malleable, and ductile metal with very high thermal and electrical conductivity.", "urdu_meaning": "تانبا - ایک دھات", "term_type": "element", "example_sentence": "Copper pipes are often used in plumbing because of their durability and resistance to corrosion.", "properties": {"symbol": "Cu", "atomic_number": 29, "category": "metal", "state_room_temp": "solid", "common_uses": ["Electrical wiring", "Pipes and plumbing", "Alloys (brass, bronze)", "Coins", "Cookware"]}}

{"explanation": "Copper hydroxide, Cu(OH)₂, is the hydroxide of copper with the chemical formula Cu(OH)₂, a pale greenish-blue or bluish-green solid.", "urdu_meaning": "کاپر ہائیڈروآکسائیڈ", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Copper hydroxide is often used as a fungicide and nematicide in agriculture.", "properties": {"formula": "Cu(OH)₂", "molar_mass": "97.561 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Harmful if swallowed", "Skin and eye irritant", "Toxic to aquatic life"]}}

{"explanation": "Cream of tartar, chemically known as potassium bitartrate, is a byproduct of winemaking and is used in cooking as a leavening agent and stabilizer.", "urdu_meaning": "کریم آف ٹارٹر - پوٹاشیم بائی ٹارٹریٹ", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Cream of tartar is often added to egg whites to stabilize them and increase their volume when whipped.", "properties": {"formula": "KC₄H₅O₆", "molar_mass": "188.18 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Generally recognized as safe (GRAS)", "Can act as a laxative in large doses"]}}

{"explanation": "Detergent properties refer to the characteristics of detergents, such as their ability to lower surface tension, emulsify oils, and suspend dirt particles in water.", "urdu_meaning": "ڈیٹرجنٹ خصوصیات - صفائی کی صلاحیتیں", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "The excellent detergent properties of synthetic surfactants make them effective in hard water.", "properties": {"describes": "The cleaning effectiveness of a detergent, including its ability to interact with both oil and water.", "related_concepts": ["surfactants", "emulsification", "micelles", "surface tension", "hydrophilic", "hydrophobic"], "example_of_use": "Evaluating the detergent properties of a new laundry soap formulation for stain removal.", "measurement_type": "Surface tension measurement, washing tests"}}

{"explanation": "Digestion is the biochemical process of breaking down large insoluble food molecules into smaller water-soluble food molecules so that they can be absorbed into the watery blood plasma.", "urdu_meaning": "ہاضمہ - خوراک کو توڑنے کا عمل", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Enzymes like pepsin and amylase play crucial roles in the chemical digestion of proteins and carbohydrates.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Breakdown of complex food molecules into simpler, absorbable units through mechanical and chemical (enzymatic) means.", "related_concepts": ["enzymes", "acids (stomach acid)", "absorption", "metabolism", "nutrients"], "real_world_example": "The human digestive system breaking down a meal into glucose, amino acids, and fatty acids."}}

{"explanation": "Dilute sulfuric acid is a solution of sulfuric acid (H₂SO₄) in water at a lower concentration, still acidic but less corrosive and reactive than concentrated sulfuric acid.", "urdu_meaning": "ہلکا سلفیورک ایسڈ - کم ارتکاز والا سلفیورک تیزاب", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Dilute sulfuric acid is used as an electrolyte in lead-acid batteries.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A solution of H₂SO₄ where water is the major component, exhibiting acidic properties.", "related_concepts": ["sulfuric acid", "concentration", "acids", "pH", "electrolyte"], "real_world_example": "Used in laboratories for various reactions, battery electrolyte, cleaning agent for metals."}}

{"explanation": "Dish soap, or dishwashing liquid, is a detergent used to assist in dishwashing, primarily for breaking down grease and food residues.", "urdu_meaning": "برتن دھونے کا صابن - برتن دھونے کا مائع", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Dish soap contains surfactants that help to lift grease from dishes and allow it to be washed away with water.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Utilizes surfactants to reduce surface tension and emulsify fats and oils for cleaning.", "related_concepts": ["detergents", "surfactants", "emulsification", "micelles", "hydrophilic", "hydrophobic"], "real_world_example": "Brands like Dawn, Fairy, Palmolive used for manual dishwashing."}}

{"explanation": "Ecosystems are complex networks or interconnected systems of living organisms (biotic) and their physical environment (abiotic components) interacting as a unit.", "urdu_meaning": "ماحولیاتی نظام - جانداروں اور ماحول کا باہمی ربط", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The introduction of pollutants can severely disrupt the chemical balance within aquatic ecosystems.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Interacting system of biotic and abiotic components in a particular area.", "related_concepts": ["biodiversity", "food webs", "nutrient cycles", "environmental chemistry", "pollution"], "real_world_example": "A forest, a lake, a coral reef, or even a small pond."}}

{"explanation": "Environmental science is an interdisciplinary academic field that integrates physical, biological, and information sciences (including ecology, biology, physics, chemistry, zoology, mineralogy, oceanology, limnology, soil science, geology, atmospheric science, and geodesy) to the study of the environment, and the solution of environmental problems.", "urdu_meaning": "ماحولیاتی سائنس - ماحول اور ماحولیاتی مسائل کا علم", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Environmental science plays a crucial role in understanding the impact of acid rain on various ecosystems.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Scientific study of the environment and human impact on it.", "related_concepts": ["ecology", "pollution", "climate change", "conservation", "sustainability", "chemistry"], "real_world_example": "Researching the effects of pesticides on water quality, developing renewable energy solutions."}}

{"explanation": "A fatty acid is a carboxylic acid with a long aliphatic chain, which is either saturated or unsaturated, and is a key component of lipids.", "urdu_meaning": "فیٹی ایسڈ - لمبی زنجیر والا کاربوکسائلک تیزاب", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Saponification involves the hydrolysis of triglycerides to produce glycerol and salts of fatty acids (soap).", "properties": {"formula": "R-COOH (R = long alkyl chain)", "molar_mass": "Varies depending on chain length", "state_room_temp": "Varies (liquid or solid)", "hazards": ["Generally non-toxic in food context", "Some can be irritants in pure form"]}}

{"explanation": "Fatty acids are carboxylic acids with long aliphatic chains, serving as building blocks for fats and oils (lipids) in living organisms.", "urdu_meaning": "فیٹی ایسڈز - چکنائی بنانے والے تیزاب", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The properties of fats and oils are determined by the types of fatty acids they contain.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Long-chain carboxylic acids, essential components of lipids like triglycerides and phospholipids.", "related_concepts": ["lipids", "triglycerides", "saponification", "saturated fats", "unsaturated fats", "metabolism"], "real_world_example": "Omega-3 fatty acids found in fish oil, palmitic acid in palm oil."}}

{"explanation": "Fertilizer production involves industrial chemical processes to manufacture substances that supply essential nutrients like nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium to plants, enhancing their growth.", "urdu_meaning": "کھاد کی پیداوار - پودوں کے لیے غذائی اجزاء بنانے کا عمل", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "The Haber-Bosch process is a key step in fertilizer production for synthesizing ammonia from nitrogen and hydrogen.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Manufacturing chemical compounds rich in plant nutrients (N, P, K).", "related_concepts": ["ammonia", "nitric acid", "phosphoric acid", "potassium salts", "Haber-Bosch process", "chemical synthesis"], "real_world_example": "Production of ammonium nitrate, urea, superphosphate, and potash fertilizers."}}

{"explanation": "Gold is a chemical element with symbol Au and atomic number 79, a bright, slightly orange-yellow, dense, soft, malleable, and ductile metal in its purest form.", "urdu_meaning": "سونا - ایک قیمتی دھات", "term_type": "element", "example_sentence": "Gold is highly unreactive and does not tarnish, making it valuable for jewelry and electronics.", "properties": {"symbol": "Au", "atomic_number": 79, "category": "metal", "state_room_temp": "solid", "common_uses": ["Jewelry", "Electronics (connectors)", "Coins", "Dentistry", "Catalysis"]}}

{"explanation": "Grease is a semisolid lubricant, generally consisting of a soap emulsified with mineral or vegetable oil, often causing blockages in drains that require chemical cleaners.", "urdu_meaning": "چکنائی - نیم ٹھوس چکنا کرنے والا مادہ", "term_type": "other", "example_sentence": "Caustic drain cleaners are effective at breaking down grease buildup in pipes through saponification.", "properties": {"description": "A thick, oily substance, often a mixture of triglycerides or petroleum-derived hydrocarbons.", "contextual_relevance": "In drain cleaning, grease is a common organic blockage that can be saponified by alkaline cleaners. In lubrication, it reduces friction."}}

{"explanation": "Hair is a protein filament that grows from follicles found in the dermis, primarily composed of keratin, and can contribute to drain blockages.", "urdu_meaning": "بال - پروٹین کا ریشہ", "term_type": "other", "example_sentence": "Chemical drain cleaners often work by breaking down the protein structure of hair.", "properties": {"description": "Biological material made mainly of keratin protein.", "contextual_relevance": "A common component of drain clogs, targeted by chemical drain cleaners that can hydrolyze proteins."}}

{"explanation": "HCl, or hydrochloric acid, is a strong corrosive acid, a solution of hydrogen chloride gas in water, widely used in industry and laboratories.", "urdu_meaning": "ایچ سی ایل - ہائیڈروکلورک ایسڈ", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "HCl is produced in the stomach to aid in the digestion of food.", "properties": {"formula": "HCl", "molar_mass": "36.46 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "liquid (aqueous solution)", "hazards": ["Corrosive", "Causes severe burns", "Respiratory irritant (fumes)"]}}

{"explanation": "Heartburn is a burning sensation in the chest, just behind the breastbone or in the epigastrium, usually caused by stomach acid backing up into the esophagus.", "urdu_meaning": "سینے کی جلن - معدے کی تیزابیت کا உணர்வு", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Antacids are commonly used to relieve heartburn by neutralizing excess stomach acid.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Discomfort caused by acid reflux into the esophagus.", "related_concepts": ["acid reflux", "stomach acid (HCl)", "esophagus", "antacids", "pH"], "real_world_example": "Experiencing a burning chest pain after eating spicy or fatty foods."}}

{"explanation": "HNO₃, nitric acid, is a highly corrosive mineral acid, a colorless liquid that is a strong oxidizing agent.", "urdu_meaning": "ایچ این او تھری - نائٹرک ایسڈ", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Nitric acid (HNO₃) is used in the production of fertilizers, explosives, and nylon.", "properties": {"formula": "HNO₃", "molar_mass": "63.01 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "liquid", "hazards": ["Highly corrosive", "Strong oxidizing agent", "Causes severe burns", "Toxic fumes"]}}

{"explanation": "Hydrochloric acid is a strong, corrosive acid formed by dissolving hydrogen chloride gas in water, used in various industrial applications and naturally present in stomach acid.", "urdu_meaning": "ہائیڈروکلورک ایسڈ", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Industrially, hydrochloric acid is used for pickling steel and producing various chemical compounds.", "properties": {"formula": "HCl(aq)", "molar_mass": "36.46 g/mol (of HCl)", "state_room_temp": "liquid (aqueous solution)", "hazards": ["Corrosive", "Causes severe skin burns and eye damage", "Respiratory irritant"]}}

{"explanation": "Hydrogen carbonates, also known as bicarbonates, are salts containing the HCO₃⁻ anion, which can act as weak bases or acids.", "urdu_meaning": "ہائیڈروجن کاربونیٹس - بائی کاربونیٹس", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Sodium hydrogen carbonate (sodium bicarbonate) is commonly known as baking soda.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Salts containing the HCO₃⁻ ion, capable of neutralizing acids and acting as buffers.", "related_concepts": ["carbonates", "acids", "bases", "pH", "buffers", "sodium bicarbonate"], "real_world_example": "Baking soda used in cooking and as an antacid; bicarbonate buffer system in blood."}}

{"explanation": "Hydrogen gas (H₂) is a colorless, odorless, tasteless, highly flammable diatomic gas, the lightest and most abundant chemical substance in the universe.", "urdu_meaning": "ہائیڈروجن گیس - کائنات کی سب سے ہلکی گیس", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Hydrogen gas is produced when reactive metals like zinc react with dilute acids.", "properties": {"formula": "H₂", "molar_mass": "2.016 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "gas", "hazards": ["Extremely flammable", "Explosive mixtures with air"]}}

{"explanation": "H₂SO₄, sulfuric acid, is a highly corrosive strong mineral acid, a colorless to slightly yellow viscous liquid that is soluble in water at all concentrations.", "urdu_meaning": "ایچ ٹو ایس او فور - سلفیورک ایسڈ", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Concentrated H₂SO₄ is a powerful dehydrating agent and is used extensively in the chemical industry.", "properties": {"formula": "H₂SO₄", "molar_mass": "98.079 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "liquid", "hazards": ["Highly corrosive", "Causes severe burns", "Strong dehydrating agent", "Oxidizing agent (when concentrated and hot)"]}}

{"explanation": "H₃PO₄, phosphoric acid (also known as orthophosphoric acid), is a weak mineral acid, commonly encountered as an aqueous solution, and used in fertilizers, detergents, and as a food additive.", "urdu_meaning": "ایچ تھری پی او فور - فاسفورک ایسڈ", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "H₃PO₄ gives a tangy or sour taste to some soft drinks.", "properties": {"formula": "H₃PO₄", "molar_mass": "97.994 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid (pure), liquid (aqueous solution)", "hazards": ["Corrosive (concentrated solutions)", "Skin and eye irritant"]}}

{"explanation": "Industrial chemistry is the branch of chemistry that applies chemical principles and processes to manufacturing useful products on a large scale.", "urdu_meaning": "صنعتی کیمیا - صنعتی پیمانے پر کیمیائی پیداوار کا علم", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The Haber-Bosch process for ammonia synthesis is a cornerstone of industrial chemistry, vital for fertilizer production.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Large-scale production of chemicals and materials using efficient and economical chemical processes.", "related_concepts": ["chemical engineering", "process chemistry", "scale-up", "catalysis", "raw materials", "synthesis"], "real_world_example": "Manufacturing of plastics, pharmaceuticals, fertilizers, fuels, and other bulk chemicals."}}

{"explanation": "KCl, potassium chloride, is a metal halide salt composed of potassium and chlorine, an odorless white or colorless vitreous crystal.", "urdu_meaning": "کے سی ایل - پوٹاشیم کلورائیڈ", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "KCl is used as a fertilizer, in medicine, and as a salt substitute.", "properties": {"formula": "KCl", "molar_mass": "74.551 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Generally non-toxic in small amounts", "Can cause hyperkalemia in large doses"]}}

{"explanation": "KOH, potassium hydroxide, is an inorganic compound, a strong alkali (base), also known as caustic potash.", "urdu_meaning": "کے او ایچ - پوٹاشیم ہائیڈروآکسائیڈ", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "KOH is used in the manufacturing of soft soaps and as an electrolyte in alkaline batteries.", "properties": {"formula": "KOH", "molar_mass": "56.106 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Highly corrosive", "Causes severe skin burns and eye damage", "Hygroscopic"]}}

{"explanation": "Limewater is the common name for a dilute aqueous solution of calcium hydroxide, which is basic in nature.", "urdu_meaning": "چونے کا پانی - کیلشیم ہائیڈروآکسائیڈ کا محلول", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Bubbling carbon dioxide through limewater causes it to turn milky due to the precipitation of calcium carbonate.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A saturated or near-saturated solution of Ca(OH)₂ in water, exhibiting alkaline properties.", "related_concepts": ["calcium hydroxide", "calcium carbonate", "carbon dioxide test", "alkalinity", "solubility"], "real_world_example": "Used in laboratories to detect CO₂, in food preparation (nixtamalization), and historically for medicinal purposes."}}

{"explanation": "Magnesium is a chemical element with symbol Mg and atomic number 12, an alkaline earth metal, and the eighth-most-abundant element in the Earth's crust.", "urdu_meaning": "میگنیشیم - ایک دھات", "term_type": "element", "example_sentence": "Magnesium reacts with steam to produce magnesium oxide and hydrogen gas.", "properties": {"symbol": "Mg", "atomic_number": 12, "category": "metal (alkaline earth)", "state_room_temp": "solid", "common_uses": ["Alloys (lightweight construction)", "Flares and pyrotechnics", "Dietary supplement", "Sacrificial anodes"]}}

{"explanation": "Metal carbonates are salts containing a metal cation and the carbonate anion (CO₃²⁻), often insoluble in water unless they are alkali metal carbonates.", "urdu_meaning": "دھاتی کاربونیٹس - کاربونیٹ اینائن والے دھاتی نمکیات", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Many metal carbonates, such as calcium carbonate, decompose upon heating to produce a metal oxide and carbon dioxide.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Ionic compounds formed between metal cations and the carbonate ion (CO₃²⁻).", "related_concepts": ["carbonates", "salts", "acids (reaction with)", "thermal decomposition", "metal oxides"], "real_world_example": "Calcium carbonate (limestone, chalk), sodium carbonate (washing soda), magnesium carbonate (antacids)."}}

{"explanation": "Metal extraction is the process of obtaining metals from their ores through various chemical and physical methods, such as smelting, electrolysis, or chemical reduction.", "urdu_meaning": "دھات کا حصول - کچ دھات سے دھات نکالنے کا عمل", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Electrolysis is a common method for metal extraction of highly reactive metals like aluminum.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Separating and purifying metals from their naturally occurring compounds (ores).", "related_concepts": ["ores", "metallurgy", "reduction", "oxidation", "smelting", "electrolysis", "roasting"], "real_world_example": "Extraction of iron from iron ore (hematite) in a blast furnace, extraction of aluminum from bauxite."}}

{"explanation": "Metal oxides are chemical compounds that contain at least one oxygen atom and one other element that is a metal in its chemical formula.", "urdu_meaning": "دھاتی آکسائیڈ - آکسیجن اور دھات کے مرکبات", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Basic metal oxides react with acids to form salt and water.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Compounds formed by the reaction of metals with oxygen.", "related_concepts": ["oxides", "metals", "oxygen", "acid-base properties (basic, acidic, amphoteric)", "corrosion"], "real_world_example": "Iron(III) oxide (rust), calcium oxide (quicklime), aluminum oxide (alumina)."}}

{"explanation": "MgCl₂, magnesium chloride, is an ionic halide salt of magnesium and chlorine, highly soluble in water.", "urdu_meaning": "ایم جی سی ایل ٹو - میگنیشیم کلورائیڈ", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "MgCl₂ is used as a de-icing agent and in the production of magnesium metal.", "properties": {"formula": "MgCl₂", "molar_mass": "95.211 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Irritant (especially to eyes)", "Hygroscopic"]}}

{"explanation": "Mineral deposits are naturally occurring concentrations of minerals in the Earth's crust that are of economic interest, often serving as ores for metal extraction.", "urdu_meaning": "معدنی ذخائر - زمین میں معدنیات کا اجتماع", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Large mineral deposits of copper ore are mined to extract copper metal.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Geological formations containing significant amounts of one or more minerals.", "related_concepts": ["minerals", "ores", "geology", "mining", "metal extraction"], "real_world_example": "Iron ore deposits, bauxite (aluminum ore) deposits, gold veins."}}

{"explanation": "NaNO₃, sodium nitrate, is an alkali metal nitrate salt also known as Chile saltpeter, a white solid which is very soluble in water.", "urdu_meaning": "این اے این او تھری - سوڈیم نائٹریٹ", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "NaNO₃ is used as a food preservative and in the production of fertilizers and explosives.", "properties": {"formula": "NaNO₃", "molar_mass": "84.9947 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Oxidizing agent", "Can be harmful if ingested in large amounts"]}}

{"explanation": "Na₂CO₃, sodium carbonate, also known as washing soda or soda ash, is an inorganic compound, the water-soluble sodium salt of carbonic acid.", "urdu_meaning": "این اے ٹو سی او تھری - سوڈیم کاربونیٹ", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Na₂CO₃ is used in the manufacture of glass, detergents, and as a water softener.", "properties": {"formula": "Na₂CO₃", "molar_mass": "105.9888 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Irritant (skin and eyes)", "Alkaline in solution"]}}

{"explanation": "Neutral compounds are chemical substances that are neither acidic nor basic in aqueous solution, typically having a pH around 7.", "urdu_meaning": "غیر جانبدار مرکبات - نہ تیزابی نہ اساسی مرکبات", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Pure water and sodium chloride solution are examples of neutral compounds or solutions.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Do not significantly produce H⁺ or OH⁻ ions in water, or produce them in equal measure.", "related_concepts": ["acids", "bases", "pH", "neutralization", "salts (some)", "water"], "real_world_example": "Distilled water, table salt (NaCl) solution."}}

{"explanation": "Neutralization reactions are chemical reactions in which an acid and a base react quantitatively with each other to form a salt and usually water, resulting in a solution that is closer to neutral pH.", "urdu_meaning": "بے اثر کرنے والے تعاملات - تیزاب اور اساس کا ردعمل", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "The reaction between hydrochloric acid (HCl) and sodium hydroxide (NaOH) is a classic neutralization reaction, producing sodium chloride (NaCl) and water (H₂O).", "properties": {"key_principle": "Acid + Base → Salt + Water. The H⁺ ions from the acid combine with OH⁻ ions from the base.", "related_concepts": ["acids", "bases", "salts", "water", "pH", "titration", "stoichiometry"], "real_world_example": "Using antacids (bases) to neutralize excess stomach acid; treating acidic industrial waste with lime (a base)."}}

{"explanation": "NH₃, ammonia, is a compound of nitrogen and hydrogen, a colorless gas with a characteristic pungent odor, and is a common nitrogenous waste, particularly among aquatic organisms.", "urdu_meaning": "این ایچ تھری - امونیا", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "NH₃ is a key ingredient in the production of fertilizers and many cleaning products.", "properties": {"formula": "NH₃", "molar_mass": "17.031 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "gas", "hazards": ["Toxic", "Corrosive", "Irritant", "Forms alkaline solution in water"]}}

{"explanation": "NH₄Cl, ammonium chloride, is an inorganic compound, an ionic salt of ammonia and hydrochloric acid, which is a white crystalline solid, highly soluble in water.", "urdu_meaning": "این ایچ فور سی ایل - امونیم کلورائیڈ", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "NH₄Cl is used as an expectorant in cough medicine and as a flux in soldering.", "properties": {"formula": "NH₄Cl", "molar_mass": "53.491 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Irritant", "Harmful if swallowed in large quantities"]}}

{"explanation": "Ocean acidification is the ongoing decrease in the pH of the Earth's oceans, caused by the uptake of carbon dioxide (CO₂) from the atmosphere.", "urdu_meaning": "سمندری تیزابیت - سمندروں کی پی ایچ میں کمی", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Ocean acidification poses a serious threat to marine organisms with calcium carbonate shells, such as corals and shellfish.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Dissolution of atmospheric CO₂ into seawater, forming carbonic acid and lowering ocean pH.", "related_concepts": ["carbon dioxide", "carbonic acid", "pH", "calcium carbonate", "marine ecosystems", "climate change"], "real_world_example": "Difficulty for corals to build their skeletons, impacting reef ecosystems."}}

{"explanation": "Organic materials are substances derived from living organisms or contain carbon-hydrogen bonds, often forming complex structures and including materials like wood, cotton, and food waste.", "urdu_meaning": "نامیاتی مواد - جانداروں سے حاصل شدہ یا کاربن پر مشتمل مواد", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Many drain blockages are caused by the accumulation of organic materials like hair and grease.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Carbon-containing compounds, typically originating from living matter or synthetically produced with carbon backbones.", "related_concepts": ["carbon", "hydrocarbons", "proteins", "carbohydrates", "lipids", "biodegradation"], "real_world_example": "Food scraps, hair, paper, wood, cotton, plastics."}}

{"explanation": "Platinum is a chemical element with symbol Pt and atomic number 78, a dense, malleable, ductile, highly unreactive, precious, silverish-white transition metal.", "urdu_meaning": "پلاٹینم - ایک قیمتی دھات", "term_type": "element", "example_sentence": "Platinum is used as a catalyst in catalytic converters to reduce harmful emissions from vehicles.", "properties": {"symbol": "Pt", "atomic_number": 78, "category": "metal (transition)", "state_room_temp": "solid", "common_uses": ["Catalytic converters", "Jewelry", "Laboratory equipment", "Electrodes", "Cancer drugs"]}}

{"explanation": "Potassium hydroxide (KOH) is a strong inorganic base, also known as caustic potash, used in various industrial applications such as soap manufacturing and biodiesel production.", "urdu_meaning": "پوٹاشیم ہائیڈروآکسائیڈ - کاسٹک پوٹاش", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Potassium hydroxide is highly corrosive and can cause severe burns upon contact with skin.", "properties": {"formula": "KOH", "molar_mass": "56.106 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Highly corrosive", "Causes severe skin burns and eye damage", "Toxic if ingested"]}}

{"explanation": "Protein folding is the physical process by which a polypeptide chain acquires its native three-dimensional structure, a conformation that is usually biologically functional.", "urdu_meaning": "پروٹین فولڈنگ - پروٹین کا سہ جہتی ساخت اختیار کرنا", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Misfolding of proteins can lead to various diseases, highlighting the importance of correct protein folding.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A polypeptide chain spontaneously or with assistance (chaperones) folds into a specific, functional 3D shape.", "related_concepts": ["proteins", "amino acids", "polypeptide", "secondary structure", "tertiary structure", "quaternary structure", "denaturation"], "real_world_example": "Enzymes achieving their active site conformation through proper folding."}}

{"explanation": "Reaction rate, or rate of reaction, is the speed at which a chemical reaction takes place, defined as proportional to the increase in the concentration of a product per unit time and to the decrease in the concentration of a reactant per unit time.", "urdu_meaning": "ردعمل کی شرح - کیمیائی تعامل کی رفتار", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "Increasing the temperature generally increases the reaction rate of a chemical process.", "properties": {"describes": "The change in concentration of reactants or products over time.", "related_concepts": ["kinetics", "activation energy", "catalyst", "concentration", "temperature", "collision theory"], "example_of_use": "Measuring how quickly a reactant is consumed to determine the reaction rate.", "measurement_type": "Spectroscopy, pressure change, concentration monitoring"}}

{"explanation": "Reactive metals are metals that readily undergo chemical reactions with other substances, such as oxygen, water, or acids, often losing electrons to form positive ions.", "urdu_meaning": "فعال دھاتیں - آسانی سے ردعمل کرنے والی دھاتیں", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Alkali metals like sodium and potassium are highly reactive metals that react vigorously with water.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Metals that have a high tendency to lose electrons (oxidize) and participate in chemical reactions.", "related_concepts": ["activity series", "alkali metals", "alkaline earth metals", "oxidation", "reduction", "corrosion"], "real_world_example": "Sodium reacting with water, iron rusting in moist air, magnesium burning in air."}}

{"explanation": "Salt, in chemistry, is an ionic compound that results from the neutralization reaction of an acid and a base, consisting of a cation from a base and an anion from an acid.", "urdu_meaning": "نمک - تیزاب اور اساس کے تعامل سے بننے والا آئنی مرکب", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Sodium chloride (NaCl), common table salt, is formed from the reaction of hydrochloric acid and sodium hydroxide.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Ionic compound formed from the reaction of an acid and a base.", "related_concepts": ["ionic compounds", "acids", "bases", "neutralization", "cations", "anions", "electrolytes"], "real_world_example": "Table salt (NaCl), Epsom salt (MgSO₄), baking soda (NaHCO₃ - also a salt)."}}

{"explanation": "Salts are ionic compounds composed of positively charged ions (cations) and negatively charged ions (anions) such that the product is electrically neutral (without a net charge). They are typically formed from the reaction between an acid and a base.", "urdu_meaning": "نمکیات - آئنی مرکبات جو تیزاب اور اساس سے بنتے ہیں", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Many salts, like potassium nitrate and ammonium phosphate, are used as fertilizers.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Ionic compounds consisting of cations (not H⁺) and anions (not OH⁻ or O²⁻, generally).", "related_concepts": ["ionic bonding", "acids", "bases", "neutralization", "electrolytes", "solubility rules"], "real_world_example": "Sodium chloride (table salt), calcium carbonate (limestone), copper(II) sulfate (used as a fungicide)."}}

{"explanation": "Saponification is a process that involves the hydrolysis of fats or oils (triglycerides) with a strong alkali (like NaOH or KOH) to produce glycerol and a salt of a fatty acid, which is soap.", "urdu_meaning": "صابن سازی - چکنائی سے صابن بنانے کا عمل", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "The saponification reaction is essential for the traditional method of soap making.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Base-promoted hydrolysis of an ester (specifically a triglyceride) to yield an alcohol (glycerol) and a carboxylate salt (soap).", "related_concepts": ["esters", "hydrolysis", "triglycerides", "fatty acids", "alkalis", "soap", "glycerol"], "real_world_example": "Making soap by reacting animal fat or vegetable oil with lye (sodium hydroxide)."}}

{"explanation": "Silver is a chemical element with symbol Ag and atomic number 47, a soft, white, lustrous transition metal, it exhibits the highest electrical conductivity, thermal conductivity, and reflectivity of any metal.", "urdu_meaning": "چاندی - ایک قیمتی دھات", "term_type": "element", "example_sentence": "Silver is used in jewelry, tableware, and photographic films due to its unique properties.", "properties": {"symbol": "Ag", "atomic_number": 47, "category": "metal (transition)", "state_room_temp": "solid", "common_uses": ["Jewelry", "Coins", "Electronics", "Photography (silver halides)", "Antimicrobial agent"]}}

{"explanation": "Soap is a salt of a fatty acid used in a variety of cleansing and lubricating products, typically made by reacting fats or oils with an alkali.", "urdu_meaning": "صابن - صفائی کے لیے استعمال ہونے والا مادہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Soap molecules have a hydrophilic head and a hydrophobic tail, allowing them to emulsify oils and dirt.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A cleansing agent made from natural fats/oils and an alkali, working by emulsifying grease.", "related_concepts": ["saponification", "fatty acids", "alkalis", "surfactants", "micelles", "emulsification"], "real_world_example": "Bar soap used for handwashing, laundry soap (older types)."}}

{"explanation": "Sodium acetate (CH₃COONa) is the sodium salt of acetic acid, a colorless deliquescent salt with a wide range of uses including as a food additive and in heating pads.", "urdu_meaning": "سوڈیم ایسیٹیٹ", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Supersaturated solutions of sodium acetate can be used in reusable heating pads due to their exothermic crystallization.", "properties": {"formula": "CH₃COONa", "molar_mass": "82.0343 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Mild irritant", "Generally recognized as safe (GRAS)"]}}

{"explanation": "Sodium bicarbonate (NaHCO₃), commonly known as baking soda, is a chemical compound that is a white solid crystalline but often appears as a fine powder. It has a slightly salty, alkaline taste.", "urdu_meaning": "سوڈیم بائی کاربونیٹ - بیکنگ سوڈا", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Sodium bicarbonate is used as a leavening agent in baking because it releases CO₂ when it reacts with an acid or is heated.", "properties": {"formula": "NaHCO₃", "molar_mass": "84.007 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Generally non-toxic", "Can cause electrolyte imbalance if ingested in very large amounts"]}}

{"explanation": "Sodium hydroxide (NaOH), also known as lye or caustic soda, is a highly caustic metallic base and alkali salt, available in pellets, flakes, granules, and as prepared solutions at a number of different concentrations.", "urdu_meaning": "سوڈیم ہائیڈروآکسائیڈ - کاسٹک سوڈا", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Sodium hydroxide is a common ingredient in drain cleaners due to its ability to dissolve grease and hair.", "properties": {"formula": "NaOH", "molar_mass": "39.997 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Highly corrosive", "Causes severe skin burns and eye damage", "Toxic if ingested", "Reacts exothermically with water"]}}

{"explanation": "Vinegar is an aqueous solution of acetic acid and trace compounds that may include flavorings, produced through the fermentation of ethanol by acetic acid bacteria.", "urdu_meaning": "سرکہ - ایسیٹک ایسڈ کا آبی محلول", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The acidity of vinegar makes it useful for cleaning and as a food preservative.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A dilute solution of acetic acid (typically 4-7%) produced by fermentation.", "related_concepts": ["acetic acid", "fermentation", "acidity", "pH", "preservative"], "real_world_example": "White vinegar used for cleaning, apple cider vinegar used in cooking and for health purposes."}}

{"explanation": "Wastewater treatment is a process used to remove contaminants from wastewater or sewage and convert it into an effluent that can be returned to the water cycle with minimum impact on the environment, or directly reused.", "urdu_meaning": "گندے پانی کی صفائی - آلودہ پانی کو صاف کرنے کا عمل", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Chemical precipitation and pH adjustment are important steps in many wastewater treatment plants.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Removing physical, chemical, and biological contaminants from used water to make it safe for discharge or reuse.", "related_concepts": ["pollution", "water purification", "sedimentation", "filtration", "disinfection", "pH control", "coagulation"], "real_world_example": "Municipal sewage treatment plants, industrial effluent treatment facilities."}}

{"explanation": "Water (H₂O) is a transparent, odorless, tasteless liquid, a chemical substance that is the main constituent of Earth's streams, lakes, and oceans, and the fluids of most living organisms.", "urdu_meaning": "پانی - ایچ ٹو او", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Water acts as a universal solvent in many chemical reactions and biological processes.", "properties": {"formula": "H₂O", "molar_mass": "18.015 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "liquid", "hazards": ["Generally non-hazardous", "Drowning risk"]}}

{"explanation": "White powders in a chemistry context can refer to a wide variety of solid chemical compounds that appear white in color and finely divided, requiring careful identification due to potential hazards or specific reactivity.", "urdu_meaning": "سفید پاؤڈر - سفید رنگ کے ٹھوس کیمیائی مرکبات", "term_type": "other", "example_sentence": "Many common laboratory reagents, such as sodium chloride or sugar, are white powders.", "properties": {"description": "A physical description for many solid chemical substances.", "contextual_relevance": "In chemistry, many reagents, products, and reactants are white powders (e.g., NaCl, NaHCO₃, sugar). Identification often requires further chemical tests beyond visual appearance. Some white powders can be hazardous."}}

{"explanation": "Zinc is a chemical element with symbol Zn and atomic number 30, a bluish-white, lustrous, diamagnetic metal, that is somewhat brittle at room temperature but becomes malleable when heated.", "urdu_meaning": "جست - ایک دھات", "term_type": "element", "example_sentence": "Zinc is commonly used for galvanizing iron to prevent rusting.", "properties": {"symbol": "Zn", "atomic_number": 30, "category": "metal (transition, or sometimes post-transition)", "state_room_temp": "solid", "common_uses": ["Galvanizing steel", "Alloys (brass)", "Batteries (e.g., zinc-carbon)", "Dietary supplement"]}}

{"explanation": "Zinc granules are small pieces or pellets of zinc metal, often used in laboratories for reactions due to their increased surface area compared to larger chunks.", "urdu_meaning": "جست کے دانے - جست دھات کے چھوٹے ٹکڑے", "term_type": "other", "example_sentence": "Adding zinc granules to dilute hydrochloric acid produces hydrogen gas.", "properties": {"description": "A physical form of the element zinc, small pellets or grains.", "contextual_relevance": "Used in chemical reactions, particularly in laboratories, to provide a reactive surface area of zinc metal, e.g., for hydrogen generation with acids or in redox reactions."}}

{"explanation": "ZnSO₄, zinc sulfate, is an inorganic compound and dietary supplement, historically known as 'white vitriol'.", "urdu_meaning": "زیڈ این ایس او فور - زنک سلفیٹ", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "ZnSO₄ is used as a coagulant in the production of rayon and as a micronutrient in fertilizers.", "properties": {"formula": "ZnSO₄", "molar_mass": "161.47 g/mol (anhydrous)", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Irritant (skin and eyes)", "Harmful if swallowed in large amounts"]}}

{"explanation": "To absorb nutrients is the process by which organisms, particularly plants and animals, take in essential substances from their environment or food for growth and maintenance.", "urdu_meaning": "غذائی اجزاء جذب کرنا - ضروری مادوں کو جسم میں لینا", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Plant roots absorb nutrients like nitrates and phosphates from the soil, but acidic soil can hinder this process.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Uptake of essential chemical substances required for life processes from the surroundings or diet.", "related_concepts": ["nutrition", "digestion", "active transport", "diffusion", "plant roots", "soil chemistry"], "real_world_example": "Plant roots taking up minerals from soil; human intestines absorbing digested food molecules."}}

{"explanation": "To absorb nutrition refers to the biological process where digested food substances pass into the bloodstream and cells of an organism to provide energy and building materials.", "urdu_meaning": "غذائیت جذب کرنا - ہضم شدہ خوراک کو خون میں شامل کرنا", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Acid rain can leach essential minerals from the soil, making it harder for plants to absorb nutrition effectively.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The assimilation of nourishing substances by tissues after digestion.", "related_concepts": ["nutrients", "digestion", "metabolism", "bioavailability", "malnutrition"], "real_world_example": "The small intestine's role in absorbing vitamins, minerals, carbohydrates, fats, and proteins."}}

{"explanation": "Accelerated weathering is the more rapid breakdown and alteration of rocks, soils, and man-made materials at or near the Earth's surface due to intensified environmental factors, such as acid rain.", "urdu_meaning": "تیز رفتار موسمی شکست و ریخت - ماحولیاتی عوامل سے مواد کا تیزی سے ٹوٹنا", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Acid rain causes accelerated weathering of limestone buildings and statues.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Increased rate of chemical and physical breakdown of materials due to aggressive environmental conditions.", "related_concepts": ["weathering", "erosion", "acid rain", "chemical reactions", "pollution", "material degradation"], "real_world_example": "Rapid corrosion of metal structures in polluted industrial areas; faster dissolution of carbonate rocks by acid rain."}}

{"explanation": "Acid rain is precipitation, such as rain, snow, or fog, that is unusually acidic due to atmospheric pollutants like sulfur dioxide and nitrogen oxides released from burning fossil fuels.", "urdu_meaning": "تیزابی بارش - فضائی آلودگی سے تیزابی ہونے والی بارش", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The primary cause of acid rain is the emission of sulfur dioxide and nitrogen oxides from power plants and vehicles.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Precipitation with pH lower than normal rain (typically < 5.6) due to anthropogenic pollutants.", "related_concepts": ["pH", "sulfuric acid", "nitric acid", "sulfur dioxide", "nitrogen oxides", "fossil fuels", "environmental impact"], "real_world_example": "Damage to forests and lakes in regions downwind of industrial centers."}}

{"explanation": "Acid rain damage refers to the harmful effects caused by acid rain on natural ecosystems, man-made structures, and human health.", "urdu_meaning": "تیزابی بارش کا نقصان - تیزابی بارش سے ہونے والے مضر اثرات", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Acid rain damage to forests can include yellowing leaves and stunted growth of trees.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Negative consequences of acidic deposition on various environmental and material components.", "related_concepts": ["acid rain", "corrosion", "leaching", "soil acidification", "aquatic ecosystem damage", "plant health"], "real_world_example": "Corrosion of marble statues, death of fish in acidified lakes, reduced crop yields."}}

{"explanation": "Acid rain events are occurrences of precipitation (rain, snow, fog) with significantly high acidity levels, often linked to specific meteorological conditions and pollutant concentrations.", "urdu_meaning": "تیزابی بارش کے واقعات - شدید تیزابی بارش کا ہونا", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Monitoring stations track acid rain events to assess their frequency and severity in different regions.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Specific instances or periods of highly acidic precipitation.", "related_concepts": ["acid rain", "pH measurement", "atmospheric pollution", "meteorology", "environmental monitoring"], "real_world_example": "A period of several days with rainfall pH below 4.5 recorded in an industrial area."}}

{"explanation": "Acid rain formation is the chemical process by which sulfur dioxide (SO₂) and nitrogen oxides (NOx) in the atmosphere react with water, oxygen, and other chemicals to form sulfuric acid and nitric acid.", "urdu_meaning": "تیزابی بارش کی تشکیل - تیزابی بارش بننے کا کیمیائی عمل", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Understanding the chemistry of acid rain formation is crucial for developing strategies to reduce its occurrence.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Atmospheric chemical reactions converting SO₂ and NOx into H₂SO₄ and HNO₃, which then dissolve in water droplets.", "related_concepts": ["sulfur dioxide", "nitrogen oxides", "sulfuric acid", "nitric acid", "atmospheric chemistry", "oxidation", "photochemistry"], "real_world_example": "SO₂ released from coal burning reacts with atmospheric oxygen and water to form sulfuric acid."}}

{"explanation": "Acidic describes a substance that has the properties of an acid, such as a pH less than 7, the ability to donate protons, or turn blue litmus paper red.", "urdu_meaning": "تیزابی - تیزاب کی خصوصیات والا", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "Solutions with a pH value below 7 are considered acidic.", "properties": {"describes": "Having a pH < 7, or the ability to donate H⁺ ions or accept electrons.", "related_concepts": ["pH", "acids", "acidity", "hydrogen ion concentration", "litmus test"], "example_of_use": "Testing soil to see if it is too acidic for certain plants.", "measurement_type": "pH meter, indicators"}}

{"explanation": "Acidic compounds are chemical substances that, when dissolved in water, increase the concentration of hydrogen ions (H⁺), thereby lowering the pH.", "urdu_meaning": "تیزابی مرکبات - پانی میں ہائیڈروجن آئن بڑھانے والے مرکبات", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Sulfuric acid and nitric acid are strong acidic compounds responsible for acid rain.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Compounds that can donate protons or form H⁺ ions in solution.", "related_concepts": ["acids", "pH", "dissociation", "strong acids", "weak acids", "Bronsted-Lowry acid"], "real_world_example": "Acetic acid (in vinegar), citric acid (in lemons), hydrochloric acid (stomach acid)."}}

{"explanation": "Acidic deposition refers to the transfer of acidic pollutants from the atmosphere to the Earth's surface, occurring in both wet forms (acid rain, snow, fog) and dry forms (acidic gases and particles).", "urdu_meaning": "تیزابی جمعاؤ - تیزابی آلودگی کا زمین پر منتقل ہونا", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Acidic deposition can harm forests, soils, and aquatic ecosystems far from the original pollution source.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The process by which acidic components are deposited from the atmosphere onto surfaces.", "related_concepts": ["acid rain", "dry deposition", "wet deposition", "atmospheric pollution", "environmental transport"], "real_world_example": "Acidic sulfates and nitrates falling as dry particles or being washed out by rain."}}

{"explanation": "Acidic droplets are small liquid particles, such as those in fog or mist, that contain dissolved acidic compounds, resulting in a low pH.", "urdu_meaning": "تیزابی قطرے - تیزابی مرکبات پر مشتمل مائع ذرات", "term_type": "other", "example_sentence": "Inhaling acidic droplets in polluted air can cause respiratory problems.", "properties": {"description": "Microscopic liquid particles with acidic properties due to dissolved pollutants.", "contextual_relevance": "A form of wet acidic deposition (e.g., acid fog) that can directly impact plants, materials, and human health."}}

{"explanation": "Acidic particles are fine solid or liquid aerosols in the atmosphere that have acidic properties, often composed of sulfates or nitrates.", "urdu_meaning": "تیزابی ذرات - تیزابی خصوصیات والے ہوائی ذرات", "term_type": "other", "example_sentence": "Acidic particles contribute to dry deposition and can reduce visibility as haze.", "properties": {"description": "Small airborne particles (solid or aerosol) that are acidic.", "contextual_relevance": "Contribute to dry acidic deposition, can be inhaled causing health issues, and affect atmospheric chemistry and visibility."}}

{"explanation": "Acidic solutions are aqueous solutions that have a pH less than 7, meaning they have a higher concentration of hydrogen ions (H⁺) than hydroxide ions (OH⁻).", "urdu_meaning": "تیزابی محلول - پی ایچ 7 سے کم والے آبی محلول", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Acid rain forms acidic solutions when it falls into lakes and rivers, lowering their pH.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Solutions where [H⁺] > [OH⁻], resulting in pH < 7.", "related_concepts": ["pH", "acids", "hydrogen ion", "dissociation", "strong acids", "weak acids"], "real_world_example": "Lemon juice, vinegar, battery acid."}}

{"explanation": "Acidity is the measure of the concentration of acidic species, typically hydrogen ions (H⁺), in a substance or solution, often expressed using the pH scale.", "urdu_meaning": "تیزابیت - تیزابی اجزاء کی مقدار", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "The acidity of soil can affect nutrient availability for plants.", "properties": {"describes": "The level of acid character, specifically the concentration of hydrogen ions or the capacity to donate them.", "related_concepts": ["pH", "acids", "pKa", "hydrogen ion concentration", "buffer capacity"], "example_of_use": "Measuring the acidity of rainwater to determine if it qualifies as acid rain.", "measurement_type": "pH measurement, titration"}}

{"explanation": "Acids are chemical substances that increase the hydrogen ion (H⁺) concentration in a solution, typically having a pH below 7 and reacting with bases.", "urdu_meaning": "تیزاب - ہائیڈروجن آئن بڑھانے والے کیمیائی مادے", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Sulfuric acid and nitric acid are the main acids responsible for the environmental problem of acid rain.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Proton (H⁺) donors or substances that increase [H⁺] in water.", "related_concepts": ["pH", "bases", "neutralization", "strong acids", "weak acids", "acid rain"], "real_world_example": "Hydrochloric acid in stomach, acetic acid in vinegar, citric acid in fruits."}}

{"explanation": "Air pollutants are substances present in the atmosphere at concentrations high enough to cause harm to humans, other living organisms, ecosystems, or materials.", "urdu_meaning": "فضائی آلودگی پھیلانے والے مادے - ہوا کو آلودہ کرنے والے عناصر", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Sulfur dioxide and nitrogen oxides are key air pollutants that lead to the formation of acid rain.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Contaminants in the air that can have adverse effects.", "related_concepts": ["pollution", "smog", "acid rain", "greenhouse gases", "particulate matter", "emission sources"], "real_world_example": "Carbon monoxide from car exhaust, sulfur dioxide from industrial plants, ozone at ground level."}}

{"explanation": "Aluminum soluble refers to the state where aluminum ions (Al³⁺) are dissolved in a solution, a process often enhanced by acidic conditions.", "urdu_meaning": "ایلومینیم حل پذیر - حل شدہ ایلومینیم آئن", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "Acid rain can make aluminum soluble in soil, releasing toxic aluminum ions that can harm plant roots and aquatic life.", "properties": {"describes": "The ability of aluminum to dissolve, usually as Al³⁺ ions, in a solvent (typically water).", "related_concepts": ["aluminum", "solubility", "ions", "pH", "acid rain", "toxicity", "leaching"], "example_of_use": "Acidic conditions in soil can increase the concentration of soluble aluminum.", "measurement_type": "Concentration of Al³⁺ in solution"}}

{"explanation": "An aquatic ecosystem is a community of organisms that live in water, along with their physical and chemical environment, such as lakes, rivers, oceans, and wetlands.", "urdu_meaning": "آبی ماحولیاتی نظام - پانی میں رہنے والے جانداروں اور ان کے ماحول کا نظام", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Acid rain can severely damage an aquatic ecosystem by lowering the pH of the water and releasing toxic metals.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Interacting system of living organisms and non-living components within a water body.", "related_concepts": ["ecosystem", "water quality", "pH", "dissolved oxygen", "aquatic life", "pollution", "eutrophication"], "real_world_example": "A freshwater lake with its fish, plants, and microorganisms; a coral reef."}}

{"explanation": "Aquatic life refers to all living organisms, including plants, animals, and microorganisms, that inhabit water environments such as oceans, lakes, rivers, and ponds.", "urdu_meaning": "آبی حیات - پانی میں رہنے والے جاندار", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Lowered pH levels in lakes due to acid rain can be fatal to many forms of aquatic life.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Organisms adapted to live in water.", "related_concepts": ["aquatic ecosystem", "biodiversity", "fish", "invertebrates", "algae", "water quality", "pollution effects"], "real_world_example": "Fish, amphibians, aquatic insects, plankton, aquatic plants."}}

{"explanation": "The atmosphere is the layer of gases surrounding a planet, such as Earth, held in place by gravity and essential for supporting life.", "urdu_meaning": "فضا - زمین کے گرد گیسوں کا غلاف", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Pollutants released into the atmosphere can travel long distances before contributing to acid rain.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The envelope of gases surrounding a celestial body.", "related_concepts": ["air", "atmospheric chemistry", "weather", "climate", "pollution", "ozone layer"], "real_world_example": "Earth's atmosphere composed mainly of nitrogen and oxygen, which enables respiration and protects from solar radiation."}}

{"explanation": "Atmospheric moisture refers to water present in the atmosphere in various forms, such as water vapor, clouds, fog, rain, snow, sleet, or hail.", "urdu_meaning": "فضائی نمی - ہوا میں موجود پانی", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Acidic pollutants like SO₂ and NOx react with atmospheric moisture to form acid rain.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Water in its gaseous, liquid, or solid state within the Earth's atmosphere.", "related_concepts": ["water vapor", "humidity", "clouds", "precipitation", "hydrological cycle", "acid rain formation"], "real_world_example": "Water vapor that condenses to form clouds, leading to rainfall."}}

{"explanation": "Breakdown, in a chemical context, refers to the decomposition or dissociation of a substance into simpler components or constituent parts, often through chemical reactions.", "urdu_meaning": "ٹوٹ پھوٹ - مادے کا سادہ اجزاء میں تقسیم ہونا", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Acid rain accelerates the chemical breakdown of marble statues, which are made of calcium carbonate.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Decomposition of a complex substance into simpler ones.", "related_concepts": ["decomposition reaction", "hydrolysis", "oxidation", "weathering", "degradation"], "real_world_example": "The breakdown of organic matter by microorganisms; the breakdown of limestone by acidic water."}}

{"explanation": "Calcium (Ca) is a chemical element, an alkaline earth metal, essential for living organisms, particularly in cell physiology where movement of the Ca²⁺ ion into and out of the cytoplasm functions as a signal for many cellular processes.", "urdu_meaning": "کیلشیم - ایک کیمیائی عنصر", "term_type": "element", "example_sentence": "Acid rain can leach calcium from the soil, depleting this essential nutrient for plants.", "properties": {"symbol": "Ca", "atomic_number": 20, "category": "metal (alkaline earth)", "state_room_temp": "solid", "common_uses": ["Building materials (cement, mortar)", "Dietary supplement", "Alloying agent", "Reducing agent in metal extraction"]}}

{"explanation": "Calcium carbonate (CaCO₃) is a common chemical compound found in rocks (limestone, marble, chalk), shells of marine organisms, and eggs, which reacts with acids.", "urdu_meaning": "کیلشیم کاربونیٹ - چونے کا پتھر", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Buildings and statues made of calcium carbonate are susceptible to damage from acid rain.", "properties": {"formula": "CaCO₃", "molar_mass": "100.086 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Generally non-toxic", "Dust can be an irritant"]}}

{"explanation": "Chalk is a soft, white, porous sedimentary carbonate rock, a form of limestone composed of the mineral calcite (calcium carbonate).", "urdu_meaning": "چاک - کیلشیم کاربونیٹ کی ایک قسم", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Chalk cliffs are vulnerable to erosion by acid rain due to their calcium carbonate composition.", "properties": {"formula": "CaCO₃ (primarily)", "molar_mass": "~100.086 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "solid", "hazards": ["Non-toxic", "Dust can be an irritant"]}}

{"explanation": "A chemical equation is the symbolic representation of a chemical reaction in the form of symbols and formulae, wherein the reactant entities are given on the left-hand side and the product entities on the right-hand side.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی مساوات - کیمیائی تعامل کی علامتی نمائندگی", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The chemical equation for the formation of sulfuric acid in the atmosphere from sulfur trioxide and water is SO₃ + H₂O → H₂SO₄.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Symbolic representation of reactants, products, and stoichiometry of a chemical reaction.", "related_concepts": ["chemical reaction", "reactants", "products", "stoichiometry", "balancing equations", "conservation of mass"], "real_world_example": "2H₂ + O₂ → 2H₂O represents the formation of water from hydrogen and oxygen."}}

{"explanation": "Chemical reactions are processes that involve rearrangement of the molecular or ionic structure of a substance, as opposed to a change in physical form or a nuclear reaction.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی تعاملات - مادوں کی ساخت میں تبدیلی کے عوامل", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "The formation of acid rain involves a series of chemical reactions in the atmosphere between pollutants and water.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Transformation of one set of chemical substances (reactants) into another set (products) through the breaking and forming of chemical bonds.", "related_concepts": ["reactants", "products", "chemical equation", "kinetics", "thermodynamics", "catalysis", "activation energy"], "real_world_example": "Combustion of fuel, rusting of iron, photosynthesis."}}

{"explanation": "Chemicals are distinct compounds or substances that have been purified or prepared, especially artificially, and are characterized by a specific molecular structure and properties.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیکلز - مخصوص ساخت اور خصوصیات والے مرکبات", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Industrial processes release various chemicals into the atmosphere, some of which contribute to acid rain.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Substances with a defined chemical composition and structure.", "related_concepts": ["compounds", "elements", "mixtures", "chemical properties", "physical properties", "reactivity"], "real_world_example": "Water (H₂O), sodium chloride (NaCl), sulfuric acid (H₂SO₄)."}}

{"explanation": "Crayfish are freshwater crustaceans resembling small lobsters, whose exoskeletons made of calcium carbonate can be affected by acidic water conditions.", "urdu_meaning": "کریفش - میٹھے پانی کا کیکڑا نما جانور", "term_type": "other", "example_sentence": "Increased acidity in lakes due to acid rain can make it difficult for crayfish to build and maintain their exoskeletons.", "properties": {"description": "Freshwater crustaceans with calcium carbonate exoskeletons.", "contextual_relevance": "Biological indicators of water quality; their health and populations can be negatively impacted by acid rain, which affects calcium availability and shell formation."}}

{"explanation": "Dissolving is the process by which a solute (solid, liquid, or gas) mixes with a solvent (typically a liquid) to form a homogeneous mixture called a solution.", "urdu_meaning": "حل ہونا - کسی چیز کا محلول میں گھل جانا", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Acid rain contributes to the dissolving of minerals from rocks and soil.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A solute disperses uniformly into a solvent at a molecular or ionic level.", "related_concepts": ["solute", "solvent", "solution", "solubility", "concentration", "saturation"], "real_world_example": "Sugar dissolving in tea; salt dissolving in water; CO₂ dissolving in soda."}}

{"explanation": "Dry deposition is a process by which acidic pollutants in the atmosphere, such as gases (SO₂, NOx) and particles (sulfates, nitrates), settle onto surfaces directly without precipitation.", "urdu_meaning": "خشک جمعاؤ - بغیر بارش کے تیزابی آلودگی کا سطح پر جمنا", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Dry deposition of acidic particles can damage buildings and vegetation even in areas with infrequent rainfall.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Gravitational settling and direct transfer of atmospheric acidic gases and particles to surfaces.", "related_concepts": ["acidic deposition", "acid rain (wet deposition)", "atmospheric pollutants", "aerosols", "surface chemistry"], "real_world_example": "Acidic dust and sulfate particles settling on leaves, buildings, and water bodies."}}

{"explanation": "Emission reduction refers to the process or strategies aimed at decreasing the amount of pollutants, such as sulfur dioxide and nitrogen oxides, released into the atmosphere from various sources.", "urdu_meaning": "اخراج میں کمی - آلودگی پھیلانے والے مادوں کے اخراج کو کم کرنا", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Stricter environmental regulations have led to significant emission reduction from power plants, helping to mitigate acid rain.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Lowering the discharge of harmful substances into the environment, particularly the atmosphere.", "related_concepts": ["pollution control", "air pollutants", "scrubbers", "catalytic converters", "renewable energy", "environmental policy"], "real_world_example": "Installing flue-gas desulfurization systems in coal power plants; promoting the use of electric vehicles."}}

{"explanation": "Environmental damage refers to the deterioration of the environment through depletion of resources such as air, water and soil; the destruction of ecosystems and the extinction of wildlife.", "urdu_meaning": "ماحولیاتی نقصان - ماحول کو پہنچنے والا ضرر", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Acid rain causes significant environmental damage, including harm to forests, lakes, and wildlife.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Adverse changes or harm to the natural environment and its components.", "related_concepts": ["pollution", "acid rain", "deforestation", "habitat loss", "climate change", "ecosystem degradation"], "real_world_example": "Oil spills contaminating coastlines; deforestation leading to soil erosion and biodiversity loss; acid rain damaging aquatic ecosystems."}}

{"explanation": "Environmental impacts are the effects, whether adverse or beneficial, that human activities or natural events have on the environment.", "urdu_meaning": "ماحولیاتی اثرات - ماحول پر پڑنے والے نتائج", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The environmental impacts of acid rain include acidification of soils and water bodies, and damage to vegetation.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Changes to the environment resulting from specific actions or phenomena.", "related_concepts": ["environmental assessment", "pollution", "sustainability", "ecosystem health", "acid rain", "climate change"], "real_world_example": "Increased global temperatures due to greenhouse gas emissions; loss of biodiversity from habitat destruction."}}

{"explanation": "Environmental regulations are rules, laws, and policies established by governments to protect the environment and control activities that may cause pollution or harm to ecosystems.", "urdu_meaning": "ماحولیاتی ضوابط - ماحول کی حفاظت کے لیے حکومتی قوانین", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Environmental regulations often mandate limits on the emission of pollutants like sulfur dioxide to combat acid rain.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Legal and administrative measures designed to manage human impact on the environment.", "related_concepts": ["environmental law", "pollution control", "emission standards", "conservation", "sustainability", "EPA"], "real_world_example": "Clean Air Act in the USA, regulations on industrial waste disposal, vehicle emission standards."}}

{"explanation": "Environmental systems are complex, interrelated sets of natural components and processes, including ecosystems, biogeochemical cycles, and climate systems, that interact to form the Earth's environment.", "urdu_meaning": "ماحولیاتی نظام (بڑے پیمانے پر) - قدرتی اجزاء اور عوامل کا باہم مربوط مجموعہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Acid rain can disrupt the delicate balance of various environmental systems, affecting nutrient cycles and biodiversity.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Interconnected natural processes and components that constitute the environment.", "related_concepts": ["ecosystems", "biogeochemical cycles (carbon, nitrogen, water)", "climate", "hydrology", "geology"], "real_world_example": "The global carbon cycle, a watershed system, the Earth's climate system."}}
