The physical properties of alkanes, such as boiling points, generally increase with increasing molecular masses (longer carbon chains).", "urdu_meaning": "مالیکیولی کمیتیں - مالیکیول میں تمام ایٹموں کی کمیتوں کا مجموعہ", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "Alkanes with higher molecular masses have stronger London dispersion forces and thus higher boiling points.", "properties": {"describes": "The mass of a molecule, calculated as the sum of the atomic masses of its constituent atoms.", "related_concepts": ["alkanes", "hydrocarbons", "boiling points", "intermolecular forces", "atomic mass", "mole"], "example_of_use": "Ethane (C₂H₆) has a higher molecular mass than methane (CH₄).", "measurement_type": "Atomic mass units (amu) or grams per mole (g/mol)."}}

{"explanation": "Naphtha is a volatile, flammable liquid hydrocarbon mixture obtained from the fractional distillation of petroleum, consisting mainly of alkanes and cycloalkanes (typically C₅-C₁₂). {"explanation": "Nascent hydrogen refers to freshly generated atomic hydrogen (H) which is highly reactive. It can be produced by the reaction of a metal (like zinc) with an acid (like HCl) and is a powerful reducing agent used, for example, in the reduction of alkyl halides to alkanes.", "urdu_meaning": "نوزائیدہ ہائیڈروجن - تازہ پیدا شدہ انتہائی عامل ایٹمی ہائیڈروجن", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The reduction of ethyl bromide to ethane can be achieved using nascent hydrogen generated in situ from zinc and hydrochloric acid.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Highly reactive atomic hydrogen produced at the moment of its generation in a chemical reaction.", "related_concepts": ["reduction", "hydrogen", "atomic hydrogen", "alkyl halides (reduction of)", "zinc", "hydrochloric acid", "reducing agent"], "real_world_example": "Zn(s) + 2HCl(aq) → ZnCl₂(aq) + 2[H] (nascent hydrogen), which then reduces an organic substrate."}}

{"explanation": "Organic chemistry is the study of carbon-containing compounds, including hydrocarbons like alkanes, alkenes, and alkynes, and their synthesis, properties, and reactions (e.g., hydrogenation to form alkanes, cracking of alkanes).", "urdu_meaning": "نامیاتی کیمیا - کاربن پر مشتمل مرکبات کا علم", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The synthesis of alkanes from alkenes via catalytic hydrogenation is a fundamental reaction in organic chemistry.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The branch of chemistry focused on the structure, properties, composition, reactions, and preparation of carbon-containing compounds.", "related_concepts": ["hydrocarbons", "alkanes", "alkenes", "alkynes", "organic synthesis", "addition reactions", "hydrogenation", "cracking", "petroleum chemistry"], "real_world_example": "Developing new methods for synthesizing alkanes or converting them into other useful organic molecules."}}

{"explanation": "Oxidation is a chemical process involving the loss of electrons or an increase in oxidation state. While alkanes are generally resistant to oxidation by mild oxidizing agents, they undergo complete oxidation (combustion) with oxygen at high temperatures. Some partial oxidation processes are also industrially important.", "urdu_meaning": "تکسید - الیکٹران کھونے یا تکسیدی حالت میں اضافے کا عمل", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "The controlled oxidation of methane can produce methanol, a more valuable chemical, though complete oxidation to CO₂ and H₂O is more common.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A reaction involving an increase in oxidation state or loss of electrons.", "related_concepts": ["combustion (a type of oxidation)", "redox reactions", "alkanes", "oxidation states"], "real_world_example": "Burning of natural gas (methane) is an oxidation reaction."}}

{"explanation": "Oxidation states (or oxidation numbers) represent the degree of oxidation of an atom in a chemical compound. Carbon in alkanes typically has negative oxidation states due to being more electronegative than hydrogen. This changes during reactions like combustion.", "urdu_meaning": "تکسیدی حالتیں - کیمیائی مرکب میں ایٹم کی تکسید کی ڈگری", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "During the combustion of methane, the oxidation state of carbon increases from -4 in CH₄ to +4 in CO₂.", "properties": {"describes": "A number assigned to an element in a chemical combination which represents the number of electrons lost (or gained, if the number is negative) by an atom of that element in the compound.", "related_concepts": ["oxidation", "reduction", "redox reactions", "carbon", "alkanes", "electronegativity"], "example_of_use": "Assigning oxidation states helps track electron transfer in redox reactions involving hydrocarbons.", "measurement_type": "Integer or fractional value."}}

{"explanation": "Paul Sabatier was a French chemist who, with Jean-Baptiste Senderens, developed catalytic hydrogenation of organic compounds using finely divided metal catalysts (like nickel), a crucial method for synthesizing alkanes from alkenes/alkynes. He received the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1912.", "urdu_meaning": "پال سباتیئر - فرانسیسی کیمیا دان جس نے عمل انگیزی ہائیڈروجنیشن کا طریقہ تیار کیا", "term_type": "other", "example_sentence": "Paul Sabatier's discovery of catalytic hydrogenation using nickel revolutionized the synthesis of saturated compounds like alkanes.", "properties": {"description": "A French chemist awarded the Nobel Prize for his work on catalytic hydrogenation of organic compounds.", "contextual_relevance": "His work (Sabatier reaction) is fundamental to methods for alkane synthesis from unsaturated precursors and hydrogenation of oils."}}

{"explanation": "Petroleum (crude oil) is a complex mixture of hydrocarbons, primarily alkanes, that serves as the main source for obtaining alkanes used as fuels (gasoline, diesel) and chemical feedstocks, through refining processes like fractional distillation and cracking.", "urdu_meaning": "پیٹرولیم / خام تیل - ہائیڈروکاربن کا قدرتی آمیزہ، الکینز کا بڑا ذریعہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Most of the alkanes used in industry and as fuels are derived from the fractional distillation and cracking of petroleum.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A naturally occurring liquid fossil fuel composed mainly of hydrocarbons.", "related_concepts": ["crude oil", "fossil fuels", "hydrocarbons", "alkanes", "petroleum refining", "fractional distillation", "cracking", "gasoline", "diesel fuel", "naphtha"], "real_world_example": "The primary raw material for the petrochemical industry."}}

{"explanation": "The petroleum industry encompasses the global processes of exploration, extraction, refining (including fractional distillation and cracking of alkanes), transporting, and marketing petroleum products. {"explanation": "Petroleum refining involves separating crude oil (a mixture of alkanes and other hydrocarbons) into useful fractions (like gasoline, diesel) and converting some components into others (e.g., cracking large alkanes into smaller ones) to meet product demands.", "urdu_meaning": "پیٹرولیم صاف کرنا - خام تیل کو مفید مصنوعات میں تبدیل کرنے کا صنعتی عمل", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Catalytic cracking and fractional distillation are essential processes in petroleum refining for obtaining specific alkane fractions.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Industrial processes that transform crude oil into various fuels, lubricants, and chemical feedstocks.", "related_concepts": ["petroleum", "crude oil", "hydrocarbons", "alkanes", "fractional distillation", "cracking", "reforming", "gasoline", "diesel fuel", "naphtha"], "real_world_example": "An oil refinery complex processing crude oil."}}

{"explanation": "Platinum-group metals (PGMs: ruthenium, rhodium, palladium, osmium, iridium, and platinum) are rare, precious transition metals known for their exceptional catalytic properties, often used in hydrogenation reactions to form alkanes and in catalytic converters.", "urdu_meaning": "پلاٹینم گروہ کی دھاتیں - بہترین عمل انگیزی خصوصیات والی کمیاب دھاتیں", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Platinum and palladium, which are platinum-group metals, are highly effective catalysts for the hydrogenation of alkenes to alkanes.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A group of six chemically similar, precious, and catalytically active transition metals.", "related_concepts": ["metals", "transition metals", "catalysts", "platinum", "palladium", "rhodium", "hydrogenation", "catalytic converters"], "real_world_example": "Platinum used in catalytic converters; Palladium used in Heck and Suzuki coupling reactions."}}

{"explanation": "Propane (C₃H₈) is a three-carbon alkane, a gas at room temperature, commonly used as a fuel (LPG) for heating and cooking. {"explanation": "Renewable feedstocks are raw materials derived from renewable biological resources (biomass) used for producing chemicals, materials, and fuels, offering sustainable alternatives to petroleum-based feedstocks for compounds like alkanes.", "urdu_meaning": "قابل تجدید خام مال - قابل تجدید حیاتیاتی وسائل سے حاصل کردہ ابتدائی مواد", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Research is focused on converting renewable feedstocks like lignocellulose into alkanes and other valuable chemicals.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Raw materials for industrial processes derived from sources that can be replenished naturally.", "related_concepts": ["bio-based routes", "renewable energy", "biomass", "biofuels", "sustainable alternatives", "green chemistry", "alkanes (potential production from)", "vegetable oils"], "real_world_example": "Corn used to produce ethanol; algae being explored for biofuel production."}}

{"explanation": "Saturated fats are triglycerides whose fatty acid chains contain only carbon-carbon single bonds (i.e., are saturated with hydrogen), structurally similar to long-chain alkanes. They are often produced by hydrogenating unsaturated oils.
column4: ""urdu_meaning"": ""سیر شدہ چکنائیاں - وہ چکنائیاں جن میں کاربن-کاربن سنگل بانڈ ہوتے ہیں""
column6: ""example_sentence"": ""The hydrogenation of unsaturated vegetable oils converts them into more saturated fats
column7: changing their physical properties from liquid to semi-solid
column9: ""properties"": {""key_principle"": ""Fats composed of fatty acids with no C=C double bonds in their hydrocarbon chains.""
column19: ""real_world_example"": ""Animal fats like butter and lard; palm oil.""}}"

enrichment_data: {"explanation": "Shortening is a fat that is solid at room temperature, often produced by the partial or complete hydrogenation of vegetable oils (unsaturated) to make them more saturated, similar in properties to solid alkanes. Used in baking.

column6: ""example_sentence"": ""The process of making shortening involves hydrogenating unsaturated C=C bonds in vegetable oils
column8: ""properties"": {""key_principle"": ""A solid fat used in baking to make products tender or flaky
column9: typically made by hydrogenating vegetable oils.""
column16: ""real_world_example"": ""Crisco is a well-known brand of shortening.""}}"

enrichment_data: {"explanation": "Sulfuric acid (H₂SO₄) can be used as a catalyst in some dehydration reactions (e.g., alcohols to alkenes), which can be an intermediate step if the alkene is then hydrogenated to an alkane. {"explanation": "Sustainable alternatives refer to resources, processes, or products that can be maintained over the long term without depleting resources or harming the environment, such as bio-based routes for producing alkanes instead of relying solely on fossil fuels.", "urdu_meaning": "پائیدار متبادل - ماحول دوست اور طویل مدتی وسائل یا طریقے", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Developing sustainable alternatives for producing fuels like alkanes from renewable feedstocks is crucial for reducing carbon emissions.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Options that meet present needs without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs.", "related_concepts": ["renewable energy", "renewable feedstocks", "bio-based routes", "green chemistry", "sustainability", "fossil fuels (as non-sustainable)", "climate change mitigation"], "real_world_example": "Using solar power instead of coal for electricity; producing biofuels from algae."}}

{"explanation": "Triple bonds (specifically carbon-carbon triple bonds, C≡C) are characteristic of alkynes. Hydrogenation of these triple bonds (in one or two steps) is a method for synthesizing alkanes.", "urdu_meaning": "ٹرپل بانڈ - C≡C، الکائنز کی خصوصیت", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The complete hydrogenation of an alkyne, which contains triple bonds, results in the formation of the corresponding alkane.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A covalent bond where three pairs of electrons are shared between two atoms (e.g., C≡C).", "related_concepts": ["alkynes", "unsaturated hydrocarbons", "carbon-carbon triple bonds", "pi bond", "sigma bond", "addition reactions", "hydrogenation"], "real_world_example": "The C≡C triple bond in ethyne (acetylene)."}}

{"explanation": "Unsaturated hydrocarbons are hydrocarbons containing one or more carbon-carbon double bonds (alkenes) or triple bonds (alkynes). {"explanation": "Unsaturated oils are triglycerides containing fatty acid chains with one or more carbon-carbon double bonds. They are liquids at room temperature and can be hydrogenated (often with a nickel catalyst) to produce more saturated, solid or semi-solid fats like margarine (alkane-like chains).", "urdu_meaning": "غیر سیر شدہ تیل - وہ تیل جن کے فیٹی ایسڈ میں C=C ڈبل بانڈ ہوتے ہیں", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The food industry uses catalytic hydrogenation to convert liquid unsaturated oils into semi-solid fats for products like margarine.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Oils containing a high proportion of unsaturated fatty acids (with C=C bonds).", "related_concepts": ["oils", "fats", "fatty acids", "triglycerides", "double bonds", "hydrogenation", "saturated fats", "margarine", "vegetable oils", "nickel catalyst"], "real_world_example": "Olive oil, soybean oil, sunflower oil."}}

{"explanation": "Vegetable oils are oils extracted from plants, typically rich in unsaturated fatty acids (containing C=C double bonds). They can be hydrogenated using catalysts like nickel to produce more saturated fats, which have alkane-like saturated chains.", "urdu_meaning": "سبزیوں کا تیل - پودوں سے حاصل کردہ تیل، اکثر غیر سیر شدہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Hydrogenation of vegetable oils is a key industrial process for making margarine and shortening.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Oils derived from plant sources, usually triglycerides of fatty acids.", "related_concepts": ["unsaturated oils", "hydrogenation", "margarine", "shortening", "food industry", "biofuels (biodiesel)", "fatty acids"], "real_world_example": "Soybean oil, corn oil, olive oil, palm oil."}}

{"explanation": "Zeolites are microporous aluminosilicate minerals commonly used as commercial catalysts, particularly in the petroleum industry for catalytic cracking of long-chain alkanes into smaller hydrocarbons like gasoline components.", "urdu_meaning": "زیولائٹ - ایک مسام دار معدنی عمل انگیز، پیٹرولیم کریکنگ میں استعمال", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Zeolite catalysts are highly effective in the catalytic cracking process due to their acidic sites and shape selectivity.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Crystalline aluminosilicates with a porous structure, used as catalysts, adsorbents, and ion exchangers.", "related_concepts": ["catalysts", "catalytic cracking", "petroleum refining", "alkanes", "hydrocarbons", "alumina", "silica", "heterogeneous catalysis", "shape selectivity", "acid sites"], "real_world_example": "FCC (Fluid Catalytic Cracking) catalysts in oil refineries often contain zeolites."}}

{"explanation": "Zinc (Zn) metal can be used with an acid (like hydrochloric acid) to produce nascent hydrogen, which acts as a reducing agent for converting alkyl halides to alkanes.", "urdu_meaning": "جست - Zn، ایک دھات جو الکائل ہیلائیڈز کی تخفیف میں استعمال ہوتی ہے", "term_type": "element", "example_sentence": "The reaction of ethyl bromide with zinc and hydrochloric acid yields ethane through reduction by nascent hydrogen.", "properties": {"symbol": "Zn", "atomic_number": 30, "category": "metal (transition or post-transition)", "state_room_temp": "solid", "common_uses": ["Galvanizing", "Alloys (brass)", "Batteries", "Reducing agent in organic synthesis"]}}

{"explanation": "Acids are substances that donate protons or accept electron pairs. Alkanes are generally unreactive towards common acids at room temperature due to their non-polar nature and strong C-C/C-H bonds.", "urdu_meaning": "تیزاب - الکینز عام طور پر تیزابوں کے ساتھ تعامل نہیں کرتے", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Unlike alkenes, alkanes do not react with aqueous solutions of acids like HCl or H₂SO₄ under normal conditions.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Chemical species that can donate H⁺ or accept e⁻ pairs. Alkanes show very limited reactivity with them.", "related_concepts": ["alkanes", "reactivity", "chemical inertness", "bases", "non-polar bonds"], "real_world_example": "Concentrated sulfuric acid can react with some branched alkanes at high temperatures (sulfonation), but simple alkanes are largely inert."}}

{"explanation": "Alcohols (-OH group) are organic compounds. While alkanes don't directly convert to alcohols easily, alcohols can be dehydrated to alkenes, which are then hydrogenated to alkanes. Also, oxidation of alkanes under specific conditions can yield alcohols, but this is not a typical alkane reaction.", "urdu_meaning": "الکوحل - نامیاتی مرکبات، الکینز سے بالواسطہ تعلق", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Controlled oxidation of methane can produce methanol, but this requires specific catalysts and conditions beyond typical alkane reactivity.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Organic compounds with a hydroxyl (-OH) group. Not directly interconverted with alkanes easily, but related through multi-step processes.", "related_concepts": ["alkanes", "oxidation", "functional groups"], "example_compounds": ["Methanol", "Ethanol"]}}

{"explanation": "Alkanes are saturated hydrocarbons (CnH2n+2) characterized by C-C and C-H single bonds, relative chemical inertness, and undergoing primarily combustion and free-radical substitution reactions (e.g., halogenation with UV light).", "urdu_meaning": "الکینز - سیر شدہ ہائیڈروکاربن، کم عامل", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The two main reactions of alkanes are combustion, which makes them excellent fuels, and halogenation under UV light.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Saturated hydrocarbons with general formula CnH2n+2 (acyclic), known for low reactivity except combustion and radical substitution.", "related_concepts": ["hydrocarbons", "saturated hydrocarbons", "paraffins", "combustion", "halogenation", "substitution reactions", "free radical reactions", "chemical inertness", "c-c bonds", "c-h bonds"], "general_formula": "CnH2n+2", "example_compounds": ["Methane", "Ethane", "Propane", "Butane"]}}

{"explanation": "Alkyl halides (haloalkanes) are compounds formed when one or more hydrogen atoms in an alkane are replaced by halogen atoms, typically through free-radical halogenation reactions.", "urdu_meaning": "الکائل ہیلائیڈز - الکینز کی ہیلوجینیشن سے بننے والے مرکبات", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The reaction of methane with chlorine in the presence of UV light produces a mixture of alkyl halides, including chloromethane.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Organic compounds containing a halogen atom bonded to an sp³-hybridized carbon of an alkyl group.", "related_concepts": ["alkanes", "halogenation", "substitution reactions", "halogens", "chloromethane", "dichloromethane", "trichloromethane", "tetrachloromethane"], "general_formula": "R-X", "example_compounds": ["CH₃Cl", "CH₂Cl₂"]}}

{"explanation": "Alternative energy sources are energy resources other than fossil fuels (which include alkanes like natural gas and petroleum components). The combustion of alkane fossil fuels contributes to greenhouse gas emissions, driving the search for alternative energy sources.", "urdu_meaning": "متبادل توانائی کے ذرائع - رکازی ایندھن کے علاوہ توانائی کے وسائل", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Due to the environmental impact of combusting alkane-based fossil fuels, there is a growing emphasis on developing alternative energy sources like solar and wind power.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Energy sources that are not based on the burning of fossil fuels or splitting of atoms.", "related_concepts": ["fossil fuels", "alkanes", "combustion", "greenhouse gas emissions", "renewable energy", "solar energy", "wind energy", "geothermal energy", "biofuels"], "real_world_example": "Solar panels, wind turbines, hydroelectric power plants."}}

{"explanation": "An anesthetic is a substance that induces anesthesia (loss of sensation). Some halogenated derivatives of alkanes, like chloroform and halothane (though not simple alkanes themselves), have been used as anesthetics, but their use is often limited due to toxicity or ozone-depleting properties.", "urdu_meaning": "بے ہوش کرنے والی دوا / اینستھیٹک - احساس ختم کرنے والا مادہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Halogenated alkanes such as halothane were once widely used as general anesthetics, but simpler alkanes are not typically anesthetic.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A drug that causes reversible loss of sensation. Some halogenated alkanes have this property.", "related_concepts": ["halogenated derivatives", "chloroform", "halothane", "alkanes (not typically anesthetic)", "medicines"], "real_world_example": "Sevoflurane, a halogenated ether, is a modern inhalational anesthetic."}}

{"explanation": "A balanced equation for alkane reactions, like combustion or halogenation, ensures that the number of atoms of each element is conserved, allowing for stoichiometric calculations.", "urdu_meaning": "متوازن مساوات - الکین تعاملات کے لیے ایٹموں کی تعداد کو برابر کرنے والی مساوات", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The balanced equation for the complete combustion of ethane (2C₂H₆ + 7O₂ → 4CO₂ + 6H₂O) shows the molar ratios involved.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A chemical equation where the total number of atoms of each element is identical on both reactant and product sides.", "related_concepts": ["chemical equation", "alkanes", "combustion", "halogenation", "stoichiometry", "moles of oxygen"], "real_world_example": "CH₄ + 2O₂ → CO₂ + 2H₂O for methane combustion."}}

{"explanation": "Bases are substances that accept protons or donate electron pairs. Alkanes are neither acidic nor basic and are generally unreactive towards common bases at room temperature.", "urdu_meaning": "اساس - الکینز عام طور پر اساسوں کے ساتھ تعامل نہیں کرتے", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The non-polar C-H bonds in alkanes do not readily donate protons, so alkanes do not act as acids, nor do they have sites to accept protons easily to act as bases.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Chemical species that can accept H⁺ or donate e⁻ pairs. Alkanes show very limited reactivity with them.", "related_concepts": ["alkanes", "reactivity", "chemical inertness", "acids", "non-polar bonds"], "real_world_example": "Alkanes do not react with strong bases like NaOH under normal conditions."}}

{"explanation": "Bonding electrons in alkanes are the valence electrons shared in the C-C and C-H single covalent bonds. All valence electrons of carbon and hydrogen in alkanes are typically involved as bonding electrons (no lone pairs on C or H).", "urdu_meaning": "بندھنی الیکٹران - الکینز میں C-C اور C-H بندھنوں میں شامل الیکٹران", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The stability of alkanes is partly due to the strong sigma bonds formed by their bonding electrons.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Valence electrons participating in the formation of covalent bonds.", "related_concepts": ["covalent bonds", "single bonds", "alkanes", "c-c bonds", "c-h bonds", "valence electrons"], "real_world_example": "In ethane (C₂H₆), there are 14 bonding electrons forming 1 C-C bond and 6 C-H bonds."}}

{"explanation": "'Bonds broken' refers to the chemical bonds that are cleaved during a chemical reaction. In alkane reactions like combustion or halogenation, strong C-H and sometimes C-C bonds must be broken, often requiring significant energy input (e.g., heat or UV light).", "urdu_meaning": "ٹوٹے ہوئے بندھن - کیمیائی تعامل کے دوران ٹوٹنے والے کیمیائی روابط", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "For the halogenation of an alkane to occur, C-H bonds must be broken, often initiated by free radicals.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Cleavage of existing chemical bonds during a chemical transformation.", "related_concepts": ["chemical reactions", "alkanes", "combustion", "halogenation", "activation energy", "bond energy", "c-c bonds", "c-h bonds", "bonds formed"], "real_world_example": "In the combustion of methane, C-H bonds in CH₄ and O=O bonds in O₂ are broken."}}

{"explanation": "'Bonds formed' refers to the new chemical bonds created during a chemical reaction. In the combustion of alkanes, new C=O bonds (in CO₂) and H-O bonds (in H₂O) are formed, releasing energy.", "urdu_meaning": "بننے والے بندھن - کیمیائی تعامل کے دوران بننے والے نئے کیمیائی روابط", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The energy released in the combustion of alkanes comes from the net energy change associated with bonds broken and new, stronger bonds formed (like C=O and H-O).", "properties": {"key_principle": "Creation of new chemical bonds during a chemical transformation.", "related_concepts": ["chemical reactions", "alkanes", "combustion", "halogenation", "bond energy", "c=o bonds", "h-o bonds", "alkyl halides", "bonds broken"], "real_world_example": "In the combustion of methane, C=O bonds in CO₂ and O-H bonds in H₂O are formed."}}

{"explanation": "Butane (C₄H₁₀) is a four-carbon alkane, existing as two structural isomers (n-butane and isobutane). It is a flammable gas used as a fuel, often in lighters and portable stoves (as part of LPG).", "urdu_meaning": "بیوٹین - C₄H₁₀، ایک چار کاربن والا الکین", "term_type": "compound", "example_sentence": "Butane undergoes complete combustion in sufficient oxygen to produce carbon dioxide and water.", "properties": {"formula": "C₄H₁₀", "molar_mass": "58.12 g/mol", "state_room_temp": "gas", "hazards": ["Highly flammable", "Forms explosive mixtures with air"]}}

{"explanation": "C-C bonds (carbon-carbon single bonds) are strong covalent bonds that form the backbone of alkane molecules. These bonds are relatively stable and require significant energy to break.", "urdu_meaning": "سی-سی بانڈز - الکینز میں کاربن ایٹموں کے درمیان سنگل بندھن", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The thermal cracking of alkanes involves the breaking of C-C bonds at high temperatures.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Single covalent bonds between carbon atoms, characteristic of alkanes.", "related_concepts": ["alkanes", "carbon backbone", "single bonds", "covalent bonds", "bond energy", "cracking"], "real_world_example": "The C-C bond in ethane."}}

{"explanation": "C-H bonds (carbon-hydrogen single bonds) are strong, relatively non-polar covalent bonds found extensively in alkanes. {"explanation": "Zinc (Zn) metal, often used with an acid like HCl, can act as a reducing agent to convert alkyl halides (derived from alkanes) back into alkanes by providing nascent hydrogen.", "urdu_meaning": "جست - Zn، ایک دھات جو الکائل ہیلائیڈز کی تخفیف میں استعمال ہو سکتی ہے", "term_type": "element", "example_sentence": "While not directly reacting with alkanes, zinc can be used to reduce chloromethane (an alkyl halide from methane) to methane.", "properties": {"symbol": "Zn", "atomic_number": 30, "category": "metal (transition or post-transition)", "state_room_temp": "solid", "common_uses": ["Galvanizing", "Alloys", "Batteries", "Reducing agent in organic synthesis (e.g., with HCl for alkyl halide reduction)"]}}

{"explanation": "Amount of substance is a fundamental physical quantity that measures the number of elementary entities (e.g., atoms, molecules, ions) present in a sample, with the SI base unit being the mole.", "urdu_meaning": "مادے کی مقدار - نمونے میں بنیادی اکائیوں کی تعداد کی پیمائش، اکائی مول", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "In chemical reactions, the amount of substance of reactants and products is often expressed in moles.", "properties": {"describes": "A measure of the number of specified elementary entities (atoms, molecules, ions, electrons, etc.).", "related_concepts": ["mole", "Avogadro's number", "molar mass", "stoichiometry", "concentration", "si base units"], "example_of_use": "Calculating that 18 grams of water is equivalent to 1 mole, representing an amount of substance.", "measurement_type": "Moles (mol)."}}

{"explanation": "Area is a measure of the extent of a two-dimensional surface or region. The SI derived unit for area is the square meter (m²).", "urdu_meaning": "رقبہ - دو جہتی سطح کی وسعت کی پیمائش", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "The surface area of a catalyst can affect the rate of a chemical reaction.", "properties": {"describes": "The extent of a two-dimensional figure or shape, or planar sections of a solid.", "related_concepts": ["derived units", "square metre", "length", "surface area"], "example_of_use": "Calculating the area of filter paper used in an experiment.", "measurement_type": "Square meters (m²), square centimeters (cm²), etc."}}

{"explanation": "Atoms are the basic units of a chemical element. The amount of substance (in moles) relates to a specific number of atoms (Avogadro's number).", "urdu_meaning": "ایٹم / جوہر - کیمیائی عنصر کی بنیادی اکائیاں", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "One mole of carbon contains approximately 6.022 x 10²³ carbon atoms.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The smallest constituent unit of ordinary matter that has the properties of a chemical element.", "related_concepts": ["element", "mole", "molecules", "amount of substance", "Avogadro's number", "periodic table"], "real_world_example": "The atoms of gold give it its characteristic properties."}}

{"explanation": "Celsius (°C) is a temperature scale where 0°C is the freezing point of water and 100°C is the boiling point of water at standard atmospheric pressure. It is a common unit for temperature measurement, though Kelvin is the SI base unit.", "urdu_meaning": "سیلسیس - درجہ حرارت کا پیمانہ", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "Many chemical reactions in the laboratory are carried out at a controlled temperature measured in degrees Celsius.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Temperature", "symbol_if_any": "°C", "system": "Metric (derived from Kelvin, K = °C + 273.15)"}}

{"explanation": "Cesium-133 (¹³³Cs) is a specific isotope of the element cesium. The SI base unit of time, the second, is defined based on the frequency of radiation corresponding to a specific transition in the cesium-133 atom.", "urdu_meaning": "سیزیم-133 - سیزیم کا ایک آئسوٹوپ، وقت کی اکائی کی تعریف میں استعمال", "term_type": "isotope", "example_sentence": "Atomic clocks use the precise oscillations of cesium-133 atoms to define the second with extreme accuracy.", "properties": {"element_symbol": "Cs", "mass_number": 133, "category": "isotope of cesium", "relevance_to_si": "Used to define the SI unit of time (second).", "common_uses": ["Atomic clocks", "Time standardization"]}}

{"explanation": "Chemical calculations involve using quantitative relationships (often based on SI units like moles, grams, liters) to determine amounts of reactants, products, concentrations, yields, etc., in chemical reactions and processes.", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی حسابات - کیمیائی تعاملات میں مقداروں کا تعین کرنے کے لیے حسابی عمل", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Stoichiometry, which relies on balanced chemical equations and the mole concept (an SI unit), is fundamental to chemical calculations.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Quantitative determination of amounts, compositions, and properties related to chemical substances and reactions.", "related_concepts": ["stoichiometry", "mole", "molar mass", "concentration", "chemical equations", "yields", "si units", "conversion"], "real_world_example": "Calculating the mass of product expected from a given mass of reactant using a balanced chemical equation."}}

{"explanation": "Chemical equations symbolically represent chemical reactions, showing reactants, products, and their stoichiometric ratios, often using SI units implicitly (e.g., coefficients as mole ratios).", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی مساوات - کیمیائی تعاملات کی علامتی نمائندگی", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Balanced chemical equations are essential for performing stoichiometric chemical calculations involving moles and masses.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A symbolic representation of a chemical reaction using formulas and symbols to show reactants and products.", "related_concepts": ["chemical reactions", "reactants", "products", "stoichiometry", "mole", "balancing equations", "chemical calculations"], "real_world_example": "2H₂(g) + O₂(g) → 2H₂O(l) is the chemical equation for water formation."}}

{"explanation": "Chemical reactions are processes involving the transformation of substances, described quantitatively using stoichiometry and SI units for amounts (moles), mass (kilograms/grams), and energy (joules).", "urdu_meaning": "کیمیائی تعاملات - مادوں کی ساخت میں تبدیلی کے عوامل", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "The yield of chemical reactions can be calculated using the mole concept and masses of reactants measured in SI units.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Processes that lead to the chemical transformation of one set of chemical substances to another.", "related_concepts": ["chemical equations", "reactants", "products", "stoichiometry", "mole", "energy", "joule", "reaction outcomes", "yields"], "real_world_example": "Neutralization of an acid with a base."}}

{"explanation": "Chemistry is the scientific discipline that studies matter, its properties, how and why substances combine or separate to form other substances, and how substances interact with energy. {"explanation": "Chemists are scientists who study chemistry. {"explanation": "Collaborative international research projects in science, including chemistry, depend on standardized measurement systems like the SI system to ensure that data and results are comparable and understandable across different countries and laboratories.", "urdu_meaning": "مشترکہ بین الاقوامی تحقیقی منصوبے - مختلف ممالک کے سائنسدانوں کے مشترکہ تحقیقی کام", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The success of collaborative international research projects often hinges on the consistent use of SI units for reporting measurements.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Research efforts involving cooperation between scientists or institutions from multiple countries.", "related_concepts": ["si system", "standardized measurement systems", "scientific communication", "chemistry", "research", "data sharing"], "real_world_example": "The Human Genome Project; international collaborations on climate change research."}}

{"explanation": "Concentration is the measure of the amount of a solute dissolved in a given amount of solvent or solution. {"explanation": "Convenience in measurement refers to ease of use and practicality. While SI units provide standardization, sometimes local or older units persist due to historical convenience or specific application contexts, though SI is preferred for scientific rigor.", "urdu_meaning": "سہولت / آسانی - پیمائش میں استعمال کی عملیت", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "For everyday temperature measurements, Celsius offers convenience over Kelvin for many people, though Kelvin is the SI base unit.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The quality of being suitable or easy to use in a particular situation.", "related_concepts": ["measurement systems", "si system", "us customary units", "local measurement systems", "unit conversion"], "real_world_example": "Using teaspoons for cooking measurements offers convenience over milliliters for some home cooks."}}

{"explanation": "Conversion (unit conversion) is the process of changing a measurement from one unit to another (e.g., Celsius to Kelvin, grams to kilograms) using conversion factors. This is essential when working with different measurement systems or SI prefixes.", "urdu_meaning": "تبدیلی / یونٹ کی تبدیلی - ایک پیمائشی اکائی سے دوسری میں تبدیل کرنا", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Accurate conversion between grams and moles using molar mass is a fundamental skill in chemical calculations.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Changing a quantity expressed in one unit to an equivalent quantity in a different unit.", "related_concepts": ["unit conversion error", "si units", "metric units", "us customary units", "conversion factor", "dimensional analysis"], "real_world_example": "Converting inches to centimeters; converting pounds to kilograms."}}

{"explanation": "Countries around the world adopt measurement systems. {"explanation": "Cubic centimeters (cm³ or cc) are units of volume in the metric system, equivalent to milliliters (mL). 1 cm³ = 10⁻⁶ cubic meters (m³).", "urdu_meaning": "مکعب سینٹی میٹر - حجم کی اکائی", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "The volume of a small liquid sample in a laboratory is often measured in cubic centimeters or milliliters.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Volume", "symbol_if_any": "cm³ (or cc)", "system": "Metric (derived from SI base unit meter)"}}

{"explanation": "Cubic meters (m³) are the SI derived unit for volume, representing the volume of a cube with sides of one meter in length.", "urdu_meaning": "مکعب میٹر - حجم کی ایس آئی اکائی", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "The density of a substance can be expressed in kilograms per cubic meters (kg/m³).", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Volume", "symbol_if_any": "m³", "system": "SI derived unit"}}

{"explanation": "Cubic metre (m³) is the SI unit of volume, defined as the volume of a cube with edges one metre in length.", "urdu_meaning": "مکعب میٹر (مفرد) - حجم کی ایس آئی اکائی", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "One cubic metre is equivalent to 1,000 liters.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Volume", "symbol_if_any": "m³", "system": "SI derived unit"}}

{"explanation": "Decimal-based systems, like the SI (metric) system, use powers of 10 for conversions between units, making calculations and scaling straightforward (e.g., 1 kilogram = 1000 grams).", "urdu_meaning": "اعشاریہ پر مبنی - وہ نظام جو دس کی طاقتوں پر مبنی ہو، جیسے میٹرک نظام", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "The SI system is a decimal-based system, which simplifies unit conversions using prefixes like kilo-, milli-, and nano-.", "properties": {"describes": "A system founded on the number ten or powers of ten.", "related_concepts": ["metric system", "si system", "si prefixes", "powers of 10", "unit conversion"], "example_of_use": "Converting meters to kilometers in the decimal-based metric system involves simply dividing by 1000.", "measurement_type": "N/A (describes a system characteristic)."}}

{"explanation": "A definition in science provides a precise meaning for a term or unit. {"explanation": "Degrees Celsius (°C) is a common unit for measuring temperature, where water freezes at 0°C and boils at 100°C at standard pressure. It's related to the SI unit Kelvin by K = °C + 273.15.", "urdu_meaning": "ڈگری سیلسیس - درجہ حرارت کی اکائی", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "Most laboratory experiments are conducted at temperatures reported in degrees Celsius for convenience, although thermodynamic calculations often use Kelvins.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Temperature", "symbol_if_any": "°C", "system": "Metric (related to SI Kelvin)"}}

{"explanation": "Density is a derived physical property defined as mass per unit volume. The SI unit for density is kilograms per cubic metre (kg/m³), though g/cm³ or g/mL are also commonly used.", "urdu_meaning": "کثافت - مادے کی فی اکائی حجم کمیت", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "The density of water is approximately 1000 kilograms per cubic metre (or 1 g/cm³).", "properties": {"describes": "The mass of a substance per unit of volume.", "related_concepts": ["masses", "volume", "derived units", "kilograms per cubic metre", "grams per cubic centimeter", "si units"], "example_of_use": "Determining the density of a gas requires measuring its mass and volume under specific conditions.", "measurement_type": "kg/m³, g/cm³, g/mL."}}

{"explanation": "Derived units in the SI system are units of measurement formed by combining SI base units through multiplication or division. Examples include area (m²), volume (m³), density (kg/m³), force (newton, N), pressure (pascal, Pa), and energy (joule, J).", "urdu_meaning": "ماخوذ اکائیاں - بنیادی ایس آئی اکائیوں کے ملاپ سے بننے والی اکائیاں", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The newton (N), the SI derived unit of force, is defined as kg·m/s².", "properties": {"key_principle": "Units formed from combinations of SI base units according to algebraic relations linking the corresponding quantities.", "related_concepts": ["si base units", "si system", "area (m²)", "volume (m³)", "density (kg/m³)", "force (newton)", "pressure (pascal)", "energy (joule)", "concentration (mol/m³ or mol/L)"], "real_world_example": "Velocity (meter per second, m/s), Acceleration (meter per second squared, m/s²)."}}

{"explanation": "An element is a pure substance consisting only of atoms that all have the same number of protons in their atomic nuclei. The amount of an element is often expressed in moles (SI unit).", "urdu_meaning": "عنصر - ایک ہی قسم کے ایٹموں پر مشتمل خالص مادہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The mass of one mole of an element in grams is numerically equal to its atomic weight.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A species of atoms having the same number of protons in their atomic nuclei.", "related_concepts": ["atoms", "mole", "periodic table", "amount of substance", "chemical reactions"], "real_world_example": "Carbon (C), Oxygen (O), Gold (Au)."}}

{"explanation": "Energy is the capacity to do work or produce heat. The SI derived unit for energy is the joule (J).", "urdu_meaning": "توانائی - کام کرنے یا حرارت پیدا کرنے کی صلاحیت", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "Chemical reactions often involve the release or absorption of energy, measured in joules or kilojoules.", "properties": {"describes": "The quantitative property that must be transferred to an object in order to perform work on, or to heat, the object.", "related_concepts": ["joule", "derived units", "heat", "work", "chemical reactions", "thermodynamic calculations", "si units"], "example_of_use": "The combustion of methane releases a specific amount of energy per mole.", "measurement_type": "Joules (J), kilojoules (kJ), calories (cal)."}}

SI units are used for the quantities in these formulas.", "urdu_meaning": "فارمولا - مرکب کی ترکیب یا مقداری تعلق کی علامتی نمائندگی", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The formula for calculating density requires mass (e.g., in kilograms) and volume (e.g., in cubic metres).", "properties": {"key_principle": "A concise way of expressing information symbolically, as in a chemical formula or a mathematical formula.", "related_concepts": ["chemical formula", "mathematical equation", "density", "concentration", "si units"], "real_world_example": "H₂O is the chemical formula for water; E=mc² is a famous physics formula."}}

{"explanation": "The French Revolution (late 18th century) was a period of social and political upheaval in France that, among many other reforms, played a crucial role in the development and adoption of the metric system, the precursor to the modern SI system.", "urdu_meaning": "فرانسیسی انقلاب - فرانس میں سماجی اور سیاسی تبدیلی کا دور، میٹرک نظام کی ترقی میں اہم", "term_type": "other", "example_sentence": "The desire for a rational, universal system of measurement during the French Revolution led to the creation of the metric system.", "properties": {"description": "A period of far-reaching social and political upheaval in late 18th century France.", "contextual_relevance": "Key historical event that spurred the development and adoption of the metric system of measurement, aiming for standardization and rationality."}}

{"explanation": "Gas is a state of matter with no fixed shape or volume. The properties of gases (pressure, volume, temperature, amount) are often described using SI units and gas laws.", "urdu_meaning": "گیس - مادے کی ایک حالت", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "The pressure of a gas in a container is often measured in pascals (Pa), the SI unit.", "properties": {"describes": "A state of matter in which particles are widely separated and move randomly to fill their container.", "related_concepts": ["gases (plural)", "pressure", "volume", "temperature", "amount of substance (mole)", "pascal", "cubic metre", "kelvin", "ideal gas law"], "example_of_use": "Oxygen is a gas at room temperature.", "measurement_type": "N/A (describes a state)."}}

{"explanation": "Gases are substances in a state of matter where particles are far apart and move freely. Their behavior is often quantified using SI units for pressure (pascals), volume (cubic metres), temperature (kelvins), and amount (moles).", "urdu_meaning": "گیسیں (جمع) - گیس حالت میں موجود مادے", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The ideal gas law relates the pressure, volume, temperature, and number of moles of gases using the gas constant R in appropriate SI units.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A state of matter characterized by low density, high compressibility, and indefinite shape and volume.", "related_concepts": ["gas (singular)", "ideal gas law", "pressure", "volume", "temperature", "mole", "si units"], "real_world_example": "Air, helium, carbon dioxide."}}

{"explanation": "Grams (g) are units of mass in the metric system, equal to one-thousandth of a kilogram (the SI base unit for mass). Grams are commonly used in laboratory settings for convenience.", "urdu_meaning": "گرام - کمیت کی اکائی، کلوگرام کا ہزارواں حصہ", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "Chemists often measure reactants in grams and then convert to moles for stoichiometric calculations.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Mass", "symbol_if_any": "g", "system": "Metric (1 g = 10⁻³ kg)"}}

{"explanation": "Heat is energy transferred due to a temperature difference. The SI unit for heat, like other forms of energy, is the joule (J).", "urdu_meaning": "حرارت - درجہ حرارت کے فرق کی وجہ سے منتقل ہونے والی توانائی", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "The amount of heat absorbed or released during a chemical reaction is often measured in joules or kilojoules.", "properties": {"describes": "Energy in transit from a high-temperature object to a lower-temperature object.", "related_concepts": ["energy", "joule", "temperature", "specific heat capacity", "enthalpy", "thermodynamic calculations", "si units"], "example_of_use": "Calculating the heat required to raise the temperature of water.", "measurement_type": "Joules (J), calories (cal)."}}

{"explanation": "The joule (J) is the SI derived unit of energy or work, defined as the work done when a force of one newton displaces an object by one meter in the direction of the force (1 J = 1 N·m = 1 kg·m²/s²).", "urdu_meaning": "جول - توانائی یا کام کی ایس آئی اکائی", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "The energy released in many chemical reactions is expressed in joules or kilojoules per mole.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Energy, work, heat", "symbol_if_any": "J", "system": "SI derived unit (kg·m²/s²)"}}

{"explanation": "The kelvin (K) is the SI base unit of thermodynamic temperature. It is defined by taking the fixed numerical value of the Boltzmann constant k to be 1.380649 × 10⁻²³ J·K⁻¹. Zero kelvin (0 K) is absolute zero.", "urdu_meaning": "کیلون - حرارتی درجہ حرارت کی ایس آئی بنیادی اکائی", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "In scientific calculations, especially those involving gases or thermodynamics, temperature is often expressed in kelvin.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Thermodynamic temperature", "symbol_if_any": "K", "system": "SI base unit"}}

{"explanation": "The Kelvin scale is an absolute thermodynamic temperature scale where zero Kelvin (0 K) represents absolute zero, the theoretical point of no molecular motion. It is the SI standard for temperature measurement.", "urdu_meaning": "کیلون پیمانہ - مطلق حرارتی درجہ حرارت کا پیمانہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Unlike Celsius or Fahrenheit, the Kelvin scale does not use degrees and starts at absolute zero.", "properties": {"key_principle": "An absolute temperature scale with 0 K as absolute zero.", "related_concepts": ["kelvin (unit)", "temperature", "absolute zero", "celsius scale", "thermodynamic calculations", "si base units"], "real_world_example": "Water freezes at 273.15 K and boils at 373.15 K (at 1 atm)."}}

{"explanation": "Kelvins (K) are the units used in the Kelvin temperature scale, the SI base unit for thermodynamic temperature.", "urdu_meaning": "کیلون (جمع) - کیلون پیمانے کی اکائیاں", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "Scientific data for gas law calculations must have temperatures converted to kelvins.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Thermodynamic temperature", "symbol_if_any": "K", "system": "SI base unit"}}

{"explanation": "Kilo- (symbol k) is an SI prefix representing a factor of one thousand (10³). For example, one kilogram (kg) is 1000 grams, and one kilometer (km) is 1000 meters.", "urdu_meaning": "کلو- - ایک ہزار کا سابقہ (10³)", "term_type": "prefix", "example_sentence": "The mass of a person is often expressed in kilograms, where 'kilo-' means one thousand.", "properties": {"represents_factor": 10³ (one thousand)""

{"explanation": "The kilogram (kg) is the SI base unit of mass. It is currently defined by taking the fixed numerical value of the Planck constant h to be 6.62607015 × 10⁻³⁴ when expressed in the unit J·s, which is equal to kg·m²·s⁻¹.", "urdu_meaning": "کلوگرام - کمیت کی ایس آئی بنیادی اکائی", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "A standard solution in chemistry might be prepared by dissolving a specific mass of solute, measured in grams or kilograms, in a solvent.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Mass", "symbol_if_any": "kg", "system": "SI base unit"}}

{"explanation": "Kilograms (kg) are the SI base units for measuring mass. One kilogram is equal to 1000 grams.", "urdu_meaning": "کلوگرام (جمع) - کمیت کی اکائیاں", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "The density of water is approximately 1000 kilograms per cubic metre.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Mass", "symbol_if_any": "kg", "system": "SI base unit"}}

{"explanation": "Kilograms per cubic metre (kg/m³) is the SI derived unit for density, representing the mass in kilograms contained in a volume of one cubic metre.", "urdu_meaning": "کلوگرام فی مکعب میٹر - کثافت کی ایس آئی اکائی", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "The density of air at sea level is approximately 1.225 kilograms per cubic metre.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Density", "symbol_if_any": "kg/m³ or kg·m⁻³", "system": "SI derived unit"}}

{"explanation": "Laboratory equipment, such as balances, glassware (beakers, burettes, pipettes), and thermometers, is often calibrated and marked in SI units or metric units (grams, milliliters, Celsius) to ensure accurate and consistent measurements in experiments.", "urdu_meaning": "تجربہ گاہی سامان - تجربات میں استعمال ہونے والے آلات اور برتن", "term_type": "other", "example_sentence": "Volumetric laboratory equipment like pipettes and burettes are calibrated to deliver precise volumes, usually in milliliters (related to SI cubic meters).", "properties": {"description": "Tools and apparatus used in scientific laboratories for experiments and measurements.", "contextual_relevance": "Designed and calibrated for use with standardized units, predominantly SI or metric units, to ensure accuracy and reproducibility of measurements."}}

{"explanation": "Laboratory safety involves procedures and precautions to prevent accidents and ensure a safe working environment. This includes proper handling of chemicals, use of safety equipment, and understanding hazard symbols, often involving quantities expressed in SI units (e.g., concentration limits in ppm, volumes of reagents).", "urdu_meaning": "تجربہ گاہی حفاظت - حادثات سے بچنے کے لیے طریقہ کار اور احتیاطی تدابیر", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Understanding exposure limits for chemicals, often given in SI-derived units like mg/m³ or ppm, is crucial for laboratory safety.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Practices and protocols designed to minimize risks and hazards in a laboratory setting.", "related_concepts": ["hazards", "personal protective equipment (PPE)", "chemical handling", "waste disposal", "emergency procedures", "safety data sheets (SDS)"], "real_world_example": "Wearing safety goggles and gloves when handling corrosive chemicals."}}

{"explanation": "Local measurement systems are traditional or non-standardized units of measurement used within specific regions or for particular purposes, which can lead to confusion and errors if not converted to a universal system like SI for scientific communication.", "urdu_meaning": "مقامی پیمائشی نظام - مخصوص علاقوں یا مقاصد کے لیے استعمال ہونے والی غیر معیاری اکائیاں", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "While some local measurement systems persist for convenience in certain trades, scientific research overwhelmingly uses the SI system for clarity and universality.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Measurement units specific to a particular culture, region, or trade, not part of a global standard like SI.", "related_concepts": ["measurement systems", "si system", "us customary units", "convenience", "unit conversion error", "standardization"], "real_world_example": "Using 'pounds' and 'feet' in the US (US customary units) vs. kilograms and meters in the SI system."}}

{"explanation": "Manufacturers of chemicals, equipment, and products often rely on standardized measurement systems like SI units for quality control, product specifications, and international trade to ensure consistency and avoid errors.", "urdu_meaning": "صنعت کار / بنانے والے - مصنوعات تیار کرنے والے افراد یا کمپنیاں", "term_type": "other", "example_sentence": "Chemical manufacturers provide product specifications that list concentrations and quantities using SI units or clearly convertible units.", "properties": {"description": "Entities (individuals or companies) that produce goods.", "contextual_relevance": "Depend on standardized measurements (often SI units) for production processes, quality control, and international commerce to ensure product consistency and interoperability."}}

{"explanation": "Masses refer to the amounts of matter in objects or samples, with the SI base unit being the kilogram (kg). Grams (g) are also commonly used in chemistry.", "urdu_meaning": "کمیتیں - اشیاء یا نمونوں میں مادے کی مقداریں", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "In stoichiometric calculations, the masses of reactants and products are often interconverted with moles using molar masses.", "properties": {"describes": "Plural of mass, a fundamental property of matter.", "related_concepts": ["mass (singular)", "kilogram", "grams", "mole", "molar mass", "density", "si base units"], "example_of_use": "Precisely measuring the masses of reactants is crucial for determining reaction yields.", "measurement_type": "Kilograms (kg), grams (g), milligrams (mg)."}}

{"explanation": "Measurement systems are standardized collections of units used to quantify physical properties. The SI system is the most widely adopted international measurement system in science and technology.", "urdu_meaning": "پیمائشی نظام - جسمانی خصوصیات کی مقدار بندی کے لیے اکائیوں کا مجموعہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Different measurement systems, like the SI system and US customary units, use different base units for quantities like length and mass.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A set of units of measurement and rules relating them to each other.", "related_concepts": ["si system", "metric system", "us customary units", "local measurement systems", "units of measurement", "standardization", "convenience"], "real_world_example": "The International System of Units (SI); the Imperial system."}}

{"explanation": "Measurement uncertainty is a parameter associated with the result of a measurement that characterizes the dispersion of the values that could reasonably be attributed to the measurand. It is inherent in all measurements.", "urdu_meaning": "پیمائشی غیر یقینی - پیمائش کے نتیجے سے وابستہ قدروں کے پھیلاؤ کی خصوصیت", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Reporting experimental results with their associated measurement uncertainty is crucial for assessing the reliability of the data.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A quantitative indication of the doubt about the result of a measurement.", "related_concepts": ["accuracy", "precision", "error", "significant figures", "standard deviation", "calibration"], "real_world_example": "A length measurement reported as 10.5 ± 0.1 cm, where ±0.1 cm is the uncertainty."}}

{"explanation": "The metre (m) is the SI base unit of length, defined as the length of the path travelled by light in vacuum during a time interval of 1/299,792,458 of a second.", "urdu_meaning": "میٹر - لمبائی کی ایس آئی بنیادی اکائی", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "The dimensions of a reaction vessel might be measured in centimetres or metres.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Length", "symbol_if_any": "m", "system": "SI base unit"}}

{"explanation": "The metric system is a decimal-based system of measurement, which formed the basis for the modern SI system. It uses units like meter (length), gram/kilogram (mass), and liter (volume), with prefixes indicating multiples of 10.", "urdu_meaning": "میٹرک نظام - اعشاریہ پر مبنی پیمائشی نظام", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The convenience of the metric system lies in its decimal-based prefixes, making unit conversions straightforward.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A system of measurement based on the meter for length, kilogram for mass, and second for time, using decimal multiples and submultiples.", "related_concepts": ["si system", "decimal-based", "si prefixes", "metre", "kilogram", "liter", "grams", "units of measurement"], "real_world_example": "Used in most countries for everyday and scientific measurements."}}

{"explanation": "Metric units are units of measurement belonging to the metric system (and by extension, the SI system), such as meter, kilogram, second, liter, gram, Celsius, characterized by decimal-based prefixes.", "urdu_meaning": "میٹرک اکائیاں - میٹرک نظام کی پیمائشی اکائیاں", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Scientists predominantly use metric units for consistency and ease of conversion in their experiments and calculations.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Units within the metric system of measurement.", "related_concepts": ["metric system", "si units", "metre", "kilogram", "second", "liter", "gram", "celsius", "si prefixes"], "real_world_example": "Milliliters (mL) for volume, centimeters (cm) for length, milligrams (mg) for mass."}}

{"explanation": "Micromoles per liter (μmol/L or μM) is a unit of molar concentration, representing 10⁻⁶ moles of solute per liter of solution. It is used for expressing very low concentrations, e.g., of pollutants or biochemical substances.", "urdu_meaning": "مائیکرو مول فی لیٹر - ارتکاز کی اکائی (μmol/L)", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "The concentration of certain trace elements in blood plasma is often measured in micromoles per liter.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Molar concentration", "symbol_if_any": "μmol/L or μM", "system": "Derived from SI units (mole and liter, which is dm³)"}}

{"explanation": "Milli- (symbol m) is an SI prefix representing a factor of one-thousandth (10⁻³). For example, one millimeter (mm) is 0.001 meters, and one milligram (mg) is 0.001 grams.", "urdu_meaning": "ملی- - ایک ہزارویں حصے کا سابقہ (10⁻³)", "term_type": "prefix", "example_sentence": "A common laboratory measurement for small volumes is the milliliter (mL), where 'milli-' indicates one-thousandth of a liter.", "properties": {"represents_factor": 10⁻³ (one thousandth)""

{"explanation": "mol/L (moles per liter), also denoted as M (molar), is a common unit for molar concentration, representing the amount of substance (in moles) of a solute per liter of solution. It is an SI-derived unit (as L = dm³).", "urdu_meaning": "مول فی لیٹر - مولر ارتکاز کی اکائی", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "A 1 mol/L solution of HCl contains one mole of HCl dissolved in enough water to make one liter of solution.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Molar concentration", "symbol_if_any": "mol/L or M", "system": "Derived from SI units (mole and liter/dm³)"}}

{"explanation": "The mole (mol) is the SI base unit for amount of substance. It is defined as containing exactly 6.02214076 × 10²³ elementary entities (e.g., atoms, molecules), which is Avogadro's number.", "urdu_meaning": "مول - مادے کی مقدار کی ایس آئی بنیادی اکائی", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "Chemists use the mole to relate macroscopic measurements (like mass in grams) to the number of atoms or molecules involved in a reaction.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Amount of substance", "symbol_if_any": "mol", "system": "SI base unit"}}

{"explanation": "Molecules are electrically neutral groups of two or more atoms held together by chemical bonds. The amount of substance (in moles) can refer to a specific number of molecules.", "urdu_meaning": "مالیکیول - دو یا زیادہ ایٹموں کا کیمیائی بندھن سے جڑا مجموعہ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "One mole of water contains Avogadro's number of H₂O molecules.", "properties": {"key_principle": "An electrically neutral entity consisting of more than one atom (same or different) held together by chemical bonds.", "related_concepts": ["atoms", "mole", "amount of substance", "chemical bonds", "compounds"], "real_world_example": "A molecule of oxygen (O₂); a molecule of glucose (C₆H₁₂O₆)."}}

{"explanation": "Moles (mol) are the SI base units for amount of substance, crucial for quantitative chemistry, stoichiometry, and expressing concentrations (e.g., moles per liter).", "urdu_meaning": "مول (جمع) - مادے کی مقدار کی اکائیاں", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "Chemical equations are balanced in terms of moles of reactants and products.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Amount of substance", "symbol_if_any": "mol", "system": "SI base unit"}}

{"explanation": "Moles per liter (mol/L or M), also known as molarity, is a common unit of concentration representing the amount of solute in moles dissolved in one liter of solution. It's an SI-derived unit.", "urdu_meaning": "مول فی لیٹر - مولر ارتکاز کی اکائی", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "A solution with a concentration of 0.5 moles per liter of NaCl contains 0.5 moles of NaCl in every liter of the solution.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Molar concentration", "symbol_if_any": "mol/L or M", "system": "Derived from SI units (mole and liter/dm³)"}}

{"explanation": "Nano- (symbol n) is an SI prefix representing a factor of one billionth (10⁻⁹). For example, one nanometer (nm) is 10⁻⁹ meters, and one nanomole (nmol) is 10⁻⁹ moles.", "urdu_meaning": "نینو- - ایک اربویں حصے کا سابقہ (10⁻⁹)", "term_type": "prefix", "example_sentence": "Nanotechnology deals with materials and structures at the nanometer scale, where 'nano-' signifies 10⁻⁹.", "properties": {"represents_factor": 10⁻⁹ (one billionth)""

{"explanation": "The newton (N) is the SI derived unit of force, defined as the force required to accelerate a mass of one kilogram by one meter per second squared (1 N = 1 kg·m/s²).", "urdu_meaning": "نیوٹن - قوت کی ایس آئی اکائی", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "Pressure is force per unit area, and can be expressed in newtons per square metre (pascals).", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Force", "symbol_if_any": "N", "system": "SI derived unit (kg·m/s²)"}}

{"explanation": "Newtons (N) are the SI units for measuring force. Pressure is often defined in terms of newtons per square metre.", "urdu_meaning": "نیوٹن (جمع) - قوت کی اکائیاں", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "The weight of an object is a force measured in newtons.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Force", "symbol_if_any": "N", "system": "SI derived unit"}}

{"explanation": "Parts per billion (ppb) is a unit of concentration representing one part of a substance per billion parts of the total mixture (e.g., 1 μg per kg, or 1 nL per L). It is used for extremely low concentrations, such as of trace pollutants.", "urdu_meaning": "حصے فی ارب (پی پی بی) - ارتکاز کی ایک اکائی (بہت کم مقدار کے لیے)", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "The concentration of some highly toxic pollutants in drinking water is regulated at parts per billion levels.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Concentration (dimensionless ratio, or mass/mass, volume/volume, mass/volume)", "symbol_if_any": "ppb", "system": "Ratio (10⁻⁹)"}}

{"explanation": "Parts per million (ppm) is a unit of concentration representing one part of a substance per million parts of the total mixture (e.g., 1 mg per kg, or 1 μL per L). It is often used for dilute solutions or concentrations of gases in air.", "urdu_meaning": "حصے فی ملین (پی پی ایم) - ارتکاز کی ایک اکائی", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "The concentration of carbon monoxide in polluted air might be reported in parts per million (ppm).", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Concentration (dimensionless ratio, or mass/mass, volume/volume, mass/volume)", "symbol_if_any": "ppm", "system": "Ratio (10⁻⁶)"}}

{"explanation": "The pascal (Pa) is the SI derived unit of pressure, defined as one newton of force per square metre (1 Pa = 1 N/m² = 1 kg·m⁻¹·s⁻²).", "urdu_meaning": "پاسکل - دباؤ کی ایس آئی اکائی", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "Atmospheric pressure is approximately 101,325 pascals (or 101.325 kPa) at sea level.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Pressure, stress", "symbol_if_any": "Pa", "system": "SI derived unit (N/m² or kg·m⁻¹·s⁻²)"}}

{"explanation": "Pascals (Pa) are the SI units for measuring pressure or stress. Gas pressures in chemical experiments are often measured or calculated in pascals or kilopascals.", "urdu_meaning": "پاسکل (جمع) - دباؤ کی اکائیاں", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "The partial pressures of gases in a mixture can be expressed in pascals.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Pressure, stress", "symbol_if_any": "Pa", "system": "SI derived unit"}}

{"explanation": "Percentage error is a measure of the discrepancy between an experimental or measured value and a true or accepted value, expressed as a percentage of the accepted value. It quantifies measurement accuracy.", "urdu_meaning": "فیصد غلطی - تجرباتی اور حقیقی قدر کے درمیان فرق کا فیصد", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "A small percentage error in a chemical analysis indicates high accuracy of the measurement technique.", "properties": {"key_principle": "((|Measured Value - Accepted Value|) / Accepted Value) * 100%.", "related_concepts": ["accuracy", "precision", "error", "measurement uncertainty", "experimental results", "true value"], "real_world_example": "If a student measures the boiling point of water as 98°C (accepted value 100°C), the percentage error is 2%.", "measurement_type": "Percentage (%)."}}

{"explanation": "The periodic table lists elements with their atomic masses, which are used with the mole concept (SI unit) for chemical calculations involving masses and amounts of substance.", "urdu_meaning": "دوری جدول - عناصر کی ترتیب، کیمیائی حسابات میں استعمال", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Chemists use atomic masses from the periodic table to convert between grams (mass) and moles (amount of substance) of an element.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A tabular arrangement of chemical elements ordered by atomic number, electron configuration, and recurring chemical properties.", "related_concepts": ["element", "atoms", "atomic mass", "mole", "chemical calculations"], "real_world_example": "Finding the molar mass of CO₂ by summing atomic masses of C and O from the periodic table."}}

{"explanation": "A physical reference object was historically used to define some base units, like the international prototype kilogram (a specific platinum-iridium cylinder). Modern SI definitions are increasingly based on fundamental constants rather than physical objects.", "urdu_meaning": "طبیعی حوالہ جاتی شے - بنیادی اکائیوں کی تعریف کے لیے تاریخی طور پر استعمال ہونے والی شے", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Until 2019, the kilogram was defined by a physical reference object, the International Prototype Kilogram, stored in France.", "properties": {"key_principle": "A tangible artifact used as the standard for defining a unit of measurement (largely historical for SI base units).", "related_concepts": ["definition (of units)", "si base units", "kilogram", "metre (historical)", "standardization", "fundamental constants"], "real_world_example": "The former platinum-iridium bar that defined the meter."}}

{"explanation": "Pollutant concentrations measure the amount of a pollutant in a given volume or mass of air, water, or soil, often expressed in SI-derived units like μg/m³, mol/L, ppm, or ppb.", "urdu_meaning": "آلودگی پھیلانے والے مادوں کا ارتکاز - ماحول میں آلودگی کی مقدار", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "Environmental scientists monitor pollutant concentrations to assess air and water quality, using units like parts per billion for trace contaminants.", "properties": {"describes": "The amount of a pollutant present in a specific quantity of an environmental medium.", "related_concepts": ["concentration", "pollutants", "environmental chemistry", "ppm", "ppb", "micromoles per liter", "si units", "air quality", "water quality"], "example_of_use": "The pollutant concentration of sulfur dioxide in urban air exceeded the safety limit.", "measurement_type": "µg/m³, mg/L, ppm, ppb, mol/L."}}

{"explanation": "Powers of 10 (e.g., 10³, 10⁻⁶) are fundamental to the decimal-based SI system, allowing easy scaling of units using prefixes like kilo- (10³) or micro- (10⁻⁶).", "urdu_meaning": "دس کی طاقتیں - ایس آئی نظام میں اکائیوں کی اسکیلنگ میں استعمال", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "The SI system uses prefixes that represent powers of 10, making conversions between units like meters and kilometers very straightforward.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Exponential notation where 10 is the base raised to an integer exponent, used for scaling in the metric/SI system.", "related_concepts": ["decimal-based", "si system", "metric system", "si prefixes", "scientific notation", "unit conversion"], "real_world_example": "1 kilometer = 10³ meters; 1 nanometer = 10⁻⁹ meters."}}

{"explanation": "ppb stands for parts per billion, a unit of concentration (1 part in 10⁹ parts) used for very dilute solutions or trace amounts of substances, such as environmental pollutants.", "urdu_meaning": "پی پی بی - حصے فی ارب، ارتکاز کی اکائی", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "The level of mercury in some fish might be measured in ppb.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Concentration", "symbol_if_any": "ppb", "system": "Ratio (10⁻⁹)"}}

{"explanation": "ppm stands for parts per million, a unit of concentration (1 part in 10⁶ parts) used for dilute solutions or trace amounts, like pollutant concentrations in air or water.", "urdu_meaning": "پی پی ایم - حصے فی ملین، ارتکاز کی اکائی", "term_type": "unit", "example_sentence": "Atmospheric carbon dioxide concentration is often expressed in ppm.", "properties": {"measures_quantity": "Concentration", "symbol_if_any": "ppm", "system": "Ratio (10⁻⁶)"}}

{"explanation": "A precision ruler is a measuring instrument for length, marked with fine divisions (e.g., millimeters or smaller fractions of an inch) to allow for precise measurements. Scientific rulers are typically calibrated in SI units (cm, mm).", "urdu_meaning": "صحیح پیمائش والا رولر - لمبائی کی درست پیمائش کا آلہ", "term_type": "other", "example_sentence": "Chemists might use a precision ruler to measure the dimensions of a crystal or the distance traveled by a substance in chromatography, often in metric units.", "properties": {"description": "A ruler designed for accurate length measurements with fine gradations.", "contextual_relevance": "Used for making length measurements, ideally calibrated in SI units (meters, centimeters, millimeters) for scientific work."}}

{"explanation": "Prefixes (SI prefixes) are used in the SI system to form decimal multiples and submultiples of units by factors of powers of 10 (e.g., kilo- for 10³, milli- for 10⁻³, nano- for 10⁻⁹).", "urdu_meaning": "سابقے - ایس آئی اکائیوں کے اعشاری حصوں یا ضربوں کی نشاندہی کرنے والے الفاظ", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "SI prefixes like 'kilo-', 'milli-', and 'micro-' allow for convenient expression of very large or very small quantities.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Modifiers attached to unit names to indicate multiples or fractions of the unit, based on powers of ten.", "related_concepts": ["si prefixes (more specific)", "si system", "metric system", "decimal-based", "powers of 10", "kilo-", "milli-", "nano-", "unit conversion"], "real_world_example": "Kilogram (1000 grams), millimeter (0.001 meters)."}}

{"explanation": "Pressure is defined as force exerted per unit area. The SI derived unit for pressure is the pascal (Pa), equal to one newton per square metre (N/m²).", "urdu_meaning": "دباؤ - فی اکائی رقبہ پر لگنے والی قوت", "term_type": "property", "example_sentence": "The pressure of a gas is an important parameter in chemical reactions involving gases and is often measured in pascals or kilopascals.", "properties": {"describes": "Force applied perpendicular to the surface of an object per unit area over which that force is distributed.", "related_concepts": ["force", "area", "pascal", "newton", "derived units", "gas laws", "atmospheric pressure", "si units"], "example_of_use": "Standard atmospheric pressure is about 101.325 kPa.", "measurement_type": "Pascals (Pa), atmospheres (atm), millimeters of mercury (mmHg), bars."}}

{"explanation": "A reaction (chemical reaction) is a process of chemical transformation. Quantifying reactants and products in a reaction often involves SI units like moles and grams.", "urdu_meaning": "تعامل / ردعمل - کیمیائی تبدیلی کا عمل", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "The stoichiometry of a chemical reaction is best understood using moles (SI unit for amount of substance).", "properties": {"key_principle": "A process that involves rearrangement of the molecular or ionic structure of a substance.", "related_concepts": ["chemical reactions (plural)", "chemical equations", "reactants", "products", "reaction outcomes", "yields", "mole"], "real_world_example": "The rusting of iron is a slow chemical reaction."}}

{"explanation": "Reaction outcomes refer to the products formed and their quantities (yields) resulting from a chemical reaction. These are determined experimentally using precise measurements (often in SI units) and predicted using stoichiometry.", "urdu_meaning": "تعامل کے نتائج - کیمیائی ردعمل سے بننے والی مصنوعات اور ان کی مقداریں", "term_type": "concept", "example_sentence": "Careful measurement of reactant masses in grams and conversion to moles helps predict reaction outcomes accurately.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The results of a chemical reaction, including the identity and amounts of products formed.", "related_concepts": ["chemical reactions", "products", "yields", "stoichiometry", "chemical calculations", "mole", "limiting reactant"], "real_world_example": "Determining that a reaction produced 5.0 grams of product with a theoretical yield of 6.0 grams."}}

{"explanation": "A reaction vessel is a container in which chemical reactions are carried out, such as a beaker, flask, or industrial reactor. Its volume might be measured in SI-derived units like liters (dm³) or milliliters (cm³).", "urdu_meaning": "تعامل کا برتن - وہ برتن جس میں کیمیائی تعاملات کیے جاتے ہیں", "term_type": "other", "example_sentence": "The reactants were mixed in a 250 mL reaction vessel and heated to 50 degrees Celsius.", "properties": {"description": "A container used to conduct chemical reactions.", "contextual_relevance": "Its volume (measured in units like L, mL, related to m³) and ability to withstand temperature (Celsius/Kelvin) and pressure (Pascals) are important considerations."}}

{"explanation": "Reactions (chemical reactions) are processes where substances transform into new substances. The study and quantification of reactions heavily rely on SI units for amounts, masses, volumes, and energy changes.", "urdu_meaning": "تعاملات / ردعمل (جمع) - کیمیائی تبدیلی کے عوامل", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Thermodynamic calculations for chemical reactions often use energy values in joules (SI unit) per mole.", "properties": {"key_principle": "Processes involving the breaking and forming of chemical bonds, leading to new chemical species.", "related_concepts": ["reaction (singular)", "chemical equations", "reactants", "products", "si units", "mole", "joule", "stoichiometry"], "real_world_example": "Acid-base reactions, redox reactions, combustion reactions."}}

{"explanation": "Scientific measurement is the process of obtaining quantitative information about physical properties using standardized instruments and units, with the SI system being the global standard in science.", "urdu_meaning": "سائنسی پیمائش - معیاری آلات اور اکائیوں کا استعمال کرتے ہوئے مقداری معلومات حاصل کرنا", "term_type": "process", "example_sentence": "Accuracy and precision are crucial aspects of scientific measurement, facilitated by the use of well-defined SI units.", "properties": {"key_principle": "The determination of the size or amount of something using appropriate instruments and standardized units.", "related_concepts": ["si system", "units of measurement", "accuracy", "precision", "measurement uncertainty", "laboratory equipment", "experiments"], "real_world_example": "Measuring the mass of a sample using an analytical balance calibrated in grams."}}

{"explanation": "SI base units are the seven fundamental units of the International System of Units (SI) from which all other SI units are derived.
